recordTypes.name: Planning Application
recordTypes.description: Apply for all Planning permits here.

recordTypes.name: Solar Permit
recordTypes.description: Solar permits for commercial, ground mount system, solar integrated roofs, homeowner projects without the use of a contractor, systems exceeding 38.4 kilowatts, energy storage system only projects, or any other solar system project that does not meet the SolarApp+ Requirements.

recordTypes.name: Re-Roofing - Express Permit
recordTypes.description: Express permits for all re-roof projects.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
Use this permit for all Residential Permits, including but not limited to New Construction and Additions of Single Family Dwellings, Manufactured Homes, ADU’s, JADU’s Duplexes, Townhouses three stories or less. Converting Structures to Habitable Space and other Accessory Structures related to residential properties.
Sheds, Metal Buildings and Garages need to be applied for under Accessory Structure permit unless you are combining the permit with a Residential House or Manufactured Home permit.

recordTypes.name: Code Complaint Form
recordTypes.description: Encountering a problem or facing a potential code enforcement matter within the unincorporated areas of the County? Utilize our user-friendly online platform to submit a request for Code Enforcement staff to investigate. Code Enforcement staff thoroughly investigates all submissions, prioritizing them based on the severity of health and safety risks.

recordTypes.name: Alteration - Residential and Commercial Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this permit for all Residential and Commercial Alterations for Siding, Windows, Home Hardening, Exclusive Remodels, Deck Repairs (not deck replacements), Foundation Installations , Retrofit Foundations (433A), Kitchen and Bathroom Remodels.

recordTypes.name: Electrical - Express Permit
recordTypes.description: Residential only Express Permit for Electrical main service replacement (200 amp max), sub-panel replacement, or whole home rewire.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing - Express Permit
recordTypes.description: Residential and Commercial Express permits for plumbing repairs, fire sprinkler systems and water heater installations/replacements.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this permit for all Commercial and Multi-Family Structures, including but not limited to, cannabis facilities temporary shipping containers, greenhouses, businesses, offices and cell towers (and cell tower modifications).

recordTypes.name: Accessory Structure Permit
recordTypes.description: Permits are required for construction of uninhabitable accessory structures including but not limited to accessory storage units (over 120 square feet), awnings, carports, decks, equipment buildings, outdoor kitchens, greenhouses (not for cannabis), patio covers, pool cabanas, retaining walls, storage sheds (over 120 square feet), storage tanks, swim spas, swimming pools and spas, portable spas, swimming pool repairs, docks.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Building permits for the demolition of a building, structure or portion of a structure, including pools.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: Electrical permits for stand alone electrical work including but not limited to relocations, outlets, lighting, receptacles, new home runs (circuits), switches, fire alarm systems, smoke alarm systems, security alarm systems, electric services (over 200amps) and EV charging stations.

recordTypes.name: Generator Permit
recordTypes.description: Mechanical permits for stand-alone mechanical work including but not limited to relocations and new installations. Minor electrical and plumbing work supporting the equipment only is permitted and will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical - Express Permit
recordTypes.description: Express permits for HVAC, Mini-Splits, Fireplaces, Water Heaters, Furnaces and Wall Heaters.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: Mechanical permits for Commercial Vent Hoods and Residential Gas and Electric Vent Hoods with and without Stoves and Propone Tanks.

recordTypes.name: SolarAPP+ Solar Permit
recordTypes.description: Expedited solar permitting for residential installations is available through the SolarAPP+ program. A SolarAPP+ Approval Document is required in order to obtain a permit of this type. If you don't hold one already, you can learn how to get one at solarapp.nrel.gov

Welcome to the County of Lake Community Development Departments Surplus Property page.

The Community Development Department offers surplus property for sale to the public, providing an o

recordTypes.name: Open Flame Cooking Permit - Annual
recordTypes.description: The Open Flame Cooking Permit is required for any exterior cooking operation or event booth with an open flame or cooking utilizing flammable gas. The permit applies to private and public events that serve food to the general public. This permit is valid for 365 days.

recordTypes.name: Tent Permit
recordTypes.description: The Tent Permit is required for any tent or canopy in excess of 400 square feet. The permit applies to private and public events that serve the general public.

recordTypes.name: Fire Construction Permit
recordTypes.description: A property owner or owner’s representative who intends to conduct an operation or business, installing or modifying systems and equipment regulated by the California Fire Code shall first submit plans for review and approval to obtain the required permit. The goal of Fire Construction Permits is to protect people and their environments from the destructive effects of fire and smoke.

recordTypes.name: Annual Industrial Health and Safety Permit
recordTypes.description:
The Benicia City Council adopted the Industrial Health and Safety Ordinance (Benicia Municipal Code Chapter 8.55) on April 1, 2025 with the intention to strengthen industrial safety, air quality monitoring, public awareness, emergency response coordination, regulatory enforcement, and interagency collaboration including timely communication and incident reporting.

A Benicia facility that uses or houses hazardous material in excess of maximum allowable quantities defined by California Fire Code Tables 307.1(1) and 307.1(2) must apply for this permit annually by July 1 of each year.

recordTypes.name: Express Permit - Building
recordTypes.description: Residential only express permits for non-structural bathroom & kitchen remodel, siding & stucco replacement (no overlays allowed), retrofit window replacement with no framing changes

recordTypes.name: Addressing Request
recordTypes.description: Apply here for address assignments for new structures including ADU's, vacant lots, newly created lots, stand-alone utility meters, and address modification requests.

recordTypes.name: Encroachment Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for requesting an encroachment permit that authorizes the permittee to perform work, construct approved facilities, conducts specified activities, Parklet/Streetery/Sidewalk Table Dining  or temporary storage within the public right of way, public easements, or City property.

recordTypes.name: Universal Planning Application
recordTypes.description: Applications for design review, use permits, variances, and tentative subdivisions maps.

recordTypes.name: Fire Flow Test Request
recordTypes.description: This application is for requesting a fire flow test for the purposes of determining water availability for the design of fire sprinkler systems, domestic water systems, or other construction needs.

recordTypes.name: Express Permit - Electric
recordTypes.description: Residential only Express permits for electrical main service or sub-panel replacement (same location only)

recordTypes.name: Express Permit - Mechanical
recordTypes.description: Residential only Express permits for furnace & heat pump replacements in the same location only; new installation of air conditioning units/condensers only; and duct replacements.

recordTypes.name: Historical Design Review Exemption
recordTypes.description: Some projects in the historic districts may be eligible for exemptions to design review. Please contact planning staff at planning@ci.benicia.ca.us to confirm if your project qualifies.

recordTypes.name: Open Flame Cooking Permit - Single Day
recordTypes.description: The Open Flame Cooking Permit is required for any exterior cooking operation or event booth with an open flame or cooking utilizing flammable gas. The permit applies to private and public events that serve food to the general public. This permit is for one day.

recordTypes.name: Sidewalk Table Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is required for the use of sidewalk tables, where appropriate, at eating and drinking establishments in the downtown area. (Sidewalk Table Policy, Res. No. 19-32)

recordTypes.name: Express Permit - Plumbing
recordTypes.description: Residential Only Express Permits:  Sewer lateral & water line replacements, water heater replacement (same location only)

recordTypes.name: Express Permit - Roofing
recordTypes.description: Residential only Express permits for re-roof projects (multiple layers of torch down or shingles do not qualify for an express roofing permit)

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Map Submission
recordTypes.description: Submit a parcel map or final map to the Engineering division following submittal of an application to Planning and approval at a public hearing.

recordTypes.name: Pre-Application
recordTypes.description: Informational meeting with multiple City departments for preliminary direction on a project. No formal action is taken.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Construction Hydrant Meter Permit
recordTypes.description:
This application is for requesting a temporary construction hydrant meter.  

For all other requests related to existing services, please contact Utility Billing at (707) 746-4225.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Required for businesses prior to installing or modifying signs.

recordTypes.name: SolarAPP+ Solar Permit
recordTypes.description: Expedited solar permitting for residential installations is available through the SolarAPP+ program. A SolarAPP+ Approval Document is required in order to obtain a permit of this type. If you don't hold one already, you can learn how to get one at solarapp.nrel.gov

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Accessory Structures
recordTypes.description: Permits are required for construction of uninhabitable accessory structures including but not limited to accessory storage units, awnings, carports, cell site modifications, cell site (new construction), decks, equipment buildings, garages, outdoor kitchens, patio covers, pool cabanas, retaining walls, storage sheds, storage tanks, swim spas, swimming pools and spas, portable spas, swimming pool repairs.

recordTypes.name: Tree Permit
recordTypes.description:
As described in the Tree & Street Trees Ordinance, Section 12.24 of the Benicia Municipal Code, a permit is
required when altering or trimming a tree that is classified as a street tree, heritage tree or designated
protected tree. A permit is not required to trim branches on said trees that are less than 3 inches in
diameter. Tree Trimming Permits are valid for 6-months from the date issued.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Use Permit
recordTypes.description: Short-term Use Permit for activities which may be seasonal in nature, or which are tied to specific events in the community.

recordTypes.name: Transportation Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is for requesting a transportation permit for "extralegal" loads as defined by the California Vehicle Code.

recordTypes.name: Short-Term Rental License Application
recordTypes.description: Application for a license to operate a Short-Term rental from a host’s primary residence.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Alteration and Repairs
recordTypes.description: Building permits for alterations including but not limited to equipment installation, facade improvements, fire damage repairs, maintenance repairs, non-residential re-roofs, residential reroofs w/overlay, storage racks, tenant improvements, water damage, window replacements.  JUNIOR ACCESSORY DWELLING UNITS ARE NOT PERMITTED UNDER THIS TYPE, PLEASE USE ‘NEW CONSTRUCTION’.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Demolition
recordTypes.description: Building permits for the demolition of a building, structure or portion of a structure, including pools.

recordTypes.name: Exception to Zoning Criteria
recordTypes.description: Select zoning criteria may be modified with an application to the Community Development Director.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter Request
recordTypes.description: Formal inquiry into a property’s zoning and development standards, on a form provided by the applicant.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - New Construction
recordTypes.description: Building permits for all types of new construction for residential, commercial, and industrial buildings including but not limited to, accessory dwelling units (ADU), junior accessory dwelling units (JADU), apartment buildings, single family homes, additions and mezzanine additions, mixed uses, and multi-family.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Energy Improvements
recordTypes.description: Building permits for energy improvement permits for electric vehicle (EV) charging outlets, EV charging stations, energy storage systems, commercial/industrial photovoltaic systems, and thermal systems.  This category does not include residential photovoltaic rooftop systems.  Those are required to be permitted via the SolarAPP+ Solar Permit type, until deemed unqualified by SolarAPP+.

recordTypes.name: Report a Code Compliance Violation
recordTypes.description: For code enforcement cases, report any properties that may have violations from the zoning code, home rule regulations, or nuisance violations.

recordTypes.name: Preliminary Housing Application
recordTypes.description: Application for an expedited review of new housing developments pursuant to SB330.

recordTypes.name: SB-35 Development Application
recordTypes.description: Streamlined application for qualifying multi-family housing developments. Projects must comply with objective planning standards and specific affordability requirements.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: Mechanical permits for stand-alone mechanical work including but not limited to relocations and new installations. Minor electrical and plumbing work supporting the equipment only is permitted and will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: Electrical permits for stand alone electrical work including but not limited to relocations, service and subpanels, outlets, lighting, receptacles, new home runs (circuits), and switches.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: Plumbing permits for stand-alone plumbing work including but not limited to relocations, new installations. Minor electrical work supporting the equipment only is permitted and will be reviewed on a case-by-case basis.

recordTypes.name: Pre-Approved ADU Program (PADU)
recordTypes.description: Design professionals submit your plans for pre-approved accessory dwelling units (ADU) per Assembly Bill 1332.

recordTypes.name: Special Inspection and Testing Agencies Recognized List
recordTypes.description: To enroll in the City of Benicia's Recognized Special Inspection and Testing Agencies list and to renew enrollment eligiblity

recordTypes.name: Grading Permit
recordTypes.description:
GRADING FOR PRIVATE DEVELOPMENT ONLY:  

This application is required for any grading/construction project that will cause erosion or sediment onto adjacent property or on public streets, obstruct or otherwise interfere with drainage, deposit sediment in natural or artificial drainage facilities, or alter drainage facilities or courses.

Grading projects in the public right-of-way will be handled under a Public Works permit.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Reactivation Request
recordTypes.description: Reactivation request for expired building permits

recordTypes.name: Request for Copies of Official Plans
recordTypes.description: California law provides certain limited protections for building owners and for the certified, licensed, or registered professionals who prepared the official plans for those buildings regarding duplication of official plans on file with the City of Benicia Community Development Department. In this application you will find attached forms that must be completed before the City can duplicate protected official plans that are on file. Also attached is the applicable state law regarding duplication of official plans.

recordTypes.description: Upon PW/Engineering review and approval, application fee of $300/residential unit will be required.

recordTypes.description: For NEW applications of New Canaan food service establishments or for renovations of existing food service establishments. No food service establishment can remodel without health department approval and then building permit.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Building Permit Project Application is for when you intend to construct, enlarge, or alter a residential property including but not limited to finishing a basement, attic, adding a bathroom, converting a room to a bedroom, installing a pool, adding or converting a garage. adding an accessory building, or enlarging a deck.

recordTypes.name: Floodplain Management Application
recordTypes.description: Floodplain Management Application-required for activities within a FEMA floodplain

recordTypes.name: Application for Septic Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Application for septic plan review. Plan must be prepared by a CT licensed septic installer or a CT licensed professional engineer. Submit a copy of the installer or engineers license in addition to the approved proposed plan.

recordTypes.name: Building Application Revision Form
recordTypes.description: Application for revision to existing Open Building Permit

recordTypes.name: Sign and/or Awning Permit Application
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for any signs or awning installed as stand alone or mounted to buildings.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description:
Use this permit for: Temporary Service, Generator, Electric Service new or upgrade, and all other electrical permit applications.   

Use this permit when tagging on building project

recordTypes.name: Application for Soil Testing
recordTypes.description: Application for septic soil testing with the New Canaan Health Department. Fee is per lot tested. Minimum of 4 deep test holes greater than 5ft deep is required (2 in proposed area and 2 holes down gradient). This is NOT for Wetlands soil testing. Please contact Inland Wetlands for Wetlands soil testing.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Pool permit for condo & club public pools
recordTypes.description: Annual commercial pool application for public pools. This annual permit with the health department pertains to only commercial pools such as private clubs, town owned pools, and condo pools. This annual pool permit application is NOT for residential pools. To apply for a residential pool permit please contact the Building department.

recordTypes.name: Fire Protection Permit
recordTypes.description: Fire Protection permit for any of the following:  Hood system, Fire Alarm and Smoke Detection System, or Automatic Sprinkler or Fire Extinguishing System

recordTypes.description:
Application for a stand alone zoning permit. THIS IS NOT REQUIRED IN ADDITION TO A BUILDING PERMIT APPLICATION

YOUR PERMIT CAN BE FOUND IN THE ATTACHMENT SECTION AFTER APPROVAL

recordTypes.description: Application process for hair, nail, barber, waxing, eyebrows and associated esthetician services as defined in CT General Statutes and New Canaan town ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Appeal Form
recordTypes.description: Appeal to be heard before the Zoning Board of Appeals

recordTypes.description: Proposed floor plan Health Department application submission for a new cosmetology/salon or to renovate an existing salon. Please complete the application and provide floor plans, licenses, & equipment specification sheets in the attachments.

recordTypes.name: Generator and/or Fuel Tank LOCATION Form
recordTypes.description:
Use this permit for the location of GENERATOR AND/OR TANK LOCATION only.

Once the location has been approved you will be notified.  You then can proceed with the other necessary permits.

recordTypes.description: Permit application form to request sewer lateral disconnection. Note that minimum 24-hrs notification needed for Sewer Department scheduling.

recordTypes.description: For annual licensure of New Canaan food service establishments

recordTypes.name: General Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
This Permit will be used for small projects consisting of bathrooms, kitchens and other interior non structural projects that do not require extensive review. No change in room designation or room count Structural changes are limited to one beam with accompanying posts and Engineered stamped drawings. Exterior work is limited to siding, direct window replacement and deck replacement of EXACT SIZE AND STAIR LOCATION.

 GENERATORS, FUEL TANKS AND SOLAR ARE TO BE ON THEIR OWN INDIVIDUAL PERMIT APPLICATIONS!

No Basements and Attics. Please use Building Permit Project

HVAC Permit
recordTypes.description:
Use this permit application for all HVAC work.

Use this permit when tagging on building project

recordTypes.name: Sign Site Plan Application
recordTypes.description: Any proposed sign(s) not meeting the specifications of New Canaan's Planning and Zoning Regulations may be approved by the Commission by Site Plan Approval.

recordTypes.name: Site Plan Application
recordTypes.description: Site Plan Application to be heard before the Planning and Zoning Commission.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Service Application
recordTypes.description: All vendors serving food and beverages to the public on a temporary basis are required to have a food service approval.  The fee for a food service booth at a Temporary Event (including at a Farmer’s Market) is $75.  There is no fee for food service establishments already licensed and inspected by the New Canaan Health Department.

recordTypes.name: Low Voltage Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description:
Use this permit for all low voltage wiring including alarm systems and audio visual 

Use this permit when tagging on building project

recordTypes.name: Itinerant Food Service Establishment License Application
recordTypes.description: This application is for Itinerant Food Establishment Vendors.  This application is only meant for mobile food establishments that can be moved.  This application only allows you to operate on private property with the owner's permission or on public property with written permission from the Town of New Canaan.  This permit does not allow you to vend on public streets.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description:
For any and all Plumbing work.

Use this permit when tagging on building project

recordTypes.name: Special Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Special Permit Application to be heard before the Planning and Zoning Commission.

recordTypes.name: TRUCK LICENSE (SEPTIC & REFUSE)
recordTypes.description: All septic pump trucks and refuse hauler trucks that operate in the town of New Canaan MUST obtain a yearly truck license from the New Canaan Health Department. The fee is $100 PER TRUCK

recordTypes.name: Roof Permit
recordTypes.description: Used when re-roofing or roof repair

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Application
recordTypes.description: Subdivision or Resubdivision Application submitted to the Planning & Zoning Commission

recordTypes.name: Text Amendment Application
recordTypes.description: Text Amendment Application to be heard before the Planning and Zoning Commission.

recordTypes.name: Solar Permit
recordTypes.description: Solar installation. Used whether Commercial or Residential

recordTypes.description: Application for permit to construct a new septic system or repair an existing septic system.

recordTypes.name: Dumpster Application
recordTypes.description:
For on public street parking ONLY. 

Not needed if located on private property.

recordTypes.name: Water Treatment Wastewater Disposal System
recordTypes.description: Permit to install a Water Treatment Wastewater Disposal System (water from a water softener, etc). Proposed plan must be submitted with the permit application which includes soil test data and calculations of the amount of GPD of discharge from the water treatment device.

recordTypes.name: Well Abandonment Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application for well abandonment permit. Fee is $100 per well to be abandoned. State Verification of abandonment is required in order to close the open permit. Please submit the state form to the New Canaan Health Department upon completion of abandonment so we can close the open permit.

recordTypes.name: Well Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application for permit to locate and drill a new well. Please note it is $150 fee PER WELL-this includes Geothermal wells.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
This application is designated for residential and commercial demolition projects.
Interior Demo is also included in this permit.

If you are simply resurfacing an existing paved driveway with no increase in impervious area then a driveway permit is NOT required. recordTypes.name: Affordable Housing Redevelopment Loan Program
recordTypes.description: The Affordable Housing Redevelopment Loan Program provides funding through a variety of loan products such as bridge loans, loan guarantees, and low-interest or forgivable loans to support affordable housing development in the South St. Petersburg CRA.

recordTypes.name: 2026 Community Food Grant Program
recordTypes.description: The Community Food Grant Program is a competitive grant program that aims improve health equity for all residents in St. Petersburg by funding local non-profit agencies who will implement projects that align with the Healthy Food Action Plan (HFAP) Areas of Focus and strategies.

recordTypes.name: Homeowner Retroactive Rebate Form
recordTypes.description: This form for the Private Lateral Rehabilitation Rebate Program is for those property owners who may be eligible for a retroactive rebate.

recordTypes.description: THIS IS A TEST APPLICATION

recordTypes.name: 2. Homeowner Verification of Inspection Results and Recommended Rehabilitation Method Form
recordTypes.description: Please do not submit until you receive an approval letter from the City. This is the second form of the Private Lateral Rehabilitation Rebate Program for property owners to submit inspection results.

recordTypes.name: 3. Homeowner Closeout Form
recordTypes.description: Please do not submit until you receive an approval letter from the City. This is the third and last form of the Private Lateral Rehabilitation Rebate Program.

recordTypes.name: Rebates for Affordable Residential Rehabilitation
recordTypes.description:
Eligible homeowners in St. Pete can apply for funding to make specific building improvements to their residential properties, including:
•Structural repairs
•Roof replacement
•Electric/plumbing upgrades
•Window/door replacement
•HVAC replacement
•Insulation upgrades
•Kitchen/bath upgrades
•Constructing an accessory dwelling unit (ADU) 

Funding is provided in the form of a rebate of up to 40% for the pre-approved construction value. Funds can be used to cover part of the actual cost of materials, labor, and reasonable profit and overhead. Funding may be provided for single-family or multi-family residential properties and must meet qualifications for affordable housing.

Fire Prevention Permit  - Aerial Fireworks Display - (NFPA 1123)
recordTypes.description: Required permit for flame effect display and/or show. Subject to NFPA 1123 - Includes permit, permit review, and inspection when set-up. If necessary hourly fire-watch and stand-by fees are in addition and are charged 1 hour prior to shoot time, until 1 hour after shoot ends, with a four hour minimum. Applications must be submitted 30 days prior to the shoot or an after-hour plans review fee will be charged.

recordTypes.name: Building-Contractor Registration
recordTypes.description: If this is your first-time doing work within the City of Apopka, then you need to use this application to register with us.

recordTypes.description: Irrigation Inspection's are only to be done on Friday.

recordTypes.name: Addressing Request
recordTypes.description: Application of new subdivisions/development projects that need addresses

recordTypes.name: Annexation Application
recordTypes.description: Annexation Definition: Annexation is the adding of land to the boundaries of the City of Apopka. Such a land addition makes the land in every way a part of the City.

Fire Prevention Permit - Consumer Sparkler - Retail Sales
recordTypes.description:
Required permit for any person , persons, or businesses who wish to sell sparklers within the City of Apopka either at a temporary seasonal location, or a fixed retail store. Applications must be submitted 21 days prior to the sales starting date or an
Expedited Plans Review fee of $227.00 will be charged.

recordTypes.description: Visit our Grease Management Page at www.Apopka.gov/Grease to view Ordinance 2933 in Municode or by visiting www.Apopka.gov/Code

recordTypes.name: Fire Prevention Permit - Flame Effect - Before a proximate audience (NFPA 160)
recordTypes.description: Required permit for flame effect display and/or show. Subject to NFPA 160 - Includes permit, permit review, and inspection when set-up. If necessary hourly fire-watch and stand-by fees are in addition and are charged 1 hour prior to display time, until 1 hour after display ends, with a four hour minimum. Applications must be submitted 30 days prior to the shoot or an after-hour plans review fee will be charged.

recordTypes.name: Business Tax Receipt Application
recordTypes.description: Welcome to OpenGov! Please complete this application to apply for a Business Tax Receipt with the City of Apopka. If you have any questions, you can send us a message directly through your OpenGov account or email us at btreceipts@apopka.net. We're here to help!

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Service Permit and Inspection (Fire Prevention Permit)
recordTypes.description:
This permit is needed for food establishments that are self-propelled or otherwise moveable from
place to place such as a truck, trailer, or similar self-propelled conveyance or non-permanent kiosk or table
where pre-packaged food products are sold.

recordTypes.name: Building-Private Provider Notice to Building Official
recordTypes.description: Private providers must be registered with the City of Apopka prior to being added to permit applications. 35% reduction if both services are used. 20% reduction for either Plan Review or Inspections.

recordTypes.name: Fire Prevention Permit - Open Flame Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is needed for open fires to include, camp fires, bonfire, and ceremonial fires.

recordTypes.name: CSP Application
recordTypes.description:
Minor Development Plan Definition:

All development that is not subject to major development plan approval shall receive approval of a minor development plan prior to the issuance of building permit.

Developments of below 25 residential dwelling units;
Development of below 25,000 square feet of nonresidential floor area; and
Development of a mixed-use project with less than 25 residential dwelling units and/or less than 25,000 square feet of floor area.

recordTypes.name: FLU (Future Land Use) Amendment
recordTypes.description: This is the Comprehensive Plan Amendment application (Future Land Use Amendment) to change the land use of a property or multiple properties.

recordTypes.name: Fire Prevention Permit - Pyrotechnics - Before a proximate audience (NFPA 1126)
recordTypes.description: Required permit for pyrotechnic display and/or show. Subject to NFPA 1126 - Includes permit, permit review, and inspection when set-up. If necessary hourly fire-watch and stand-by fees are in addition and are charged 1 hour prior to display time, until 1 hour after display ends, with a four hour minimum. Applications must be submitted 30 days prior to the shoot or an after-hour plans review fee will be charged.

recordTypes.name: Fire Prevention Permit- Restricted Access Gate/Fence Installation Review and Inspection
recordTypes.description: This permit is needed for a location with restricted access with a Gate/Fence. This is for the review and inspection. There is a separate permit for annual renewals.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building  Permit
recordTypes.description: Apartments/Tenant Improvements/Warehouses/Hangars/ Grease Traps

recordTypes.name: Fire Prevention Permit - Special Events Indoor/Outdoor Permit
recordTypes.description:
If it is a large event expecting 1,000 or more attendees per day, regardless of location in the City of Apopka (public or private property), a "Special Event Permit" is required. 
Examples: Festivals, Concerts, Fairs, Circuses, Large Community Events

recordTypes.name: FLU Amendment/Rezoning Application
recordTypes.description: This is an application if an applicant wants a Future Land Use application and Rezoning Application running concurrently for the same property/properties.

recordTypes.name: MDP Application
recordTypes.description:
Major Development Plan Definition: 

The following developments listed below shall receive major development plan approval prior to the issuance of a building permit:

Developments of 25 or more residential dwelling units;
Development of 25,000 square feet or more of nonresidential floor area; and
Development of a mixed-use project with more than 25 residential dwelling units and/or more than 25,000 square feet of floor area.
Developments determined by the Director to have a potentially significant impact on the need for public facilities, or on environmentally sensitive lands.

recordTypes.name: Fire  Permit
recordTypes.description: This form is for the Apopka Fire Department.

recordTypes.name: Fence Permit - Residential/Commercial
recordTypes.description:
Land Development Code Section 5.5 establishes standards for the location, height, and appearance of fences and walls in the City, and ensure the safety, security, and privacy of properties.

Pool fences are subject to the standards of the Florida Building Code.

recordTypes.name: Roof Permit
recordTypes.description: On Residential re-roofs by a licensed contractor we will only do a final inspection with affidavits. Owner-Builder will need a dry-in inspection and a final inspection.

recordTypes.name: Fire Training Event Permit
recordTypes.description:
A completed Apopka Fire Department Fire Training Event Permit application is required for all events being hosted with the City of Apopka Fire Department. All events may be subject to review by our Development Review Committee for approval. The City of Apopka has the exclusive right to permit or deny an individual or organization facility use. 

Once we have the completed application, we will schedule for review and approval. Please note this may take time, as we suggest that all applications submitted at least 60 to 90 prior to the event.

recordTypes.name: Planned Development/Master Plan Application
recordTypes.description:
Planned Development Definition: 

A type of zoning district map amendment involving the classification of land to special type of zoning district designed to accommodate generally larger-scale development that is planned and developed as an integral unit in accordance with a PD Plan and PD Agreement, with flexible development standards that illustrate and address land uses, circulation, utilities, parking, setbacks, densities and intensities, land coverage, landscaping and buffers, open space, building form and design, and similar features of the project.

recordTypes.name: Plat Application
recordTypes.description:
Plat Definition:

A map or delineated representation of the subdivision of lands, being a complete exact representation of the subdivision and of other information in compliance with the requirement of all applicable provisions in the LDC and the City Code of Ordinances.

Important Notice: Note the $5,000 Pass Through Fee should be characterized as a deposit. $1600 fee for initial plat review, hourly rate for subsequent re-reviews.

recordTypes.name: Rezoning Application
recordTypes.description: This is an application for rezoning a property or multiple properties.

recordTypes.name: Single Family Residence  Permit  (NEW HOUSE CONSTRUCTION ONLY)
recordTypes.description: ONLY for Single Family Homes

recordTypes.name: Special Exception Use Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
Special Exception Permit Definition:  

A use, designated as a special exception in Table 4.2.2.C: Principal Use Table, that may be appropriate in a particular zoning district, but because of its nature, extent, and external effects, requires special standards and special consideration of its location, design, and methods of operation before it is allowed in the district.

recordTypes.name: Vacation of ROW or Easement Application
recordTypes.description:
Vacation Definition:

The complete or partial abandonment or termination of the public right to use a street, highway, or public service easement.

recordTypes.name: Variance Application
recordTypes.description:
Variances Definition: 

Variances allow Applicants to have their proposals considered in a different light than what would be prescribed by zoning ordinances.

recordTypes.name: Waiver of Fees for Not for Profit Organizations and Churches
Sub-Contractor Permits (ANY & ALL FIRE RELATED WORK WILL NEED TO APPLY USING A  FIRE PERMIT)
recordTypes.description:
All sub-subcontractors associated with new homes, townhouses, commercial jobs. Plus mechanical change-outs, plumbing re-pipes, electrical panel change-outs.
ANY FIRE RELATED WORK TO APPLY USING THE FIRE PERMIT

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter
recordTypes.description: A Zoning Verification Letter is a document provided by the City to verify the current zoning of a particular piece of property, and the types of uses that are allowed in that zoning district.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool-Master File Permit
recordTypes.description: To be used by pool companies who would like to have their plans master filed.

recordTypes.description: Vacation rental registration is required for all zones in the City of Cocoa Beach.

recordTypes.name: BTR - Vacation Rental Business Tax Application
BTR - Commercial Business Tax Receipt & Certificate of Use Application
recordTypes.description: Please upload any State Business Licenses and/or Articles of Incorporation. Florida law requires all business which are State Regulated to provide a current copy of the State license before the Local Business Tax Receipt will be issued or renewed. This includes the Florida Department of Business and Professional Regulations, Department of Health, Department of Hotels & Restaurants, Department of Finance, Professional Engineers, Brevard County Certificate of Competency, and the Division of Real Estate.

recordTypes.description: Application for an Administrative Waiver review

recordTypes.name: P&Z - Change of Use Application
recordTypes.description: Application for Change of Use

recordTypes.name: P&Z - Painted Wall Sign Authorization
recordTypes.description: The Painted Sign Authorization is only available for painted wall signs, and is subject to zoning approval for size and location.  A standard sign permit may be required after review.

recordTypes.name: P&Z - Planned Development (PD) Master Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Application for consideration of a PD Master Plan for a large scale project.

recordTypes.name: DUNE - Dune Permitting Authorization/Protocol
recordTypes.description: Application for Dune Trimming/Restoration

recordTypes.name: P&Z - Right of Way and Easement Vacation
recordTypes.description: A right of way vacation application is required for any request for the city to vacate or dispose of public property, which includes any public road, public street, public alley, or other public right of way.  Approval shall be by ordinance and a unanimous vote of the city commission is required for approval of such action.

recordTypes.name: P&Z - Site Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: Site plan submittal is required for all commercial and residential development or redevelopment and all site improvements or building additions which impact the site infrastructure, parking, stormwater, and landscaping see details.

recordTypes.name: P&Z - Special Exception Request Application
recordTypes.description: Application for a Special Exception from the Board of Adjustment

recordTypes.name: P&Z - Tree Removal Authorization
recordTypes.description: Application to remove trees when not part of a site plan review process

recordTypes.name: P&Z - Variance Request Application
recordTypes.description: Application for a Variance from the Board of Adjustment

recordTypes.name: P&Z - Variance (Density above 10/28 units per acre)
recordTypes.description: Application for a Variance from the City Commission

recordTypes.name: P&Z - Variance (Building Height above 45 feet)
recordTypes.description: Application for a Variance from the City Commission

Cocoa Beach Leisure Services provides several locations for rental for your special event. We strive to provide excellent customer service by overseeing the outdoor special event permitting process and assisting you through your planning process.

Parking Permits

2026 Parking Permits

Parking permits for 2026 will be available for purchase starting Monday, December 1, 2025.

recordTypes.name: Plot Plan Request
recordTypes.description: Request a plot plan for a property located within Town Limits

recordTypes.name: Event on Town Property Application
recordTypes.description:
The Events on Town Property Application Form is required for any special event held on Town property. A special event is defined as a group activity which may require additional Town resources and/or staff, as well as a designated facility, space or other amenities requested of the Town.

Typically, this would be a large-scale event open to the public and located on Town property such as a park or Town Hall. It does not include casual park use by visitors or individual rentals of park shelters, Bundy Lodge or Eaton Hall.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Map Amendment (PCMA)
recordTypes.description: A Rezone application is needed when seeking to change the zoning classification of a property. The Advisory Plan Commission (APC) will provide a recommendation to Town Council, who then determines if the rezoning should be approved or denied. A Letter of Intent should be provided that details how the project meets the criteria considered for a rezone, as noted in Article 9 of the Unified Development Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Zoning Map Amendment (PCCZ)
recordTypes.description: A Conditional Rezone application is needed when seeking to change the zoning classification of a property that is currently outside the corporate limits of the Town of Brownsburg and is filed with a petition for annexation. The zoning, if approved, goes in to effect upon completion of the annexation.

recordTypes.name: Primary Plat (PCPP)
recordTypes.description: A Primary Plat is required for the subdivision and platting of land. A Primary Plat shall be prepared in conjunction with any proposal to subdivide or plat property within the jurisdictional area of the Plan Commission. This record type is also used for Planned Development Detailed Site Plans.

recordTypes.name: One & Two Family Residential (RESD) Permit
recordTypes.description: Residential new structures, additions, remodel.

recordTypes.name: Commercial/Industrial (COMM) Permit
recordTypes.description: Commercial new structures, additions, remodels.

recordTypes.name: Secondary Plat (CPSP)
recordTypes.description: A Secondary Plat is required for the subdivision and platting of land.  Secondary Plats need to be recorded at the Hendricks County Recorder’s Office.  Residential subdivisions should submit construction plans with the Secondary Plat. This record type is also used for Planned District Final Site Plans.

recordTypes.name: Development Plan Review (PSDP)
recordTypes.description: A Development Plan Review is required for the development of structures other than single-family dwellings. Please be prepared to submit the landscape plan, lighting plan, and architectural details as separate documents for review.

recordTypes.name: Report a Code Issue
recordTypes.description: Use this form to submit suspected code violations for Development Services Staff to document and review for compliance with Town Codes and Ordinances.

recordTypes.name: Hood System (HOOD) Permit
recordTypes.description: Installation or modification of exhaust hood systems.

recordTypes.name: Multi-Family Residential (MULT) Permit
recordTypes.description: New structure

recordTypes.name: Replat and Amendments (PCRP)
recordTypes.description: This case type is utilized for replats of recorded Final Plats and Primary Plat Amendments (major and minor).

recordTypes.name: Plat Vacation (PCVA)
recordTypes.description: A Plat Vacation is required to remove parts or all of approved and recorded plats.

recordTypes.name: Utility Connection Request (UTCR)
recordTypes.description: This utility connection request is for properties wishing to connect to Town of Brownsburg utilities that are outside of town limits.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Structure (ASTR) Permit
recordTypes.description: Sheds, pergolas, patios, decks, driveway, detached structures, etc.

recordTypes.name: Electrical (ELEC) Permit
recordTypes.description: Panel and service replacement, sub-panel, solar panels, stationary generators, electric vehicle supply equipment, etc.

recordTypes.name: Commitment Amendment (PCCA)
recordTypes.description: A Commitment Amendment application is needed when seeking to change either the developer or rezone commitments. If the commitments were recorded as part of a rezone, the APC will make a positive, negative, or no recommendation to the Town Council for final determination. Commitments related to all other types of cases are approved or denied at the Advisory Plan Commission.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Property Line Adjustments (APLA)
recordTypes.description: This case type is utilized for simple administrative property line adjustments such as the merging of commonly owned lots, splitting lots and merging the pieces with adjacent lots, adjusting lot lines between properties, and creating non-developable land for utilities and infrastructure.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Text Amendment (PCZT)
recordTypes.description: A Zoning Text Amendment application is needed when seeking to change the underlying zoning text of either the UDO or other Zoning Document. The Advisory Plan Commission (APC) will provide a recommendation to Town Council, who then determines if the Text Amendment should be approved or denied.

recordTypes.name: Variance - Development Standards (BZDV)
recordTypes.description: The Board of Zoning Appeals hears requests for relief from the Development Standards of the Unified Development Ordinance. These are generally standards found in Article 2 or Article 5 of the UDO.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way (RIOW) Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit required for work in right-of-way.

recordTypes.name: Variance - Use (BZUV)
recordTypes.description: The Board of Zoning Appeals hears requests to establish a use on a property that is not allowed under Permitted or Special Exception Uses in Article 2 for the property's zone.

recordTypes.name: Special Exception Use (BZSE)
recordTypes.description: The Board of Zoning Appeals may consider an appeal of any decision, interpretation, or determination made by the Director, or any other administrative official or board charged with the duty of enforcing and interpreting the UDO.

recordTypes.name: Utility (UTIL) Permit
recordTypes.description: Sewer laterals, water meters, sump pump drainage line, etc.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Use (TEMP) Permit
recordTypes.description: Temporary structures such as construction trailers, model homes, tents, etc.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Appeal (BZAA)
recordTypes.description: The Board of Zoning Appeals may consider an appeal of any decision, interpretation, or determination made by the Director, or any other administrative official or board charged with the duty of enforcing and interpreting the UDO.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Certification Letter (PCZL)
recordTypes.description: A Zoning Certification Letter is researched, reviewed and authored by one of the Town Planners.  All information contained in a Zoning Certification Letter shall be used as an official record of Zoning Status as of the date of the letter.

recordTypes.name: Erosion Control/Stormwater (ECSW)
recordTypes.description: This record type is used for projects such as stockpiling dirt or other site alterations that only require stormwater review. Projects completing this permit process may store dirt on future development sites but may not begin work on building pads, ponds, or the like until the project has been reviewed under its proper route (Development Plan, for example).

recordTypes.name: Bond (BOND) Record
recordTypes.description: Subdivision Bonds and Blanket Bonds are submitted through this record type.

categories.name: Permitting and Inspection Services
categories.content:
Permitting & Inspections

Permits are an important part of every project to make sure that the work completed is safe and compliant with local zoning regulations and building codes. Make sure that you or your contractor have the appropriate permits in place before you begin your project.

Water and Sewer connections that are not associated with a Building permit.  
 New Water Meter required not associated with a Building permit.

recordTypes.name: Life Safety Inspection
recordTypes.description: The Life Safety Code and Inspection addresses the construction, protection, and occupancy features necessary to minimize the danger to life from the effects of fire, including smoke, heat and toxic gases created during fire.

recordTypes.name: Residential Model Request for Production Number
Building Permit Application - New Residential Dwelling
recordTypes.description: Application for single family homes, townhouses, duplexes, condominium units, and apartment units.

recordTypes.name: Historic Preservation Commission Application
recordTypes.description:
Exterior rehabilitation work, additions, new constructions, and site modifications require HPC approval
and a building/zoning permit before starting work. The first step in this process is to submit an HPC
application to the Planning Department. Once HPC approval has been granted an applicant can obtain a building/zoning permit.

recordTypes.name: Code Violations
recordTypes.description: To report a  code complaint such as tall grass, trash, snow on sidewalks, etc. click select.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Dwelling Unit Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application for Accessory Dwelling Units.  See Section 802 of the City Charter and Code for the ADU Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Pre-application/Sketch plan
recordTypes.description: The pre-application/sketch plan review process outlined in Section 301 of the Land Management Code is required for certain types of development applications.  Please consult Section 301 prior to applying.

recordTypes.name: Dry Utility Work in City Row
recordTypes.description: This application requires an existing franchise agreement with the City of Frederick.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Application- Residential Alteration
recordTypes.description: Application for residential projects including, but not limited to: Garages, Pools, Hot Tubs, Additions, Interior and Exterior Renovations, Misc Renov like Re-roofing (when sheathing and/or framing is involved) and Solar Panels.

recordTypes.name: Commercial New Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: This application is intended for the construction of New Commercial Buildings.

recordTypes.name: Dry Utility Work in City ROW Permit Revision / Extension Request
recordTypes.description: Extend expired Dry Utility Permit 60 days

recordTypes.name: Commercial Alteration Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: This application is intended for the following projects on commercial properties, but not limited to: Additions, Remodels, Renovations.

recordTypes.name: Historic Preservation Commission Follow-Up Request (after Initial certificate issued)
recordTypes.description: This form is only to be used to request a Minor Modification, Extension, or Reconsideration. If you have any questions, please reach out to your case planner prior to making the request.

recordTypes.name: Historic Preservation Property Tax Credit Application
recordTypes.description: Tax Credits applications are due April 1st of each year. Submissions are encouraged before the due date; however, staff does not begin reviewing applications till January 1st.

recordTypes.name: Archeology Assessment Application
recordTypes.description: The Archeological Assessment process is required when subdividing property (except resubdivision of a residential lot into two) or when conducting ground disturbance on parcels containing known archeological sites, within a recognized historic district, or when the disturbance is 5,000 square feet or greater.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Accessory Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: For the installation of Solar Panels on an existing structure, Retaining Walls, Temp Trailers, Modifications to Existing Antennas/Telecommunication, Re-roofing (when sheathing and/or framing is involved), Gazebos, Pergolas, Pavilions etc. on commercial properties.

recordTypes.name: Archeology Assessment Application
recordTypes.description: The Archeological Assessment process is required when subdividing property (except resubdivision of a residential lot into two) or when conducting ground disturbance on parcels containing known archeological sites, within a recognized historic district, or when the disturbance is 5,000 square feet or greater.

recordTypes.name: Deck/Shed/Fence Permit Application
recordTypes.description: For Commercial construction of and repairs to Sheds and Fences, and Residential construction of and repairs to Decks/Porches, Sheds (Gazebos & Pergolas), and Fences.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application for the Installation or Replacement of Permanent or Temporary Signage.  Please note:  A separate Electrical permit must be submitted by the Electrical subcontractor for all Illuminated Signs.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application to Establish a Place of Business, Change of Business's Name, and Change of Ownership (if required by an outside agency).  No work is allowed under a Zoning permit.  If renovations are going to take place, a Commercial Alteration permit will be required.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Street / Lane / Sidewalk Closure Permit
HPC Zoning Permit Application
recordTypes.description: This record type is intended for properties within the Historic Overlay District that are applying for a Zoning Permit in regards to an HPC approval that doesn't require a Building permit.  Zoning permit examples include but are not limited to the following: window replacement, installation of new roofing material, mortar repair, etc.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Street / Lane / Sidewalk Closure Permit Extension Request
recordTypes.description: If your lane closure has been expired for more than 10 business days from the ending date, it is essential to submit a "NEW" lane closure

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit Application
recordTypes.description: For Commercial and Residential Electrical permits

recordTypes.name: Plumbing/Gas Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application made for Commercial or Residential Plumbing and/or Gas permits.

recordTypes.name: Residential Rental Licensing
recordTypes.description: A separate registration is required for each rental building.

recordTypes.name: Request Changes to an Existing License - Removal, Transfer or Update Information
Utility/Irrigation Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application for the installation of Irrigation systems, and Water, Sewer, or Storm mains on private property.

recordTypes.name: Fire Protection Systems Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application for but not limited to: Sprinkler Systems, Fire Alarms, Kitchen Hoods, and Smoke Control Devices.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application for the removal of Underground Tanks, Interior Demo or Full or Partial Building Demolition.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Application
recordTypes.description: This application will allow you to file the following requests to the Zoning Board of Appeals: Variance, Conditional Use, Changes to Nonconforming Uses, Temporary Uses, and to establish a Home Occupation/Home Based Business.

recordTypes.name: Vacant Property Registration
recordTypes.description: A separate registration application is required for each location.

recordTypes.name: Paving Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application for Residential paving only.

recordTypes.name: Vendor/Peddler License Application
recordTypes.description: Application to obtain a license to be a Vendor, Peddler, or Promoter/Sponsor of an event containing multiple vendors.

recordTypes.name: Appeals to Zoning Board of Appeals
recordTypes.description: The Zoning Board of Appeals may consider appeals of certain administrative decisions. * It is recommended that you discuss your application with staff from the Planning Department prior to filling. *

recordTypes.name: Sidewalk Cafe Application
recordTypes.description: Application for New and Renewals of Sidewalk Cafe's.   When a business wants to operate a Sidewalk Café with a surrounding enclosure within the City limits. Permit shall be issued on an annual basis expiring on 4/30.

recordTypes.name: Large/Non-Large Event On Private Property Application
recordTypes.description: Large and Non-Large Event Applications are for Events held on Private Property, outside in a parking lot, field, lawn, driveway, or like area which is not contained within a permanent improvement having a roof supported by enclosing walls, lattices, or other upright structural configuration.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Determination & Registration of Nonconforming Use
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request a written determination from the Zoning Administrator regarding a property's zoning, use, and development approvals or for a formal interpretation on the applicability of a provision of the Land Management Code (LMC).   This application may also be used to register a property with a Nonconforming Use.

recordTypes.name: Welding/Cutting Permit
recordTypes.description: All hot work in the Town of Needham requires a permit. In accordance with the Fire Code, plumbers and gas fitters do not need an additional hot work permit, but may require a detail. Hot work is defined as any activity that involves heat, spark, or flame that is capable of starting fires or explosions. Examples include, but are not limited to, welding, cutting, grinding, soldering, heat treating, hot riveting, torch applied roofing, abrasive blasting, and powder driven fasteners. When applying for a hot work permit, please ensure all operators working under the permit have completed the NFPA Hot Work Safety program or an equivalent found at the Massachusetts DFS website. Copies of all operators’ certificates are to be attached to the submittal. In addition, please attach a letter from the building owner giving permission to perform hot work at the location. Most hot work will require a fire detail.  Please note we require a minimum of 48 hours notice to secure a detail.  There is a 4 hour minimum for all details.  The fee is $55 an hour plus a 10% administrative fee.

recordTypes.name: Dumpster Permit
recordTypes.description:
Permits must be acquired by March 31st starting this year and must be renewed by this date in future years to stay in compliance with Article 8. 

We recommend that the applicant who creates an account on this permitting website provides a general purpose email that is unlikely to change, is monitored frequently and is accessible by the applicant and any other personnel responsible for permitting perpetually into the future. This will ensure that you receive consistent receipt of renewal reminders, communications and notifications even if personnel changes and reduces the chances of you being fined for allowing this permit to lapse. 

If you are unsure if you particular waste hauler is permitted with our office and/or do not know the permit number, you may contact our office for the current list of haulers along with their permit #'s or you can find a list of haulers permitted as of May 15, 2025 on our website: https://www.needhamma.gov/5645/Licensed-septic-installers-and-waste-hau.

If you are renewing your license, please check your account to see if your license is available for renewal. Do not submit a new application. See below for renewal instructions.

categories.name: Fire Department
categories.content: The Division of Fire Prevention within the Fall River Fire Department is dedicated to protecting the public by ensuring compliance with fire codes and enforcing Fire Prevention Laws and Codes. The Division's responsibilities include review of building plans for all life safety systems and inspecting/testing any installations, alterations, modifications, or repairs to fire alarms, sprinkler systems, or suppression systems.

recordTypes.name: Commons Use Permit
recordTypes.description:
Any festival, fundraiser, vehicle access or other event taking place on the Commons (and that is open to the public) requires a permit. For events, A certificate of liability insurance naming the City as "additionally insured" must be provided for events when over 50 people are expected to attend. This can all be uploaded as part of this application. There is a no application fee, however additional fees may also be charged depending on the request (i.e. electrical outlet usage, pavilion usage, vehicle access, etc.). 


For more information on Commons Permitting, please refer to: 
    http://www.cityofithaca.org/Commons.



For a map of Commons Amenities (including Electrical Bollards), please refer to:
    http://www.cityofithaca.org/DocumentCenter/View/4234

recordTypes.description: A short-term rental operating permit will be required to advertise a short-term rental located within the city.  Short-term rentals are permitted in single-family homes, two-family homes, and any owner-occupied unit.  A short-term rental operating permit will only be issued for a property that is the primary residence of the host.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Vending Permit
recordTypes.description: Food trucks, food trailers, and push carts operating on public property require a Mobile Vending Permit. A limited number of mobile vending locations are available on city streets and the Ithaca Commons. Mobile Vending Permits may be granted for any of the approved vending sites shown on the Mobile Vending Map and Ithaca Commons Amenities Map.

recordTypes.description: The Division of Charitable Gaming investigates, audits and monitors the sale of millions of bell jar tickets annually; verifies the lawful disbursement of bingo, bell jar, casino night, and raffle proceeds by authorized charitable organizations across New York State; licenses the manufacturers and distributors of bingo and games of chance equipment; and issues bingo and games of chance identification numbers to applicant organizations as a prerequisite to their licensing by municipalities.

A local government may have boards dedicated to finance, planning and zoning, health, or public works.

recordTypes.description: Instructions on how to check your SPAM filter and allow email through.

recordTypes.name: Noise Ordinance Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
The City of Ithaca Noise Ordinance requires that a Noise Permit be issued for the following conditions:

A: Where a sound source is planned, installed, or intended to be installed, or modified by any person in a manner that such source will create or is likely to create unreasonable noise or otherwise fail to comply with the provisions of the Ordinance.

B: Where any person uses or plans to use sound amplifying equipment in such a way that equipment is or will be heard outside of any building between 10:00 p.m. of any day and 7:30 a.m. of the next day.

C: Where any person uses or plans to use a public address system that will make sound outside of a building.

D: Noise Permit Applications shall be submitted at least 72 hours in advance of an event.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Appropriateness Review
recordTypes.description: Applications must be accompanied by thorough documentation of existing conditions and proposed changes, including (if applicable) photographs, site plans, sketches, material samples, historic photographs, etc.

recordTypes.name: Elevator Operating Permit - Ithaca Fire Department
recordTypes.description: An operating permit issued by the Chief of the Fire Department, or the Fire Marshal shall constitute permission to maintain, store or handle materials or to conduct processes and activities which produce conditions hazardous to life or property or to install equipment used in connection with such activities. Any person who proposes to undertake any new activity or to operate any type of new building listed in the City of Ithaca Municipal Code §181-9 shall be required to obtain an operating permit prior to commencing such activity or operation. Such permit shall not take the place of any license otherwise required by law. It is not transferable, and any change in the use or occupancy of premises shall require a new permit. The Fire Chief or the Fire Marshal shall, in his/her discretion, determine the appropriate duration of an issued permit.

recordTypes.name: Community Police Board - Compliment and Complaint Form
recordTypes.description:
Pursuant to the City Charter the Community Police Board (CPB) is charged by the City
of Ithaca to “act as a community liaison to the Police Department and . . . actively foster
positive communications between the police and all segments of the community.

recordTypes.name: Dog License
recordTypes.description: Pursuant to New York State Agriculture and Markets Law, all dogs in New York State are required to be licensed in the municipality in which the dog resides. Dog licenses are valid for 1 year.  However, dogs under 4 months of age do not need to be licensed until they are old enough to receive a rabies vaccination. Note: this form is for NEW dog licenses only. If you are trying to renew a license, please go to the current record (under "Completed" in your profile) and click the RENEW button.

recordTypes.name: Fire Protection System Installation/ Alteration Operating Permit Application
Public Assembly, Parade, or Motorcade Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Any parade, motorcade, or public gathering at any location within the City, in such numbers which, if not controlled or regulated, can reasonably be expected to interfere with the use of public property by others. A public gathering or assemblage of 50 or more persons shall constitute a presumption that such meeting will or can be expected to interfere with the use of public property by others. Applications must be submitted at least five business days before the assembly/parade/motorcade is scheduled to be held.

recordTypes.name: Request to Film on City Property
recordTypes.description:
Applications can be made to the Department of Public Works to obtain permission for film shoots on city property. Permission will be granted based upon the following requirements:
- Requests must be received at least 2 weeks in advance of the shoot date.
- A certificate of insurance naming the City of Ithaca must be submitted.
- Other requirements depending on the situation.

Final approval must be obtained at least 24 hours in advance of the film shoot!

recordTypes.name: Fireworks Operating Permit - Ithaca Fire Department
recordTypes.description: An operating permit issued by the Chief of the Fire Department, or the Fire Marshal shall constitute permission to maintain, store or handle materials or to conduct processes and activities which produce conditions hazardous to life or property or to install equipment used in connection with such activities. Any person who proposes to undertake any new activity or to operate any type of new building listed in the City of Ithaca Municipal Code §181-9 shall be required to obtain an operating permit prior to commencing such activity or operation. Such permit shall not take the place of any license otherwise required by law. It is not transferable, and any change in the use or occupancy of premises shall require a new permit. The Fire Chief or the Fire Marshal shall, in his/her discretion, determine the appropriate duration of an issued permit.

recordTypes.name: Dog Tag Replacement
recordTypes.description: Please use this form to replace a lost/stolen dog tag only. If you are also renewing your annual dog license, you may replace the tag as part of the renewal process.

recordTypes.name: Marriage One-Day Officiant License
recordTypes.description: New York now allows for people over the age of 18 to apply for 'one-day designation,' authorizing them to solemnize a single marriage on a specified day in the State of New York.   For more information, refer to https://www.nysenate.gov/legislation/laws/DOM/11-D.   Please note: We cannot guarantee that your application will be processed in less than 3 business days.

recordTypes.name: Hot Works Operating Permit - Ithaca Fire Department
recordTypes.description: An operating permit issued by the Chief of the Fire Department, or the Fire Marshal shall constitute permission to maintain, store or handle materials or to conduct processes and activities which produce conditions hazardous to life or property or to install equipment used in connection with such activities. Any person who proposes to undertake any new activity or to operate any type of new building listed in the City of Ithaca Municipal Code §181-9 shall be required to obtain an operating permit prior to commencing such activity or operation. Such permit shall not take the place of any license otherwise required by law. It is not transferable, and any change in the use or occupancy of premises shall require a new permit. The Fire Chief or the Fire Marshal shall, in his/her discretion, determine the appropriate duration of an issued permit.

recordTypes.name: Request to Use City Park
recordTypes.description:
Applications can be made to the Department of Public Works to Request the Use of a City Park other than Cass Park or Stewart Park. Permission will be granted based upon the following requirements:
- DeWitt Park is considered a "Quiet Use Park" and use of this park is based on separate criteria (i.e. whether there is a need for a noise permit or the size of the assembly, etc.).
- A certificate of insurance naming the City of Ithaca must be submitted.
- Other requirements depending on the situation.

Final approval must be obtained at least 24 hours in advance of event!

recordTypes.name: Special Event Permit Application - Phase 1
recordTypes.description: Any festival, parade, race, fundraiser, or other event taking place on public property and that is open to the public requires an Event Permit. There are up to three phases to the application process. Phase 1 requires you to provide basic information about your event. Certain events are eligible for approval after the successful submission of Phase 1 information. Other events will be invited to move on to Phase 2 where more detailed information is required. Large scale events and/or new events will be invited to Phase 3 which includes a meeting with the Special Event Team.

recordTypes.name: Parking Permits for People with Disabilities
recordTypes.description: The City Clerk's Office / Department of Public Information & Technology, issues New York State Parking Permits for People with Disabilities to City of Ithaca residents only. If you live outside of the city, you can obtain this permit from the clerk of the municipality you reside in.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Permit Application - Phase 2
recordTypes.description: This application is by Invitation Only.

recordTypes.name: Residential Parking Permit (RPP)
recordTypes.description: Your residential parking permit will be valid from the date it is issued until July 31. Permits for the following year are available for purchase on July 1. Permit fees are not pro-rated no matter when the permit is obtained. You are required to provide proof of residency in the form of a valid NYS driver's license, rental lease, utility bill or similar documentation that provides proof of address. A copy of your current vehicle registration is also required. Once we review your documentation, we will check permit availability for your residence. Permits are issued on a first-come first-served basis. You will be contacted if there are no permits available.

recordTypes.name: Use of Parks, Docks and Concessions
recordTypes.description: Annual licensing for Cass Park docks, Stewart Park boat rentals, and golf course concessions.

recordTypes.name: Outdoor Assembly Event Operating Permit Application
recordTypes.description: This application is for any event with 1000+ attendees.

recordTypes.name: Agent Registration Form
recordTypes.description: The City of Ithaca has recently transitioned to a new permitting and recordkeeping platform and is requesting that property owners verify their contact information to ensure accuracy as we transfer records to the new system. Please complete this voluntary survey to ensure that you AND your designated Property Agent are promptly notified of any issues relating to your property. Refer to Ithaca City Code § 210-81 for more information.

recordTypes.name: Air/Ground Source Heat Pump Permit
recordTypes.description: Select this procedure involving heat pump systems only, to apply for a permit to perform alterations on existing mechanical heating and/or cooling systems, including removal and replacement of an appliance, reconfiguration or extension of a system, or installation of an additional appliance, in both commercial and residential properties. Heat pump installations that are incorporated into larger projects shall be included in a Building Permit Application.

recordTypes.name: Residential Parking Visitor Pass
recordTypes.description: Residents in blocks participating in the Residential Parking Permit System may purchase up to 4 Visitor Passes per year with a limit of 8 passes per property in an R1 zone and 16 passes per property in an R2 zone. Visitor Passes shall be valid for a period of 2 consecutive weeks, and will be issued to a specific vehicle.

recordTypes.name: Recreational Bonfire Operating Permit - Ithaca Fire Department
