recordTypes.description:
If a Fence Permit Application is denied by Inspectional Services, a petitioner may appeal the denial decision to the Urban Design Commission (UDC). 

An application for a Fence Appeal MUST be rooted in specific conditions affecting the property which cause a hardship that warrants the granting of the proposed fence and/or fence exception. 

All fences altered, constructed, changed or erected in the City of Newton must comply with the requirements of the City’s Fence Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Fortune Teller's License
recordTypes.description: A fortune Teller license is required if telling fortunes for money. The Fortune Teller Licenses are issued to an individual for a particular location and only allow that individual to operate under the License for that particular location. If the person is telling fortunes at multiple locations within the City of Newton, that person must obtain a License for each location. If other individuals are telling fortunes at the same location, each individual must obtain their own License. Fortune Teller Licenses are not transferable.

recordTypes.name: Display Panels & Lights rentals
recordTypes.description:
The City has 40 art display panels available to rent. The panels are 37"w x 68"h (except three that are 30" x 68"). They can either lean against something singly, or stand on their own if rented as a pair. They have a black cloth surface that art or other materials can easily be pinned to. They are lightweight and can easily be transported in a large vehicle. Provided with the panels are strenghthener bars and velcro strips for attaching panels to each other. 

Also available for rental are 38 clip-on lights for mounting on the panels to light up the work being displayed.

recordTypes.name: Resident Extra Trash Cart Application
recordTypes.description: The purpose of this application is to apply for or renew a permit for an additional city-issued blue trash cart.

recordTypes.name: One Day Alcoholic Beverages and/or Entertainment License
recordTypes.description: Apply for a one-day alcohol and/or a one-day entertainment license here.  One-day alcohol licenses are required for the sale, delivery, and/or consumption of alcohol.  Please note that a person can only obtain a total of 30 one-day alcohol licenses per location in one calendar year.  You may use this application to apply for a license during consecutive days in the same location.

recordTypes.name: Historic District Application
recordTypes.description: The City of Newton’s Historic District Ordinance governs the all the local historic districts including the Newton Upper Falls Local Historic District, Chestnut Hill Local Historic District, Newtonville Local Historic District, and Auburndale Local Historic District. Each district has its own commission and application deadlines, but all subscribe to the same review process.

recordTypes.name: Inspection - Licensing of Health, Education, or Child Care Facilities
recordTypes.description: This Application is for Department of Public Heath Inspections for: Initial Licensure/ Licensure Renewal, Facility/Program Renovations, Nursing Home or Rest Home Quarterly Inspection (105 CMR 150.015(D))

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Roof & Siding Application
recordTypes.description:
The Building Permit - Roof & Siding is for residential and commercial projects. 

Please be sure to check the other building permit record types before selecting this one as some are separated from the full building permit. 

Each contractor submittal will require your license and insurance certificate to be attached.  If you have questions when completing the application please contact the office at 617-796-1060.

recordTypes.name: Facility License for Recombinant Deoxyribonucleic Acid (rDNA)
recordTypes.description: This license is required for any facility performing recombinant deoxyribonucleic acid (rDNA) work in the City of Newton. Institutional biosafety information, officers, training records, and insurance information is required for this application.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment Plan Review and Application
recordTypes.description: This application is necessary for any individual or corporation who is looking to open a food establishment in the City of Newton. This application asks for plans, general business information, staffing, equipment information, goods & services, food safety certifications, as well as the hours of operation. This includes restaurants, milk permits, as well as any special processes and variances.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Sheet Metal Application
recordTypes.description: This application is only for sheet metal work.  No other work allowed on this application.  Please use the Building Permit Application for all other work.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Fire Alarm Install or Modification [COMMERCIAL]
recordTypes.description: This permit is to be used to apply for the installation or modification of a fire alarm system in commercial buildings or residential buildings with seven (7) or more units.

recordTypes.name: Roadway Event Application
recordTypes.description: Please use this application to apply for a permit from the Department of Public Works (DPW) to do an event on the public way (i.e., public streets, public sidewalks, and municipal parking lots). The most common types of events requiring this permit are road races, walks, bicycle rides, and street closure events. Before applying for this permit, you must first apply for an Outdoor Special Event Application with the Parks, Recreation & Culture Department (PRC). Please note that applicants may have to pay for a Police Detail and/or for DPW Transportation Division labor costs for street barricades, depending on the specifics of your event.

recordTypes.name: Sandwich Board / Sign Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
An organization can place Sandwich Boards (aka A-Frame Signs) or Yard Signs in up to 5 specified locations, to notify the public of a community event, service, or announcement.

You must receive a permit from DPW for posting the Sandwich Boards/Signs, before they can be placed. Boards/Signs can be placed for up to 2 weeks. Applicants may apply for 2-week renewals, as needed.

You are responsible for the proper placement at the proper times, and for ensuring that the boards/signs remain intact after inclement weather. Boards/Signs must be removed within 48 hours of the approved end time or (if applicable) the community event being advertised.

recordTypes.name: Local Landmark Review Application
recordTypes.description: This application is required for any exterior alterations on properties that are designated Newton City Landmarks. Each individual Landmark has specific review guidelines, but approval from the Newton Historical Commission is required before any exterior work can begin.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Sign Application
recordTypes.description:
The Building Permit - Sign application is for residential and commercial projects.  

Please be sure to check the other building permit record types before selecting this one as some are separated from the full building permit.  

Each contractor submittal will require your license and insurance certificate to be attached.  If you have questions when completing the application please contact the office at 617-796-1060.

recordTypes.name: Food Permit Waiver for Afterschool Programs & Daycares
recordTypes.description: This food permit waiver is for any afterschool or daycare program not preparing or assembling food.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Fire Alarm Install or Modification [RESIDENTIAL]
recordTypes.description: This permit is to be used to apply for the installation or modification of a Fire Alarm system in a residence with 1-2 or 3-6 units.  If you are applying for a residential building with seven (7) or more units do not use this permit type.

recordTypes.name: Funeral Director License
recordTypes.description: This permit is for funeral directors who provide services for the deceased and their families. Members of this profession prepare the bodies of the deceased through embalming, arrange for crematory services, and provide services of assistance for family members of the deceased.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Swimming Pool Application
recordTypes.description:
The Building Permit - Swimming Pool application is for residential and commercial projects.  

Please be sure to check the other building permit record types before selecting this one as some are separated from the full building permit.  

Each contractor submittal will require your license and insurance certificate to be attached.  If you have questions when completing the application please contact the office at 617-796-1060.

recordTypes.name: Preservation Restriction Review Application
recordTypes.description: This application is required for any exterior alterations on properties in the City that have Preservation Restriction. The restriction for each property is different, and specifies what work may or may not be allowed, but approval from the Newton Historical Commission is required before any exterior work can begin.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Fire Alarm Repair / Replace [COMMERCIAL/RESIDENTIAL]
recordTypes.description: Use this application to repair or replace an existing fire alarm component without modifying its approved location or purpose.

recordTypes.name: Stormwater Inspection Submittal or Abatement Credit
recordTypes.description: Application Portal to allow Newton Residents to submit Annual Inspection Forms and apply for Stormwater Fee Abatement Credit for their property.

recordTypes.name: (SMCC) Stormwater Management Certificate of Compliance
recordTypes.description: Application process for obtaining a Stormwater Management Certificate of Compliance for the respective property. Applicants are required to submit a final as-built survey of the property, letter from the engineer, and an annual O&M plan for the on-site drainage systems. The Applicant must obtain proof of record at the Registry of Deeds for both the O&M plan and Certificate of Compliance before issuance of a Certificate of Occupancy.

recordTypes.name: Historical Review Application
recordTypes.description: The City of Newton's Demolition Delay Ordinance requires a Historical Review Application to be submitted for any project that proposes a total demolition, or a partial demolition that alters >50% of any one elevation. These projects will be reviewed by the Newton Historical Commission, and may be subject to a demolition delay. This application is also used for Waiver of Demolition Delay applications.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Blasting
recordTypes.description: To perform blasting at the address listed on the permit application. All applicable 527 CMR 1.00 Ch. 65 code, NFPA 495,  and the Newton. A Newton fire watch detail shall be required. Please use the Fire Watch Detail Request form to set up detail. Other requirements must meet with your application.  (See inside the application for details).

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Tent Application
recordTypes.description:
The Building Permit - Tent application is for residential and commercial projects.  

If you have questions when completing the application please contact the office at 617-796-1060.

recordTypes.name: Garbage & Offal Transport Permit
recordTypes.description: All corporations who remove or transport garbage, offal, or other offensive substances through the City of Newton. This includes garbage, grease, sewage, and recycling.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Fire Alarm Make Safe / Temporary / Demo [COMMERCIAL/RESIDENTIAL]
recordTypes.description: This form is to be used to apply for a temporary fire alarm, a make safe for construction, or demolition of an existing fire alarm system.

recordTypes.name: Keeping of Animals and Live Fowl License
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for anyone who keeps animals and/or live fowl on their property, including chickens and other livestock.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Windows/Doors Application
recordTypes.description:
The Building Permit  - Windows/Door application is for residential and commercial projects.  

Please be sure to check the other building permit record types before selecting this one as some are separated from the full building permit.  

Each contractor submittal will require your license and insurance certificate to be attached.  If you have questions when completing the application please contact the office at 617-796-1060.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Master Box Installation
recordTypes.description: Permit application to install a mechanical or digitized master box.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Plan Submittal
recordTypes.description: Please use this application when submitting a Subdivision Plan to the Engineering Department for review and approval by the Board of Survey.

recordTypes.name: Sign Review Application
recordTypes.description:
This is the initial review for a sign application. The Urban Design Commission must first issue a recommendation regarding the proposed sign before submitting to the Inspectional Services Department for a sign permit to do the installation.

All signs altered, constructed, changed or erected in the City of Newton must comply with the requirements of the Sign section of the City’s Zoning Ordinance. 

For the Sign Review Application to be accepted they must be complete. 

The Sign Permit must be signed by the Owner (or the Owner's legal representative) of the property on which the sign is to be erected. 

Inaccurate information may delay the review and issuance of a Sign Permit.

Please do not submit multiples of the same attachment.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Sprinkler COMMERCIAL Install / Modify
recordTypes.description: This permit is for Tier 2 Sprinkler installations or modifications of sprinkler systems in commercial buildings or residential buildings with more than seven (7) units. This permit application does not cover make safe or temporary sprinkler system installations or modifications. You will need to have your sprinkler license number in order to pull this permit.

recordTypes.name: Vendor Box Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Request a permit to place Vendor Boxes (also known as Newspaper Boxes) in the city on sidewalks in the City of Newton. The fee is $50 per box. Permit stickers must be placed on all of your permitted Vendor Boxes within the city.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Wireless Communications Application
recordTypes.description:
The Building Permit - Wireless Communications application is for residential and commercial projects.  

Please be sure to check the other building permit record types before selecting this one as some are separated from the full building permit.  

Each contractor submittal will require your license and insurance certificate to be attached.  If you have questions when completing the application please contact the office at 617-796-1060.

recordTypes.name: License to Manufacture Frozen Desserts and/or Ice Cream Mix
recordTypes.description: This application is necessary for any individual or corporation who is looking to manufacture frozen desserts and/or ice cream mix.

recordTypes.name: License to Operate a Tanning Facility
recordTypes.description: This license is relevant towards facilities that use any equipment used for tanning the skin that emits ultraviolet radiation, including, but not limited to, a tanning booth, tanning bed, or sunlamp which includes high pressure tanning lamps.

recordTypes.name: Building Temporary Certificate of Occupancy
recordTypes.description:
Temporary Certificate of Occupancy is used when a Final Certificate of Occupancy cannot be issued do to items not being completed on the project.  TCO's are issued at the rate of $50 per month or fraction there of per Unit.  Payment for TCO's are due when the Final Certificate of Occupancy is ready for issuance.

Applicant should speak with your Building Inspector to confirm a TCO is needed.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Sprinkler RESIDENTIAL (1-6 Unit) Install / Modify
recordTypes.description: This permit is for Tier 2 Sprinkler installations or modifications of sprinkler systems in residential buildings with less than seven (7) units. This permit application does not cover make safe or temporary sprinkler system installations or modifications. You will need to have your sprinkler license number in order to pull this permit.

recordTypes.name: Special Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
Special Permit applications for Major Projects are not accepted from May 20th to July 20th annually and after November 1st in odd years.  

A Special Permit isn’t actually a permit in the familiar sense, but permission to construct a building or establish a use that is not allowed by right. It usually consists of a set of plans that are accompanied by a list of findings and conditions for their approval. Special permits are generally  required for most multi-family housing and larger commercial projects. They often are required when special site characteristics or design features warrant a deviation from the zoning standards for a typical lot. Common requests for exceptions to these standards include variations in building height, setbacks, floor area ratios (FARs), and the number of parking spaces provided. Sometimes a proposed use has unique characteristics that warrant special review to make sure it will be compatible with other uses nearby.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Sprinkler Repair/Replace [COMMERCIAL / RESIDENTIAL]
recordTypes.description: Fire Department permit for repairing or replacing an existing system without changing the system design in a Residential / Commercial property. You will need to have your sprinkler license number in order to pull this permit.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Permit Application
recordTypes.description: The Zoning permit application is used for Driveways, Fences, and Sheds (up to 200sq ft - anything bigger is a regular building permit) and other accessory structures.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Unit Permit
recordTypes.description:
This permit is necessary for any individual or corporation who is seeking to operate a mobile food unit in the City of Newton. This includes ice cream trucks and food trucks. 

FOR TEMPORARY EVENTS: If your mobile food unit is permitted in another town and/or city, and you are interested in attending temporary events in Newton, please apply for Temporary Food Establishment (TFE) permits only. If you do not have a mobile food unit permit in any town, and are looking to operate in Newton, please apply for this mobile food unit permit.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Code Petition for Variance Request
recordTypes.description:
A property owner must obtain a variance from the State Board of Plumbers and Gas Fitters prior to the commencement of any work that falls outside the plumbing code. In order to apply for a variance, you must provide documentation that you have petitioned the local Health Department. 
To obtain this documentation, you will need to submit:
•Contact information
•Location of the project
•Copy of the variance application from the State Department of Consumer Affairs and Business Regulation Division of Occupational Licensure

recordTypes.name: Accessory Apartment Annual Affidavit
recordTypes.description: Accessory apartment annual affidavit must be completed each year you offer the accessory apartment for rent.  Please be sure to complete the document, sign and have it notarized.  Any questions please contact our office at 617-796-1060.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Sprinkler Make Safe or Demolition [COMMERCIAL / RESIDENTIAL]
recordTypes.description: Fire Department Sprinkler Make Safe / Demolition at Commercial/Residential properties permit application.  You will need to have your sprinkler license number in order to pull this permit.

recordTypes.name: Site Plan Review (Village Center Overlay District)
recordTypes.description:
Site Plan Review is required for any property opting into the Village Center Overlay District (VCOD) and developing a parcel that is between 15,000 and 30,000 square feet. Site Plan Review is also required for the construction of multiple buildings on a parcel utilizing adaptive reuse in the Multi Residence Transit (MRT) zone. 

Site Plan Review is conducted by the Planning and Development Board.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Ansul/Commercial Cooking/Gas Stations
recordTypes.description: Required for installation, modification, or removal from service of a commercial cooking fire suppression system and gas stations.   Follow all appropriate provisions of NFPA 17 (or NFPA 17A) and NFPA 96 (& UL-300).   Gas stations must follow all appropriate provisions of NFPA 30A. A set of diagram plans must be submitted with the permit application.   THE FINAL ACCEPTANCE TEST SHALL BE SCHEDULED AT THE END OF INSTALLATION.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Amendment Application
recordTypes.description: Building Permit Amendment application is used when the original issued building permit description has changed.  This application can only be used when no inspections have taken place.  The Amendment is approved or denied by the District Inspector.

recordTypes.name: Residential Kitchen Plan Review and Application
recordTypes.description: This application is necessary for any individual or corporation who is looking to operate a food establishment within a residential property in the City of Newton. This application asks for plans, general business information, staffing, equipment information, goods & services, food safety certifications, and more.

recordTypes.name: Sale of Tobacco & Nicotine Delivery Products Permit
recordTypes.description: This license is required for any individual or organization that sells any tobacco, tobacco biproducts, or nicotine delivery products in the City of Newton. This form must be completely filled out for consideration of the hereby license and the applicant must undergo the accompanying inspections for license approval.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Hot Work (Welding, Cutting, and Brazing)
recordTypes.description: This application for a fire permit addresses 527 CMR 1.00 - 29 CFR 1910.252 Subpart Q, NFPA 51B, NFPA 241, and ANSI Z49.  This form requires a property owners authorization letter before submission.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Cancelation and Refund Application
recordTypes.description:
This application is used to cancel a permit when no work has begun.  You may also request a refund using this application.  This application is not for removing a contractor and replacing with a new.

Any questions please contact Inspectional Services Department at 617-796-1060.

recordTypes.name: Inclusionary Zoning Review
recordTypes.description: Application for building permit review and approval of inclusionary housing plan and unit mix. This application can be submitted concurrently with the engineering site plan or building permit application. Plans submitted must match building permit plans.

recordTypes.name: Parking Waiver (Village Center Overlay District)
recordTypes.description: Parking waiver for any property opting into (or which has already opted into) the Village Center Overlay District (VCOD) and seeking a Special Permit for exceptions to the parking requirements in 9.2.6.C.

recordTypes.name: Request for Zoning Enforcement
recordTypes.description: Request for Zoning Enforcement - Enter a  brief complaint regarding the following issues: abandoned properties, building code issues, business use of home, construction site nuisance, fences, illegal rentals (apartments/short term), light trespass, noise, overgrown properties, unsafe structures, water runoff, work without permits, zoning issues.

recordTypes.name: Submetering of Water and Sewer Certification
recordTypes.description: This certification must be obtained from the local health department in order to install submeters for the purpose of charging tenants for water usage and/or sewer service.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Open Flame, Candles, and Outdoor Fireplaces
recordTypes.description:
Fire Permit for 527 CMR Section 10.10 (Open Flame, Candles and Outdoor Fires)
Please make sure that you have read the instructional PDF located here: https://www.newtonma.gov/home/showdocument?id=89701&t=637962074311409886

recordTypes.name: Summer Recreational Camp for Children License
recordTypes.description: This license is for the right to operate a children's recreational camp that operates at least four days a week while supervising school-age children. This application shall state the location and type of camp, the approximate maximum number of persons by whom it is used, the probable occupancy, the proposed sources of water and food supply for the camp, safety plans, and staff information.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Inspection
recordTypes.description: Many business types require a Certificate of Inspection that must be issued periodically for your premises to operate.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals 40B Insubstantial Change Application
recordTypes.description:
The Chapter 40B Regulations provide for two types of modifications the developer may request after
the ZBA has granted a comprehensive permit: an insubstantial change and a substantial change.(760 CMR 56.05(11)). Under DHCD’s Chapter 40B Regulations, changes such as an increase of 10 percent or more in building height or number of units generally qualify as substantial modifications (760 CMR 56.07(4)). The ZBA has the responsibility to determine if the proposed modifications are insubstantial or substantial. If they are deemed substantial, a public hearing must be held. If changes are determined to be substantial a new Comprehensive Permit application must be submitted.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Application for Appeals
recordTypes.description: Appeals are for when a person is appealing a decision to deny a building permit, issuance of a building permit, a zoning order and/or decision of the Commissioner of Inspectional Services, or a zoning violation.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Fuel Tank/Oil Burner Installation/Removal (Excluding Propane)
recordTypes.description: Installation, removal, or replacement of gasoline, diesel, or oil tanks and oil burner installation.

recordTypes.name: Consistency Ruling Request
recordTypes.description: Request for a Consistency ruling from the Commissioner of Inspectional Services.  Sign letter and all plans must be attached to application.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool Permit Plan Review and Application
recordTypes.description: This permit specifies the use and building of semi-public or public indoor and outdoor pools, wading pools, hot tubs, and whirlpools. Drainage, water treatment, and operator details are required for each type of pool while filling out this permit form.

recordTypes.name: Temporary / Seasonal Farmer's Market Food Establishment Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is necessary for any individual or corporation who wants to serve food in the City of Newton for up to fourteen (14) days (temporary) or at the Newton Farmer’s Market for up to six (6) months (seasonal). Temporary food permit applications must be submitted at least 14 days prior to the event. This application asks for plans, general business information, staffing, menu, equipment information, goods & services, food safety certifications, as well as the hours of operation.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Residential Propane Tank Installation, Renewal, and Storage
recordTypes.description: This form is for the permanent installation and renewal of residential propane storage tanks, inspection, and permitting. This form is NOT to be used for single-day or temporary propane storage/use.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Determination/Dover Waiver
recordTypes.description:
Request for a Determination from the Commissioner of Inspectional Services must be made on-line.  A signed letter must be attached with other supported documents for your request to be reviewed.

Use this application to request a Dover Waiver if applicable.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Board of Appeals Variance Application
recordTypes.description:
After a Development Review Team (DRT) meeting with Planning Staff, if you chose to go forward with your variance and have received a Zoning Review Memo, you may submit a variance application. Variance applications will not be accepted without a Zoning Review Memo. 

Petitioners should contact the Clerk to schedule a preliminary review prior to your intended filing date to ensure your Variance Petition is complete.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Review Application
recordTypes.description:
After a Development Review Team (DRT) meeting with Planning Staff, if you chose to go forward with your special permit, variance, or comprehensive permit, you must submit a Zoning Review Application. 

The Chief Zoning Code Official (CZCO) will review the proposal for compliance with the Newton Zoning Ordinance and will prepare a written report (Zoning Review Memo). Provided that all necessary information is provided by the applicant to describe the project, the CZCO will complete this review within 45 days. When the review is complete, you'll be informed of the next steps in the permitting process.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit Application
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliances, electrical services, etc.  Also includes low voltage wiring including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Flammable Storage Permits, Licensing & Certificates of Registration (excluding Labs)
recordTypes.description: This application covers a number of fire department permits which renew yearly, including certificates of registration which expire on April 30th each year.  This permit application should not be used for labs.

recordTypes.name: Well Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit assesses the type of well used, location, general contractor information, as well as insurance information. The word, "well", as used in these regulations, shall include any pit, pipe, excavation, casing, drill hole or other private source of water to be used for the purpose of supplying potable water in the City of Newton. Includes irrigation wells.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Cancellation  and Refund Application
recordTypes.description:
Electric cancellation form should be completed when you want to remove yourself as the Electrician of record or if you are the property owner/agent or General Contractor and want the Electrician removed.

Before the form can be accepted, an inspection will be required to confirm any work performed is done to Code.

Any questions please contact the Electrical Inspector.

recordTypes.name: Section 558 Planning Review (Public Buildings Only)
Permit - Flammable Storage - Temporary
recordTypes.description: This for is for temporary fuel storage, temporary propane, food trucks/event and generators not for permanent fuel storage.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Laboratory Registration/Permit
recordTypes.description: For the storage of flammables and hazardous materials in a Laboratory.

recordTypes.name: Gas Permit - Application
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when natural gas/propane gas piping is installed, altered, added to or repaired, including the installation of gas fired appliances. You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Gas Cancellation and Refund Request Application
recordTypes.description:
Gas cancellation form should be completed when you want to remove yourself as the Contractor of record or if you are the property owner/agent or General Contractor and want the Contractor removed.

Before the form can be accepted, an inspection will be required to confirm any work performed is done to Code.

Any questions please contact the Plumbing/Gas Inspectors.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Fumigation / Insecticidal Fogging
recordTypes.description: Per Massachusetts Comprehensive Fire Safety Code Table 1.12.8.1 a permit is required for fumigation and insecticidal fogging.

recordTypes.name: Home Business/Office Affidavit
recordTypes.description: Home Business/Office Affidavit is used for commercial activity conducted in a dwelling unit by the resident as an accessory use to the residential use of the dwelling.

recordTypes.name: Leaf Blower Complaint
recordTypes.description: Please complete this form for anyone violating the leaf blower ordinance.  All information is kept confidential from the alleged violator.

recordTypes.name: Permit - Seasonal Christmas Tree Sales
recordTypes.description: Fire Permit for the sale and storage of Christmas Trees.

recordTypes.name: Leaf Blower Registration
recordTypes.description: All users of Leaf Blowers need to register each calendar year.  Any questions please contact Inspectional Services Department 617-796-1060.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
Please do not use this permit application to request an irrigation meter.  We are currently in the process of updating our requirements for pickup and permitting.  More information to come.

This permit is required anytime the building’s plumbing is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired.  You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Cancellation and Refund Request Application
recordTypes.description:
Plumbing cancellation form should be completed when you want to remove yourself as the Plumber of record or if you are the property owner/agent or General Contractor and want the Plumber removed.

Before the form can be accepted, an inspection will be required to confirm any work performed is done to Code.

Any questions please contact the Plumbing Inspectors.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Irrigation Meter Application
recordTypes.description: This Plumbing permit application is only for requesting an irrigation meter.

recordTypes.name: Short Term Rental Annual Certification
recordTypes.description: Short Term Rental Annual Certification is required to be submitted by the first business day of January each year you intend to continue operating the Short Term Rental.  Owner/Operator should review the City Ordinance for any updates.

recordTypes.name: Short Term Rental Application
recordTypes.description:
BEFORE YOU REGISTER

Fire Inspections

All short-term rental operators must schedule an inspection with the Fire Department and receive a Certificate of Compliance indicating that the property meets the smoke detector and carbon monoxide requirements for residential units.

Fire inspections must be completed prior to registration with the City. Please note that operators are responsible for paying the fire inspection fees.

State Registration

All short-term rental operators must register with the State prior to registering with the City.  Additional information on how to register with the State can be found here: 
https://www.mass.gov/info-details/room-occupancy-frequently-asked-questions.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Energy Storage System
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request the installation of an energy storage system.  This application includes the Fire Department review of the plans.  This application is separate from a solar installation.  If you have any questions please contact Inspectional Services Department at 617-796-1060.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Energy Storage System
recordTypes.description: Use this application for the installation of the energy storage system.  This is separate from any solar installation.  Any questions please contact Inspectional Services Department at 617-796-1060.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit - Solar Application
recordTypes.description: This Building permit application is only for Solar permit jobs.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit - Solar Application
recordTypes.description: This Electrical permit application is only for Solar jobs.

categories.name: Board of License Commissioners
categories.content: The City of Newton Board of License Commissioners is a three-member Board, with one of its Commissioners as Chairperson. It is responsible for issuing licenses and permits, and enforcing rules and regulations established by the Board and the Alcoholic Beverages Control Commission. Licenses and permits issued by the Board include:

recordTypes.name: Gas Fitter Permit

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliances, electrical services, etc.  Also includes low voltage wiring including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc. You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime the building’s plumbing is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired.  You must be a licensed professional to apply for this permit.

recordTypes.name: Solid Fuel Appliance Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is used for installation of wood, pellet or coal stoves.

recordTypes.name: Trench Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime a trench hole or other excavation is being done to a depth of 4 (four) feet or more.  If this application is in connection with a road opening permit, please attach copy of road opening permit.

recordTypes.description: The owner of any dwelling, dwelling unit, rooming unit or structure who is a nonresident of the state of Rhode Island shall have and continuously maintain with the city or town clerk where the property is located a registered agent, which agent may be either an individual who resides in this state or corporation authorized to do business in this state.

recordTypes.name: Smoke Alarm & Carbon Monoxide Alarm Application for Sale of 1,2 & 3 Family Homes
recordTypes.description:
Smoke Alarm & Carbon Monoxide Alarm Inspection request for the sale of a residential building.  Initial Inspection Fee is $30.  If a re-inspection is required, the fee is $60.  If choosing to pay by cash or check, inspection will not be scheduled until payment is received. Applications not received by 4 PM on Monday, are not eligible for inspection on the upcoming Wednesday. You will be notified by email of your assigned 1 hour time slot for inspection on Tuesday afternoon.  

INSPECTION SHOULD BE SCHEDULED AT LEAST TEN BUSINESS DAYS PRIOR TO THE SCHEDULED CLOSING DATE.

ALL DEVICES are required to have a Nationally Recognized Testing Laboratory certification seal (ex. UL,ETL) on the rear of the device to ensure the device has been tested to meet all current standards.

ALL DEVICES must be installed prior to the inspector arriving. The Inspector cannot wait while devices are installed due to scheduling. When the inspector arrives if the devices are not mounted in place it will be a automatic failure and will have to be rescheduled for the following Wednesday, requiring a re-inspection fee.

categories.content: Submit one form to apply for permits (including Fire Plan Review, if applicable).

recordTypes.name: DDA Downtown Event Sponsorship Application
recordTypes.description: All sponsorships must be approved by the DDA Board. Please note that approval is not guaranteed and subject to availability of funds. Approved sponsorships will require a post-event report.

recordTypes.name: DDA 50/50 Sidewalk Improvement Application
recordTypes.description: The Downtown Development Authority’s (DDA) 50/50 Sidewalk Improvement Program helps property owners repair sidewalks (public right-of-way) by covering 50% of eligible costs and managing construction. The program improves accessibility and pedestrian safety, as well as the overall appearance and economic vitality of downtown.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Tree Permit
recordTypes.description: As per Cheyenne City Code, a permit is required for any tree work in public places, including the public right-of-way

recordTypes.name: Capital Improvement Grant
recordTypes.description:
This program is dedicated to improvements in the public-right-of way and limited improvements on private property that maintain a public element and enhance the right-of-way. Improvements funded under this program should should have a direct and lasting experience. The following are examples of improvements eligible for funding under this program. 

• Signage 
• Awnings 
• Ornamental pedestrian lights 
• Benches and trash containers 
• Sidewalks
• Street curb and gutter 
• Plazas / gathering areas
• Building facade elements
• Other projects as the DDA Board deems appropriate, provided the amenity is guaranteed to remain a benefit to the public for a specified time period as determined by the board.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit application is to be used for all commercial projects for new construction, additions, remodels, core & shell, tenant finish, and foundation only submittals.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Plan Review Only Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit application is to be used for PLAN REVIEW ONLY on all commercial projects for new construction, additions, remodels, core & shell, tenant finish, and foundation only submittals.

recordTypes.name: Engineering Plan Review
recordTypes.description: For full review and approval of construction drawings.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Change of Use Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for CHANGE OF USE in COMMERCIAL STRUCTURES ONLY. This permit is only to be used when NO CONSTRUCTION WORK is to be accomplished in a new tenant space where the OCCUPANCY CLASSIFICATION and/or USE is changing from what the prior OCCUPANCY CLASSIFICATION and/ or USE was.

recordTypes.name: Bed and Breakfast Inn or Facility
Pre-Application Meeting/Office Hours Meeting Request
recordTypes.description: Request a meeting with City Staff to discuss a project. This can be for projects not yet submitted or for comment resolution on an existing project.

recordTypes.name: DDA Pre-Application Meeting
recordTypes.description: Request a meeting with DDA Staff to discuss a project. This can be for projects not yet submitted or for comment resolution.

recordTypes.name: Grading Permit
recordTypes.description: A Grading Permit is required for all Commercial Projects.  A Grading Permit is required for Residential Projects that will be moving over 50 Cubic Yards of dirt. The review period for the application is one week.

recordTypes.name: UDC Annual Review/Code Amendments
recordTypes.description: Once a year the City formally reviews and considers code and policy changes to the Unified Development Code (UDC) initiated by members in the community. This formal review is known as the UDC Annual Review.

recordTypes.description: Any work to be performed in the City of Cheyenne Right of Way, including traffic control for street and sidewalk closures, requires a Right of Way Permit.

recordTypes.description: This permit is only to be used by entities who have a Franchise Agreement with the City of Cheyenne, i.e. BOPU, Black Hills Energy, and Century Link. Use Agreements are not the same as Franchise Agreements. Permits for private utility companies must use the standard Right of Way Permit application.

recordTypes.name: Residential Deck/Porch (with/without patio cover)
recordTypes.description: This permit type is intended to be applied for when a deck or porch is constructed, replaced, modified, or removed.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Permit- Pod/Storage Container
recordTypes.description: An encroachment permit shall be required for any mobile storage container that will occupy any part of the street or will otherwise be placed in the public right-of-way.

recordTypes.name: 100 Year Floodplain Development Permit
recordTypes.description: Any party undertaking development within a designated 100 Year FEMA floodplain must obtain a floodplain development permit prior to the work commencing.

recordTypes.name: Pre-submittal Conference/ Office Hours Meeting Request Form
recordTypes.description: If needed, you can apply for a time slot to discuss Engineering items on a submittal.

recordTypes.name: 201 Exception
recordTypes.description: For exceptions to the 201 agreement - allowing sewage systems which do not connect to a sanitary sewer system.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Dwelling Unit
recordTypes.description: To request a second dwelling unit to an owner-occupied single-family home.

recordTypes.name: Critical Traffic Control Program Complaint
recordTypes.description: This Form is in reference to Section 10.24.190 Critical traffic control areas, creation and administration; enhanced penalties. Ordinance No. 4579

recordTypes.description: To add land to the City's jurisdiction. City zoning is assigned as the City zone most analogous to the current County zone. If a different zone is desired, a zoning map amendment is also required.

recordTypes.name: Appeal of Administrative Decision
recordTypes.description: To provide an opportunity to be heard and grant relief when a final decision by an administrative official made in interpreting and applying the zoning provisions in the UDC was in error.

categories.name: Helpful Guides and Links
categories.content:
Below are helpful links to get you started on the OpenGov platform! 

The links include step-by-step guides to create an OpenGov profile, make an online payment, and how to view an active application. The FAQ page is available to answer common questions constituents may have when working with the City's Building, City Clerk, Engineering, or Planning & Development Department.

categories.name: Planning and Development

recordTypes.name: Annexation Application
recordTypes.description: Annexation application is used to apply for annexation into the City of Vestavia Hills.  Information concerning annexation maybe obtained in the help section preceding this application along with an owner affidavit authorizing the annexation of this property.  Please ensure that these documents have been reviewed and the owner's affidavit completed and notarized prior to applying for annexation as this annexation petition cannot be processed without that affidavit.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use Application
recordTypes.description: Conditional Use Application is for requesting uses that aren't permitted by right in a zoning classification.  This application must be filled out in it's entirety and filed simultaneously with a notarized owner's affidavit (blank owner's affidavit is found on the home sheet).  Failure to submit all needed information and the owner's affidavit may result in a delay of scheduling this request.

recordTypes.name: CoLocated Small Cell Facility Application
recordTypes.description: This application shall be used for small cell facilities to be colocated on an existing utility pole.  If a new pole is desired, please use the application for new pole facility.

recordTypes.name: Driveway Permit
recordTypes.description: Driveway permits are required for all new driveways, repairs/resurfacing of existing driveways, and driveway spanners that connect to a City roadway.

recordTypes.name: Blasting Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit for Blasting activity within Vestavia Hills

recordTypes.name: Design Review Board Application
recordTypes.description: The Design Review Board meets the 1st Thursday of every month in the Executive Conference Room of City Hall.  Deadline for Application before this Board are 15 days prior to the hearing.  Be sure to submit the correct application for your request and all other information as required by the Vestavia Hills Zoning Code, Subdivision Regulations, etc.  Please note, this application date is prescribed by law and cannot be amended by staff. There are no exceptions.

recordTypes.name: Cell Tower Permit
recordTypes.description: This cell tower permit application is required when installing or modifying any cell tower equipment, etc.

recordTypes.name: Fire Alarm Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when installing or altering any portion of a fire alarm system.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This commercial permit application is used for who intends to construct, enlarge, alter, repair, renovate, move, demolish or change the occupancy of the commercial building or structure.  Architects, Engineers and Designers that want to start the review process before a contractor is chosen for the project are required to submit a Plan Review Application listed below.

recordTypes.name: Land Disturbance Permit
recordTypes.description:
Land Disturbance Permits are required for any construction activity that results in soil disturbance of 500 sf or greater.

Projects that involve residential buildings, additions, renovations, retaining walls, decks, etc. should complete a Residential Building Permit application only.  The Land Disturbance record type is specifically for commercial construction, subdivisions and/or projects needing a stand-alone Land Disturbance Permit.

recordTypes.name: New Support Small Cell Facility Application
recordTypes.description: This application shall be used for small cell facilities to be colocated on an existing utility pole.  If a new pole is desired, please use the application for new pole facility.

recordTypes.name: License Agreement
recordTypes.description: License agreement for permanent private improvements within public right-of-ways, alleys, and other public property.

recordTypes.name: Fire Department  Special Event Request
recordTypes.description: This workflow is used to request a fire station tour or an on-site public relations event.

recordTypes.name: VH Civic Center Rental
recordTypes.description: This contract is to be utilized for Vestavia Hills Civic Center facility/room rentals.

recordTypes.name: Contractor License
recordTypes.description: Any home builder, general contractor, contractor or sub-contractor must obtain a City contractor license to conduct business within the City of Vestavia Hills. Please review each license type that best describes the type of license you need.

recordTypes.name: Final Plat Application
recordTypes.description:
The Planning and Zoning Commission meets the 2nd Thursday of every month.
Application dates vary and must be received in the Office on or before these dates. Be sure to
submit the correct application for your request. Please note, these application dates are
prescribed by law and cannot be amended by staff. There are no exceptions. Application
deadlines are outlined as follows:

Final Plat Approval Requests – 15 days prior to the meeting

recordTypes.name: Preliminary Plat Application
recordTypes.description:
The Planning and Zoning Commission meets the 2nd Thursday of every month.
Application dates vary and must be received in the Office on or before these dates. Be sure to
submit the correct application for your request. Please note, these application dates are
prescribed by law and cannot be amended by staff. There are no exceptions. Application
deadlines are outlined as follows:

Preliminary Plat Approval Requests – 20 days prior to the meeting

recordTypes.name: Fire Hood Suppression Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when installing or altering any portion of a commercial kitchen hood suppression system.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when installing any electrical wiring, electrical appliance, electrical services, etc. Also includes low voltage wiring, including cable TV, internet, phones, security alarm systems, etc.

recordTypes.name: VH Facility Use Approval – VHCS
recordTypes.description: This agreement is to be utilized for the reservation of Vestavia Hills facilities by Vestavia Hills City Schools and related entities.

recordTypes.name: Post Construction Stormwater Submittal
recordTypes.description:
All development sites or re-development sites that result in total soil disturbance of one or more acres must be designed to have permanent stormwater control structures in place and those structural controls must be properly maintained. (City of Vestavia Hills Ordinance Number 2771).  

Post-construction stormwater design is reviewed and approved as part of the Land Disturbance permitting process.

Following construction, submittal to the City of a certified as-built of the stormwater management features and a letter of substantial compliance from the design engineer are required within 120 days of construction.

An annual inspection of all post-construction stormwater management features is required by the Developer or Owner and must be submitted to the City each year by September 30th.

recordTypes.name: Garage Sale Permit
recordTypes.description:
A permit is required for all garage/yard sales in Vestavia Hills. The cost is $5 per participating household* and must be obtained prior to the sale. Upon approval by the Finance department, the applicant will receive an email to access the completed permit. The permit may be used on an alternate date in the event of bad weather. For more information, contact the Vestavia Hills Finance department during normal business hours at 205.978.0157.

*If the permit is for a neighborhood garage sale, each location must be provided in the application.

recordTypes.name: Municipal Assessment Letter
recordTypes.description: Due to the magnitude of non-payment, the City has had to begin processing Municipal Assessment letters following payment.  Municipal Assessment letters are issued as soon as practical following receipt of payment at the rate of $10 per property.   Please make your request through the online portal.  You can make payment by mailing a check or paying online using a credit/debit card (includes a 3%  and surcharge and 90 cent transaction fee).

recordTypes.name: Public Works Bid Contract
recordTypes.description: This contract is to be utilized for all Public Works projects estimated to be $100,000 or more.

recordTypes.name: Gas Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when natural gas/propane gas piping is installed, altered, added to or repaired, including the installation of gas fired appliances.

recordTypes.name: Fire Main Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when installing or altering any portion of a fire main system

recordTypes.name: Rezoning Application
recordTypes.description: The Vestavia Hills Planning and Zoning Commission meets the second Thursday of ever month.  The deadline for application is 25 working days (5 weeks) prior to the meeting date.  It is strongly recommended that any intended development plans be discussed with the City Zoning Staff prior to submittal of any requests for rezoning at the risk that the development does not meet code and require rejection.  The Zoning Staff meets every Tuesday, 9 AM, in the Executive Conference Room, 1st Floor, City Hall.  There is no requirement for an appointment to attend.

recordTypes.name: Variance Application
recordTypes.description: The Board of Zoning Adjustment was established by the State of Alabama to grant variances from the Vestavia Hills Zoning Code in cases of undue hardship only.  The Vestavia Hills Zoning Ordinance allows for variances due to undue hardship as well as certain special exceptions.  Before applying, please ensure you have all applicable information.  The Vestavia Hills Zoning Staff meets every Tuesday morning at 9 AM in the Executive Conference Room of City Hall.  Applicants are encouraged to bring their information or contact Jack Wakefield (jwakefield@vhal.org) or phone 205.978.0101 prior to submittal.

recordTypes.name: Fire Sprinkler Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when installing or altering any portion of a fire sprinkler or fire standpipe system

recordTypes.name: Irrigation Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required to install, enlarge, alter, do major repairs or remove a irrigation system.

recordTypes.name: Public Record Request
recordTypes.description: Pursuant to §36-12-40, Code of Alabama, 1975, inspection and copying of records, “Every citizen has a right to inspect and take a copy of any public writing of this state, except as otherwise expressly provided by statute.”  The fee schedule to obtain copies of records and/or to inspect records and the statement of general public records policy are incorporated within Ordinance Number 3179.  Please read carefully before submitting your records request or making inquiries.

recordTypes.name: Street Cutting Permit Application
recordTypes.description: A Street Cutting Permit is required to make any opening, cut or excavation in or under the surface of any street, alley, sidewalk, gutter, etc. within a City of Vestavia Hills' right-of-way.  This permit is applicable to all underground public and private utilities that are to be located, adjusted, repaired or relocated within those rights-of-way.

recordTypes.name: Caterer Contract
recordTypes.description: This contract is to be used for preferred caterers for the Vestavia HIlls Civic Center.  The contract's duration is for a period of one year (1 year) and must be renewed annually for catering services to the Center.

recordTypes.name: Traffic Calming Request
recordTypes.description:
Refer to City of Vestavia Hills' Traffic Calming Policy.  

The purpose of the Traffic Calming Policy for Residential Streets is to address safety concerns related to vehicular traffic in residential neighborhoods.  

To initiate a Traffic Calming Request, a resident who lives on the street of concern completes a Traffic Calming Request Form.  If the street is located in a neighborhood with an active Homeowner's Association (HOA), the Form should be completed by a representative of the HOA Board.

recordTypes.name: Special Exception Application
recordTypes.description: The Board of Zoning Adjustment was established by the State of Alabama to grant variances and special exceptions from the Vestavia Hills Zoning Code. Before applying, please ensure you have all applicable information.  The Vestavia Hills Zoning Staff meets every Tuesday morning at 9 AM in the Executive Conference Room of City Hall.  Applicants are encouraged to bring their information or contact Jack Wakefield (jwakefield@vhal.org) or phone 205.978.0101 prior to submittal.

recordTypes.name: Solicitation Permit Registration
recordTypes.description: Door to Door solicitation in the City is allowed pursuant to Ordinance Number 2418 only after a vendor obtains a business license for solicitation and a permit from the City Clerk's office.  Before beginning this registration, please ensure that you have the following items ready to upload:  (1) Copy of a current Vestavia Hills Business license for solicitation (not an application, this needs to be the license); (2) Documentation that you, the applicant, is personally authorized to solicit for the organization/business (must be on company letterhead and name the applicant by name); A copy of a government issued identification I.E. driver license; a passport head/shoulder recent photograph of the applicant.  These must be uploaded at the time of application of your application cannot be processed.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required to erect, install, enlarge, alter, do major repairs, remove, convert or replace a mechanical system.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Truck Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required for the operation of a Mobile Food Preparation Vehicle within Vestavia Hills

recordTypes.name: Medical Gas Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime Medical Gas systems is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired. This includes but is not limited to any Medical Gas systems, distribution piping, supply manifolds, connections, regulators, valves, alarms, sensors and associated equipment.

recordTypes.name: Utility Land Disturbance Permit
recordTypes.description: Utility Permits are required when a public utility is installing a new public underground utility line or extending an existing public underground utility line that exceeds 1,000 linear feet in accordance with Ordinance 2987 entitled Erosion and Sediment Control Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Vacation of Easement
recordTypes.description: Vacation of a recorded easement can only be accomplished by way of the Vestavia Hills City Council.  This also requires that a public hearing be held to determine the viability of the vacation. These procedures cannot be circumvented.

recordTypes.name: Vacation of Public Right-of-Way
recordTypes.description: Vacation of right-of-way is regulated by the Code of the State of Alabama (23-4-20, Code of Alabama, 1975) and certain procedures must be followed.  The State of Alabama (11-49-6, Code of Alabama, 1975) also requires that a public hearing be held to determine the price for payment of area, should the vacation be approved. These procedures cannot be circumvented.

recordTypes.name: Noise Waiver Permit
recordTypes.description: This waiver permit is for construction activity to be approved outside of the allowable time frame of 7am to 10pm Monday-Friday. This application is also required for construction activity on Saturday. If you wish to submit a permit request for non-construction events, i.e. block party or other community event, submit an Event Request at https://vestaviahillsal.portal.opengov.com/categories/1086/record-types/6517.

recordTypes.name: Permit Extension Application
recordTypes.description: This permit extension application is for permits that have expired but are not complete.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Certification
recordTypes.description: Certifications for zoning can only be provided if the City Council has adopted an Ordinance to rezone said property.  The cost of providing a zoning certification is $35.00 which would include a statement of zoning, a copy of the Ordinance rezoning the property and a table of permittable uses.  If there is no Ordinance rezoning said property, a zoning certification cannot be provided by the City.

recordTypes.name: Event Request
recordTypes.description: An event permit is required prior to hosting a block party or other community event in the City of Vestavia Hills. This also includes large events, such as weddings, showers or estate sales, that may require significant on- or off-street parking. There is no charge for an event permit. If you are unsure whether or not your event requires a permit, contact City Administration at administration@vhal.org or 205.978.0152.

recordTypes.name: Holiday Parade & Party in the Park
recordTypes.description: This record type is for use by those who wish to participate/enter a float in the holiday parade and/or be a participating sponsor for the Party in the Park following the parade.

recordTypes.name: Permit Fee Waiver Application
recordTypes.description: This permit fee waiver application is for requesting permit fees to be waived by the city manager for non-profit organizations and city schools.

recordTypes.name: Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: This application is used for Architects, Engineers and Designers that want to start the review process before a contractor is chosen for the project.

recordTypes.name: Professional Engineering Services Agreement
recordTypes.description: Agreement with the City of Vestavia Hills for Professional Engineering Services

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required anytime plumbing is being installed, altered, removed, replaced or repaired. This includes but is not limited to any plumbing fixtures such as water and drainage lines, water service, water heater, backflow preventer, etc.

recordTypes.name: Portable Storage Unit/Dumpster Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when a Portable Storage Unit/POD is placed at a home for storage of household items, inventory, temporary storage of items necessary for office use or personal property for a limited period of time. This permit is also required for construction dumpsters used by general or subcontractors for temporary storage of item necessary for construction or renovation of a residence.

recordTypes.name: Public Works Construction Contract $100,000 or Less
recordTypes.description: This contract is to be utilized for all Public Works projects estimated to be $100,000 or less.

recordTypes.name: VHCC Employee After Hours Acknowledgement
recordTypes.description: This employee acknowledgement is required, along with a Civic Center membership, for City staff to access the facility outside of regular business hours.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This residential building permit application is used for new construction, additions, renovations, alterations, window replacement, siding, fence, demolition, retaining walls, accessory structure, etc.

recordTypes.name: Roofing Permit
recordTypes.description: This roofing permit application is required for re-roofing, repairs, alterations and modifications of a roof on an existing  building.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Sign Permit Application. Use this form to apply for permanent sign permit, a temporary sign permit, or a non-profit charitable organization temporary sign permit.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is required when installing a new swimming pool and performing renovations, addition, alterations, repairs or resurfacing an existing swimming pool and pool deck.

recordTypes.name: Tree Preservation Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit application is required for any person wishing to remove, relocate, destroy, or otherwise damage a Protected Tree under the provisions of city ordinance 2203.

recordTypes.name: Tent Permit
recordTypes.description: Temporary structures that cover an area greater than 120 square feet (11.16 m2), including connecting areas or spaces with a common means of egress or entrance that are used or intended to be used for the gathering together of 10 or more persons, shall not be erected, operated or maintained for any purpose without obtaining a permit from the building official.

categories.name: Annexation
categories.content: NOTE:  Annexation requests are suspended until after the upcoming Municipal Election and the seating of a new Council in November 2025.  Annexation into the City of Vestavia Hills is at the sole discretion of the Vestavia Hills City Council by a petition of the owner or designated representative of the owner. Annexation information is available by clicking

categories.name: Building Safety
categories.content: Welcome to the Department of Building Safety permit selection page. Please view all permits options before making a selection. Detailed information is provided for each permit type and can be viewed before applying. If you have questions or need assistance, contact us at 205.978.0125, 205.978.0147 or inspections@vhal.org.

categories.name: City Clerk
categories.content: Assessment Letters:  Due to high demand, costs of accounting and the high number of non-payments, the City has now required that all Municipal Assessment letters be prepared following the required payment of $10. Payments may be paid online with a credit or debit card with a 3% surcharge and a 90 cent transaction fee. Or, checks may be mailed to the City of Vestavia Hills at the address below or hand delivered for the sake of expediting receipt of the letter. Lett

categories.name: Fire Department
categories.content: The Vestavia Hills Fire Department Fire Marshal's office processes all permits related to fire protection systems, blasting and mobile food vendors. We may be contacted at 205.978.0218 or 205.978.0224 if you have any questions.

categories.name: Planning & Zoning
categories.content: PLEASE NOTE:  ALL REQUIRED FORMS AND DRAWINGS MUST BE SUPPLIED BY THE APPLICANT AT THE TIME OF APPLICATION AND RECEIVED PRIOR TO THE DEADLINE DATE.  IF ALL INFORMATION IS NOT RECEIVED PRIOR TO THE DEADLINE DATE, YOUR APPLICATION WAS FILED INCORRECTLY AND WILL NOT BE PROCESSED.  THESE DEADLINES ARE SET BY WAY OF ORDINANCE, THE STAFF DOES NOT HAVE FLEXIBILITY TO BEND THESE RULES.  These forms are to file for various land development requests including r

categories.name: Small Cell
categories.content: New cellular 5G technology has been authorized by the Vestavia Hills City Council by adoption of Ordinance Number 2814-A with fees as set out in Ordinance Number 2815-A.   Applications may be submitted online through the following links:  Colocated Small Cell Facility Application (for nodes that are co-located on existing structures) and New Support Small Cell Facility Application (when a new support structure is requested).  NOTE:  New support structure require a public h

categories.name: Volunteer Opportunities, Boards and Commissions
categories.content: Board/Commission applications shall be open when vacancies occur on any of the following: Vestavia Hills Board of Education (annually in spring); Vestavia Hills Library Board (annually in the fall); and the Vestavia Hills Parks and Recreation Board (annually in the fall). Please note that if a link is not present, there is not a current vacancy on said Board/Commission.

categories.name: Public Works
categories.content: <div>Please note that Public Works handles bulk trash services and trash/recycle can replacements. Regular trash collection is processed via a third-party provider. Sewer service is handled by the city’s sewer department. For any issues related to weekly trash collection or sewer service, please contact our finance department at 251-981-6096. Our finance staff will coordinate communication with the other departments. If you need any changes to the trash/recycle cans you currently have, ple

recordTypes.description: Engineering/Technical Review of Proposed Final Tract and Parcel Maps for Approval by the Department of Public Works before recordation.

recordTypes.description: To request initial administrative review and fee waiver of a Pet Citation issued by Ventura County Animal Services. [Español] Solicitud de Revisión Administrativa de Citación Animal de Ventura County Animal Services.

recordTypes.name: Business Approval and Tax Certificate - In-Town
recordTypes.description: If you're doing business in Camarillo, you'll need City approval and to pay an annual business tax. Our easy, all-in-one application takes care of both zoning and tax requirements. Just apply if you're starting up, relocating, expanding, or changing how you operate in town. Each location will need its own application, and we’re here to help every step of the way. This application includes Massage Establishment Permits.

recordTypes.name: Business Tax Certificate - Out-of-Town
recordTypes.description: Apply here if your business doesn’t have a physical location in Camarillo but still provides services or does work in the city. Out-of-town businesses are required to pay an annual business tax, and we’ve made the process quick and easy to get started.

recordTypes.name: Fats, Oils, and Grease (FOG) Wastewater Discharge Permit
recordTypes.description: The Camarillo Sanitary District (CSD) administers a Fats, Oils, and Grease (FOG) Source Control Program to protect the public and the environment through the regulation of wastewater discharges from Food Service Establishments. Please do not submit this application if the facility uses a septic tank.

recordTypes.name: Change Order
recordTypes.description: For processing of revisions to approved plans for review and approval by the Department of Public Works before construction in the field.

recordTypes.name: Live Entertainment Permit
recordTypes.description: Businesses like restaurants and cafes can offer live music or entertainment once they’ve received a Live Entertainment Permit. It’s a simple step to keep things fun, safe, and compliant.

recordTypes.name: Banner Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit to display banners for temporary business promotion or for community events that do not require a City Special Event Permit.

recordTypes.description: Application for a change of zone or prezoning for annexation.

recordTypes.description: For new commercial developments. To modify an existing commercial building or site, see the Modification application.

recordTypes.name: Solicitors Permit
recordTypes.description: Anyone selling goods or services door-to-door in Camarillo needs to have a Solicitor's Permit—including charitable organizations. To help protect our residents and businesses, the City conducts a background check on every applicant before a permit is issued.

recordTypes.name: 4. Scheduling Inspections

recordTypes.description: For new uses which are not permitted by right in the zone. To modify an existing Conditional Use Permit, see the Modification application.

recordTypes.description:
The process to review soils reports including, but not limited to, Fault Investigation and Slope Stability Analysis.
Soils reports must be prepared in accordance with the CITY OF CAMARILLO GUIDELINES FOR THE PREPARATION OF GEOTECHNICAL AND GEOLOGICAL STUDIES available upon request or on the City's Website.

recordTypes.description: Application for lot line adjustment or parcel merger, resulting in no increase in number of lots.

recordTypes.description: To request a radius map, list of property owners, and certification of the property owner's list.

recordTypes.description: For new or modified Master Sign Programs.

recordTypes.description: To modify an existing Planned Development Permit (CPD/IPD/RPD), Conditional Use Permit (CUP), Wireless Communication Facility Administrative Permit, or approved Tentative Subdivision Maps (Parcel Maps/Tract Maps).

recordTypes.name: Pre-Application Review
recordTypes.description: Preliminary review to provide information on potential issues with a project before a formal submittal.

recordTypes.name: Residential Planned Development (RPD)
recordTypes.description: For new residential developments. To modify an existing residential building or site, see the Modification application or the Zone Clearance/Building Permit application.

recordTypes.description: Required for most outdoor events such as concerts, carnivals, circuses, parking lot sales, marathons, or non-profit charitable events. Application must be filed 6-8 weeks prior to the event.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Permit (SPEV) - Filming

recordTypes.name: Special Event Permit (SPEV) - Animals
recordTypes.description: Application for youth animal projects (4-H) or the keeping of wild birds. Must be submitted at least 30 days prior to the start of the use.
