categories.name: Business Tax
categories.content:
Welcome to Camarillo—We’re Glad You’re Here!

Before you get started, make sure your business is approved and your annual business tax is submitted. For most businesses, it’s a quick and easy process through our Business Approval and Tax Certificate application.

If your business involves live entertainment

categories.name: Help, Links, Guides & Other Information
categories.content: Thank you for making the switch with us from a paper system to a fully digital system! We know this transition will take time and we are here to help you through it. Check out these resources for helpful tips on getting started, and please feel free to reach out to us at Camarillo City Hall if you have any questions or need further assistance.

categories.name: Code Compliance
categories.content: <div><span style="font-family: Arial,Helvetica,sans-serif;">Camarillo's Code Compliance Division of the Community Development Department is responsible for the implementation of the Municipal Code including zoning/land use, property maintenance, conservation, inoperable vehicles on private property, and substandard housing.  The Code Compliance Division is also responsible for enforcing weed and property maintenance ordinances, including weed over-growth of vegetation, inoperable or jun

recordTypes.name: Cannabis License Renewal
recordTypes.description: Annual renewals of Cannabis Licenses

recordTypes.name: Over the Counter Building Permit Application
Administrative Adjustment
recordTypes.description: An Administrative Adjustment is a discretionary process to determine if a project is eligible for a modified standard. Standards which may be modified with an Administrative Adjustment are identified in Zoning Code Article 2 (Zoning Districts) and Article 3 (Citywide Standards).

recordTypes.name: Sewer Lateral Loan
recordTypes.description: For tracking sewer lateral loans throughout the process

recordTypes.name: Annexation
recordTypes.description: Annexation is a process used to extend the City limit line around additional property(ies).  Contact Development Services - Planning BEFORE you apply.

recordTypes.name: Encroachment Permit
recordTypes.description: An encroachment permit is required prior to construction work or any other activity taking place within the public right-of-way.

recordTypes.name: Appeal to Design Review or Planning Commission
recordTypes.description: A permit used to appeal either a Director's Decision or Design Review Committee decision to the Planning Commission

recordTypes.name: Sewer Lateral Certificate
recordTypes.description: Sewer Lateral Compliance Certificate verifying that laterals is up to standard and good for 25 years.

recordTypes.name: Annual Encroachment Permit
recordTypes.description: Annual encroachment permits are issued by the City of Eureka to tree trimming companies, Franchise Utilities and their subcontractors. If you have not previously been approved for an annual encroachment permit, please contact the Engineering Department before applying.

recordTypes.name: Burn Down Letter Request (Coastal)
recordTypes.description:
A sketch site plan is required.

Burn Down Letters may take up to two weeks to prepare.

recordTypes.name: Burn Down Letter Request (Inland)
recordTypes.description:
A sketch site plan is required.

Burn Down Letters may take up to two weeks to prepare.

recordTypes.name: Downtown Residential Parking Permit
recordTypes.description: The intent of the residential parking permit program is to allow for residents within the Downtown/Old Town area to park in City parking lots beyond the parking time limits and without paying parking meter fees.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Compliance
recordTypes.description:
A Certificate of Compliance is a legal document, recorded with the Humboldt County Recorder’s office, which certifies a parcel of land complies with the Subdivision Map Act. If the City determines the real property does not comply with the provisions of the Subdivision Map Act and/or local ordinances, a conditional certificate of compliance will be recorded. The City may, as a condition to granting a conditional certificate of compliance, impose any conditions allowed by the Subdivision Map Act. Compliance with the conditions will not be required until a permit or other grant of approval for development of the property is issued by the City of
Eureka.

The following documents are required to submit the application:
1. Current Grant Deed
2. Site Plan
3. Chain of Title
4. A Summary Description of each lot
5. A Legal Description, Plat, and Calculations of each lot prepared and signed by a Qualified Registered Civil Engineer or Land Surveyor Pursuant to the Professional Land Surveyor’s Act

recordTypes.name: Downtown Employee Parking Permit
recordTypes.description: Improving the efficiency and utilization of parking for employees in the Old Town / Downtown Area.

recordTypes.name: Eureka High School Parking Permit
recordTypes.description: The intent of the Eureka High School (EHS) parking permit program is to allow for residents within the EHS area to access on-street parking while still providing parking for students and staff, in designated areas only.

recordTypes.name: Coastal Development Permit
recordTypes.description:
The Coastal Act of 1976 established detailed policies for land use within the Coastal Zone, and charged local governments with the responsibility to incorporate these policies into their planning and zoning regulations. Generally, the Coastal Act sets forth regulations which require the City to process Coastal Development Permits for all proposed development in the Coastal Zone. The Coastal Act, as well as the City’s Local Coastal Program, provide for exemptions and exclusions for certain types of projects. 

Before you complete this application, please contact Development Service-Planning to determine whether your project requires a Coastal Development Permit or if you are eligible for an exemption or exclusion, and whether other permits or reviews are required.

recordTypes.name: Coastal  Exemption Permit
recordTypes.description:
The Coastal Act of 1976 established detailed policies for land use within the Coastal zone, and
charged local governments with the responsibility to incorporate these policies into their planning
and zoning regulations. Generally, the Coastal Act sets forth regulations which require the City to
process Coastal Development Permits for all proposed development in the Coastal Zone. The
Coastal Act, as well as the City’s Local Coastal Program, provides for exemptions and exclusions
for certain types of projects.

recordTypes.name: Consolidated CDP
recordTypes.description: In the Coastal Zone, some properties are located in an area where both the Coastal Commission and the City of Eureka have permit jurisdiction for development.  In some cases, it is advantageous to the applicant and the City to request the Coastal Commission take jurisdiction over the City's permit authority and consolidate the City's and Commission's Coastal Development Permit jurisdiction, which results in the applicant only having to apply for one Coastal Development Permit from the Coastal Commission.

recordTypes.name: Water Service Order
recordTypes.description: This is a permit request to have the City install a new water service from the water main to a water meter set in the sidewalk. Please note that a Building Permit is required for all work on private property.

recordTypes.name: Cottage Food Operation Home Occupation Permit
recordTypes.description: A Cottage Food Operation Home Occupation Permit can allow residents to prepare and package certain non-potentially hazardous foods in their private home-kitchen.

recordTypes.name: Density Bonus
recordTypes.description: The purpose of this application is to allow for density bonuses and additional incentives, consistent with Government Code Section 65915 et. seq. and the General Plan Housing Element, and to promote the production of affordable, specialized, and senior housing.

recordTypes.name: Design Review (Coastal)
recordTypes.description: Design Review, which includes either Architectural Review or Site Plan Review, or both, in the Coastal Zone is intended to preserve the natural beauty of sites and prevent: indiscriminate clearing of property and grading of hillsides; destruction of trees and shrubs; creation of drainage hazards; or the erection of structures or signs which would be inharmonious with their surroundings or would have an adverse effect on the value of property or improvements in the vicinity; and to ensure structures are properly related to their sites and surrounding sites and structures, and to traffic circulation in the vicinity, and parking areas, walk ways, and landscaping are arranged to accomplish the objectives of the coastal zoning code.

recordTypes.name: SolarAPP+ Solar Permit
recordTypes.description:
NEW! Expedited Solar Permitting is now available through the SolarAPP+ program, a collaboration between the NREL and local communities.

Note: This application requires a SolarAPP+ Approval Document. If you don't already have one, you can learn how to get one at solarapp.nrel.gov

recordTypes.name: Design Review (Inland)
recordTypes.description:
Design Review is a discretionary process to ensure street-facing facades and other aspects of
proposed developments exhibit high quality design, complement neighboring properties, and
contribute to Eureka’s distinctive identity and unique sense of place. Design Review criteria focus
on the community character, surrounding context, pedestrian environment, architectural style,
articulation and visual interest, materials, safety, and landscaping of the project. The project cannot
cause serious public health, safety or welfare impacts or have an adverse impact on the
environment.

recordTypes.name: Development Review
recordTypes.description: Development Review provides an opportunity for the City and other agencies to relay development requirements to applicants, and to answer applicant questions. Contact Development Services - Planning at 707-441-4160 or planning@eurekaca.gov to determine whether Development Review is required for your project, Development Review may also be requested by an applicant for any type of project.

recordTypes.name: Environmental Document
recordTypes.description: Projects must be reviewed in accordance with the California Environmental Quality Act (CEQA) to determine if the project is statutorily or categorically exempt from CEQA, or if further environmental review is required. If the project is exempt from CEQA, an exemption is created and the Environmental Review is complete. If the project is not exempt from CEQA, then the applicant must draft the required environmental documents for City review. Once acceptable to the City, the environmental document will be circulated for agency and public comment, and then forwarded to the Review Authority for review and action.

recordTypes.name: Extension Request
recordTypes.description: An applicant may request a one- or two-year extension of a permit/approval set to expire under Eureka Municipal Code 155.420.090 (Permit/Approval Expiration). If a one-year extension is requested first, and the project is not exercised/vested within the extended year, an additional two-year extension can be requested. If the first extension requested is a two-year extension, then no additional extensions can be requested at the end of the two years.

recordTypes.name: Business License - Inside City Limits
recordTypes.description: This application is for businesses that have a base of operations inside Eureka City limits (a base of operations is the fixed place of business in the City occupied for the particular purpose of conducting a business)

recordTypes.name: Flood Development Permit
recordTypes.description:
The flood hazard areas of the City of Eureka are subject to periodic inundation which can result in a loss of life and property, health and safety hazards, disruption of commerce and governmental services, extraordinary public expenditures for flood protection and relief, and impairment of the tax base, all of which adversely affect the public health, safety, and general welfare. These flood losses are caused by uses that are inadequately elevated, floodproofed, or protected from flood damage. The cumulative effect of obstructions in areas of special flood hazard which increase flood heights and velocities also contribute to flood losses.

A development permit must be obtained before any construction or other development, including manufactured homes, is undertaken within any area of special flood hazard.

recordTypes.name: General Plan Petition
recordTypes.description: Prior to submitting an application for a General Plan Amendment or a General Plan Map amendment, the City Council must review and accept a General Plan Petition.

recordTypes.name: Business License - Outside City Limits
recordTypes.description: This application is for businesses that have a base of operations outside Eureka City limits (a base of operations is the fixed place of business, i.e. your store, main office or headquarters) but are planning on doing business inside Eureka City limits.

recordTypes.name: Gulch Greenway Permit
recordTypes.description: A Gulch Greenway Permit is a discretionary review required for development within the Gulch Greenway Management Area (GGMA), a subset of the Gulch Greenway Overlay. The permit ensures projects minimize impacts to habitat, water quality, erosion, flooding, and fire hazards, with review by City staff (Minor permit) or the Planning Commission (Conditional permit).

recordTypes.name: Historic Preservation
recordTypes.description: The Historic Preservation Commission,  has the authority to review applications for additions, alterations, new construction, or demolition of all or part of any structure or landscape element (such as historic walls and trees designated in the Historic Preservation Application) which is located on a property listed on the Local Register of Historic Places.

recordTypes.name: Amendments to Business License
recordTypes.description: This is the application to complete for an existing business license that has changes, such as an address change, change of ownership, etc. If you have an Inside City Limits business license and are moving outside City limits, or vice versa, you will need to complete a new application. *This is not the correct option for business license renewals. Contact licensing@eurekaca.gov for assistance with renewals.*

recordTypes.name: Home Occupation Permit
recordTypes.description: A Home Occupation Permit can allow residents to conduct certain business and employment activities in their home, in a manner compatible with a residential setting.

recordTypes.name: Infill Incentive - Major
recordTypes.description: Allows deviations from development standards for projects which provide community benefits and/or public amenities. Infill Incentive Permits are discretionary actions intended to encourage high-quality infill development and/or the adaptive reuse of properties suitable for redevelopment.

recordTypes.name: Infill Incentive - Minor
recordTypes.description: Allows deviations from development standards for projects which provide community benefits and/or public amenities. Infill Incentive Permits are discretionary actions intended to encourage high-quality infill development and/or the adaptive reuse of properties suitable for redevelopment.

recordTypes.name: Lot Line Adjustment
recordTypes.description:
A Lot Line Adjustment is a minor movement of property lines between two, but no more than four adjoining lots. Lot Line Adjustments may also be used to correct minor trespasses (such as building over or too close to a property line) or to add acreage to a parcel for the owner’s convenience. When the property is located in the Coastal Zone, a Coastal Development Permit may be required.

State Law requires the City review Lot Line Adjustments to ensure the land taken from one lot is added to an adjacent lot, and that additional lots over and above the number of lots that originally existed, are created. The City also reviews the adjustment to determine that the resulting lots will conform to the City’s Zoning and Building Ordinances and that the adjustment will not cause an adverse impact on the neighborhood or the environment.

NOTE:  The following documents are REQUIRED for application submittal:
1. A preliminary Title Report (PTR) prepared by a Title Company. The PTR must have been prepared not more than six (6) months before the date the subdivision application is submitted to Development Services - Planning.
2. A Lot Line Adjustment Plan, prepared by a licensed Land Surveyor or a Civil Engineer licensed prior to 1982. The Tentative Parcel Map shall be clearly and legibly drawn.
3. A Topographic Survey.
4. The draft Legal Description of EACH resultant lot, prepared by a licensed Land Surveyor or a Civil Engineer licensed prior to 1982, and the portion(s) of land to be transferred in the grant deed (if separate owners).

recordTypes.name: Map Amendment
recordTypes.description:
The General Plan is the foundational policy document of the City of Eureka and consists of the the General Plan document, and the General Plan Map. The Zoning Code, consisting of the Zoning Code Text and Zoning Maps, implements the General Plan by establishing detailed regulations for land uses, structures, and activities in Eureka. All land uses, structures, and activities in Eureka must be consistent with the General Plan.

It may be in the public’s interest to amend either the General Plan, General Plan map, Zoning Code, or Zoning map, or a combination, to respond to the changing or evolving needs of the community.

recordTypes.name: Merger
recordTypes.description:
A Merger is the joining of two or more adjacent lots into one or more new lots. Mergers are subject to the provisions of the Subdivision Map Act and, when the property is located in the Coastal Zone, require a Coastal Development Permit.

NOTE:  The following documents are REQUIRED for application submittal:
1. A Merger Plan, prepared by a licensed Land Surveyor or a Civil Engineer licensed prior to 1982. The TMerger Plan shall be clearly and legibly drawn.
2. A preliminary Title Report (PTR) prepared by a Title Company. The PTR must have been prepared not more than six (6) months before the date the merger application is submitted to Development Services - Planning.
3. A Legal Description of the resultant lot(s), prepared by a licensed Land Surveyor or a Civil Engineer licensed prior to 1982.

recordTypes.name: Parking Indenture
recordTypes.description:
A Parking Indenture is a covenant record filed with the County Recorder guaranteeing that off-site parking will be maintained exclusively for a use for the duration of the use. 

The following documents are REQUIRED for application submittal:
1. A legal description of the property containing the use.
2. A legal description of the property where the off-site parking will be located.
The legal descriptions may be provided by submitting a copy of a recorded deed, or having the description prepared by a licensed Land Surveyor or a Civil Engineer licensed prior to 1982.

recordTypes.name: Project Modification
recordTypes.description: An application to modify an approved or conditionally approved project/application.

recordTypes.name: Public Places Naming
recordTypes.description: Eureka Municipal Code (EMC), Section 152.015, specifies the procedures for naming or renaming public facilities, including streets, buildings, parks, etc. The policy guidelines for naming or renaming support names which identify the location of the subject by reference to distinct geographic, environmental or development features in the immediate area; references the history of the subject site or its immediate area; identifies a person or family who made an extraordinary donation of land or funds to promote the construction or improvement of the subject public facility; or recognizes a person or family who made a distinct, significant contribution to the well-being of the city, including past mayors, councilmembers, board or commission members, officers, or employees of the city.

recordTypes.name: Real Property Conveyance
recordTypes.description: When the City of Eureka decides to acquire or dispose of real property and a General Plan has been adopted, California Government Code 65402 requires the City of Eureka Planning Commission to determine whether the location, purpose, and extent of the real property to be acquired or disposed conforms with the adopted general plan.  Once the determination is made, the City Council makes the ultimate decision on the conveyance of the real property.

recordTypes.name: Reasonable Accommodation Request
recordTypes.description: A Reasonable Accommodation Request in land use, zoning and building regulations provides persons with disabilities equal access to housing consistent with the Federal Fair Housing Act (42 U.S.C. §§ 3601 et seq.) and the California Fair Employment and Housing Act (Cal. Gov’t Code §§ 12955 et seq.). A reasonable accommodation is typically a ministerial adjustment to physical design standards to accommodate the placement of wheelchair ramps or other exterior modifications to a dwelling in response to the needs of a disabled resident.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit - Administrative
recordTypes.description: Administrative Sign Permits are required for all new signs, unless otherwise exempted by the zoning code.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit - Creative
recordTypes.description: A  Creative Sign Permit is a discretionary permit which can allow unique, high-quality signs which deviate from sign standards.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit - Master
recordTypes.description: A Master Sign Permit is a discretionary permit which can allow some deviations from sign standards for comprehensive and coordinated signs on large, complex, non-residential, multi-tenant sites.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision - Major
recordTypes.description:
A subdivision is the division of land for the purpose of sale, lease, or finance and is governed by state law and implemented by the City’s Subdivision Ordinance. The process of subdividing land applies to all subdividers regardless of the number of parcels and whether or not the land is improved. Minor, or Parcel Map, subdivisions involve four or fewer parcels. Major, or Final Map, subdivisions involve five or more parcels.

NOTE:  The following documents are REQUIRED for application submittal:
1. A Tentative Map, prepared by a licensed Land Surveyor or a Civil Engineer licensed prior to 1982. The Tentative Parcel Map shall be clearly and legibly drawn.
2. A preliminary Title Report (PTR) prepared by a Title Company. The PTR must have been prepared not more than six (6) months before the date the subdivision application is submitted to Development Services - Planning.
3. A preliminary Soils Report prepared in accordance with Chapter 70 of the Uniform Building Code. The soils report may be waived; please contact Development Services for a determination.
4. A preliminary Engineering Geology and/or Seismic Safety Report for a subdivision located within a “medium risk” or “high risk” geological hazard area.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision - Minor
recordTypes.description:
A subdivision is the division of land for the purpose of sale, lease, or finance and is governed by state law and implemented by the City’s Subdivision Ordinance. The process of subdividing land applies to all subdividers regardless of the number of parcels and whether or not the land is improved. Minor, or Parcel Map, subdivisions involve four or fewer parcels. Major, or Final Map, subdivisions involve five or more parcels.

NOTE:  The following documents are REQUIRED for application submittal:
1. A Tentative Parcel Map, prepared by a licensed Land Surveyor or a Civil Engineer licensed prior to 1982. The Tentative Parcel Map shall be clearly and legibly drawn.
2. A preliminary Title Report (PTR) prepared by a Title Company. The PTR must have been prepared not more than six (6) months before the date the subdivision application is submitted to Development Services - Planning.
3. A preliminary Soils Report prepared in accordance with Chapter 70 of the Uniform Building Code. The soils report may be waived; please contact Development Services for a determination.
4. A preliminary Engineering Geology and/or Seismic Safety Report for a subdivision located within a “medium risk” or “high risk” geological hazard area.

recordTypes.name: Text Amendment
recordTypes.description:
The General Plan is the foundational policy document of the City of Eureka and consists of the the General Plan document, and the General Plan Map. The Zoning Code, consisting of the Zoning Code Text and Zoning Maps, implements the General Plan by establishing detailed regulations for land uses, structures, and activities in Eureka. All land uses, structures, and activities in Eureka must be consistent with the General Plan.

It may be in the public’s interest to amend either the General Plan, General Plan map, Zoning Code, or Zoning map, or a combination, to respond to the changing or evolving needs of the community.

recordTypes.name: Tiny House on Wheels
recordTypes.description: A Tiny House on Wheels is allowed as an Accessory Dwelling Unit in any Inland residential zoning district.  One Tiny House on Wheels is allowed per lot, in lieu of one attached or detached Accessory Dwelling Unit, and must be located on a permanent foundation.

recordTypes.name: Tree Permit
recordTypes.description: A Tree Permit is required to relocate, remove, cutdown, top, reduce the crown by more than 20%, or undertake any other act that causes the destruction of a protected tree identified in 155.304.140.D, with a chest high diameter of 24"

recordTypes.name: Use and Coastal Development Permit
recordTypes.description:
The Coastal Act of 1976 established detailed policies for land use within the Coastal Zone, and charged local governments with the responsibility to incorporate these policies into their planning and zoning regulations. Generally, the Coastal Act sets forth regulations which require the City to process Coastal Development Permits for all proposed development in the Coastal Zone. The Coastal Act, as well as the City’s Local Coastal Program, provide for exemptions and exclusions for certain types of projects. 

Use permits are required for land uses which are generally appropriate within a zoning district, but where the potential impacts of the use on a site and its surroundings must be evaluated, and conditions of approval may be needed. Use permits are discretionary actions which enable the city to ensure a proposed use is consistent with the General Plan and will not create negative impacts to adjacent properties or the general public.

Before you complete this application, please contact Development Service-Planning to determine whether your project requires both a Use Permit and a Coastal Development Permit, or if you are eligible for an exemption or exclusion from a Coastal Development Permit, and whether other permits or reviews are required.

recordTypes.name: Use Permit
recordTypes.description: Use permits are required for land uses which are generally appropriate within a zoning district, but where the potential impacts of the use on a site and its surroundings must be evaluated, and conditions of approval may be needed. Use permits are discretionary actions which enable the city to ensure a proposed use is consistent with the General Plan and will not create negative impacts to adjacent properties or the general public.

recordTypes.name: Vacation Dwelling Unit (Coastal)
recordTypes.description: A Vacation Dwelling Unit is the rental of an entire dwelling unit in the Coastal Zone, for a period not to exceed 30 consecutive days. All Vacation Dwelling Unit operators are required to obtain a Business License, pay quarterly Transient Occupancy Tax to the City, and have the Vacation Rental inspected by the Building Department. A Home Occupation Permit, Use Permit, or Coastal Development Permit may also be required. Department Staff can assist in determining which permits are required.

recordTypes.name: Vacation Rental No Proprietor On-site and Minor Use Permit (Inland)
recordTypes.description:
A Vacation Rental with No Proprietor On-site is the rental of an entire dwelling unit, for a period not to exceed 30 consecutive days, without the proprietor in residence on-site during any portion of the duration of the rental. All Vacation Rental operators are required to obtain a Business License, pay quarterly Transient
Occupancy Tax to the City, and have the Vacation Rental inspected by the Building Department. A Home Occupation Permit may also be required. Vacation Rentals with No Proprietor On-site for the duration of the rental require a Minor Use Permit.

recordTypes.name: Vacation Rental Proprietor On-Site (Inland)
recordTypes.description: A Vacation Rental Proprietor On-site is the rental of an entire dwelling unit, or any portion of a dwelling unit, for a period not to exceed 30 consecutive days, with the proprietor in residence on-site during the entire duration of the rental. All Vacation Rental operators are required to obtain a Business License, pay quarterly Transient Occupancy Tax to the City, and have the Vacation Rental inspected by the Building Department. A Home Occupation Permit may also be required. Department Staff can assist in determining which permits are required.

recordTypes.name: Variance (Coastal)
recordTypes.description:
A Variance is a discretionary approval that allows for deviation from physical development standards in the Zoning Code. The City may grant a Variance only when the strict application of development standards creates a unique hardship due to unusual circumstances associated with the property. 

The City may grant a Variance to allow for deviation from any physical development standard that applies         to the subject property. Examples of physical development standards include height, setbacks, open         space, floor area ratio (FAR), and off-street parking requirements.

A Variance may not be granted to:
a. Permit a use other than a use permitted in the zoning district as specified in Eureka Municipal Code Chapter 155 Article 2 (Zoning District Standards);
b. Allow deviation from a requirement of the General Plan (e.g., maximum residential density in zoning district); and
c. Allow deviations to Zoning Code standards to reduce construction costs.

recordTypes.name: Variance (Inland)
recordTypes.description:
A Variance is a discretionary approval that allows for deviation from physical development standards in the Zoning Code. The City may grant a Variance only when the strict application of development standards creates a unique hardship due to unusual circumstances associated with the property. 

The City may grant a Variance to allow for deviation from any physical development standard that applies         to the subject property. Examples of physical development standards include height, setbacks, open         space, floor area ratio (FAR), and off-street parking requirements.

A Variance may not be granted to:
a. Permit a use other than a use permitted in the zoning district as specified in Eureka Municipal Code Chapter 155 Article 2 (Zoning District Standards);
b. Allow deviation from a requirement of the General Plan (e.g., maximum residential density in zoning district); and
c. Allow deviations to Zoning Code standards to reduce construction costs.

recordTypes.name: Encroachment Permit
recordTypes.description: A City of El Segundo Public Works Department Encroachment Permit is a permit that must be obtained prior to commencement of any activities affecting the public right-of-way (area outside private property line) or a dedicated public easement. These activities include, but are not limited to: excavation, sewer lateral repairs, street improvements, utilities, street closures, traffic control, construction equipment, temporary barricades and scaffolding, landscaping, tree trimming, etc. An encroachment permit assures that the City's public right-of-way work is done in a safe, correct way per standards and that the work zone shall be restored in a timely manner.

recordTypes.description:

recordTypes.name: Cultural Development Program
recordTypes.description:
The Cultural Development Program was initially established in November 2019, with
the adoption of Ordinance No. 1594, amending Title 15 of the El Segundo Municipal
Code (ESMC) to establish the Public Art or In-Lieu Fee Requirement and a Cultural
Development Fund. As originally adopted, the requirement applied to specific
commercial and industrial developments with a project valuation exceeding
$2,000,000.

On April 1st, 2025, the El Segundo City Council adopted Ordinance No. 1671, amending
Title 15 of the ESMC to allowing for a combination of providing both on-site public art
and in-lieu fee to satisfy the Cultural Development Program requirement.

recordTypes.name: *Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
Residential Building Permits for Express as well as Plan Check Projects.

Express Projects include:
- Residential Solar Permits from Solar APP+

- Re-Roof, Re-Pipe, Re-Stucco

All Non-Express projects will require Plan Check from the appropriate Departments.

recordTypes.description: Building permits are required any time a building or structure is erected, constructed, enlarged, altered, repaired, moved, improved, removed, converted or demolished.

recordTypes.name: Entertainment Permit
recordTypes.description:
Any person conducting, operating, owning, or in control of any premises open to the public, or private club within the city to allow any entertainment including dancing, upon the premises, or in or upon any adjoining room or premises, must obtain an Entertainment Permit. The application fee required by this section is established to cover part of the cost of the investigation and processing of applications and is not refundable. 
Exemptions: An entertainment permit shall not be required of any bona fide nonprofit organization. An entertainment permit shall not be required of any person in connection with the use of city property, unless such property is leased for a period which exceeds seven (7) consecutive days.

recordTypes.name: Water Will-Serve
recordTypes.description: For development projects, an applicant is required to submit a Will-Serve Application to Public Works regarding their anticipated water demand and sewer generation rate.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Water Meters

recordTypes.name: Design Permit
recordTypes.description: A Design Permit ensures excellence in site planning, architectural design, and consistency with the general plan. A design permit allows for new development or changes in permitted uses in the perspective zoning district.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use Permit
recordTypes.description: As determined by the specific zoning district, some uses require a Conditional Use Permit (CUP). The CUP application requires public notice and is approved by the Planning Commission through a Public Hearing. Applicants interested in Minor Use Permits and Temporary Conditional Use Permits should also use this application.

recordTypes.name: Oversize/Overweight Transportation Permit
recordTypes.description: For oversize/overweight loads coming into or through the City of American Canyon.

recordTypes.name: Residential Express Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This is for small, non-structural projects that don't require formal construction plans or a lengthy plan review, allowing for same-day or quick issuance. Examples include like-for-like replacements for re-roofing,  water heater, electrical work, window replacement and HVAC.

recordTypes.name: Preliminary Application
recordTypes.description: A Preliminary Application (Pre-App) is a great way to solicit information from City Staff regarding a proposed project. The Pre-App can include an informational meeting with multiple City Departments for preliminary direction on a project. No formal action is taken.

recordTypes.name: Major Modification
recordTypes.description: The purpose of the Major Modification is to provide for major modifications to previously approved plans or permits, based on the degree of change from an approved plan or permit. A Major Modification requires public notice and is approved by the Planning Commission through a public hearing.

recordTypes.name: Fire District Permit
recordTypes.description: Fire Sprinkler, Fire Alarm and

recordTypes.name: Minor Modification
recordTypes.description: The purpose of the Minor Modification is to provide for minor modifications to previously approved plans or permits, based on the degree of change from a previously approved plan or permit. A Minor Modification is approved administratively by the Community Development Director.

recordTypes.name: Grading Permit
recordTypes.description: For certain development projects, an applicant is required to submit a Grading Permit Application to Public Works.

recordTypes.name: Address Assignment Request
recordTypes.description: Use this form to request the assignment of an address to your project. Note that addresses will only be assigned when new development or alteration work is proposed.

recordTypes.name: Appeal Form
recordTypes.description: Select this application to make an appeal to decisions made by the Community Development Director or the Planning Commission.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Fence Permit
recordTypes.description: A Conditional Fence Permit allows a maximum 2½-foot increase over the Zoning Ordinance fence height regulations in residential zoning districts.

recordTypes.name: General Plan / Specific Plan / Zoning Ordinance / Zoning Map Amendment
recordTypes.description: This application allows an applicant to propose a General Plan, Specific Plan, Zoning Ordinance, or Zoning Map amendment.  A preliminary application is highly recommended before beginning this application.

recordTypes.name: Landscape Plan
recordTypes.description: The Landscape Plan is a planting and irrigation plan for a project site. "Landscape area" means all the planting areas, turf areas, and water features in a landscape design plan, subject to the maximum applied water allowance calculation.

recordTypes.name: Lot Line Adjustment / Lot Merger
recordTypes.description: A Lot Merger is required when two or more parcels of real property may be merged by the Planning Commission when specific conditions are met. A Lot Line Adjustment (LLA) is a transfer of land between two or more existing adjacent parcels, where the land taken from one parcel is added to an adjacent parcel, and where a greater number of parcels than originally existed is not thereby created.

recordTypes.name: Pre-Zoning / Rezoning
recordTypes.description: The pre-zoning/ rezoning application is required for the development of a new zone or to make amendments to an existing zone.

recordTypes.name: Seasonal Sales Permit
recordTypes.description: A seasonal sales permit is required for outdoor sales of seasonal agricultural products.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit / Program
recordTypes.description: A sign permit or sign program is required for new or modified signs in the City.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Mobile Structure Permit
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Trailer Permit (TTP) is required prior to placing any temporary trailer on private property.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Outdoor Promotion
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Outdoor Promotion (TOP) Permit is for an outdoor commercial event of limited duration, such as grand openings, outdoor sales, and seasonal promotions, occurring on nonresidential, private property.

recordTypes.name: Tentative Parcel/ Subdivision Map
recordTypes.description: A Tentative Parcel Map is filed for the division into four (4) or fewer residential lots or non-residential subdivisions. A Tentative Subdivision Map is filed for the division into five (5) or more lots.

recordTypes.name: Variance / Minor Variation
recordTypes.description: Variances may be granted in order to prevent or to lessen practical difficulties and unnecessary physical hardships that would result from strict or literal interpretation and enforcement of certain regulations of Zoning Code.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter
recordTypes.description: Staff can provide a zoning verification letter for inquiries into a property’s zoning and development standards.

recordTypes.description: Encroachment permits are required for construction work in the sidewalk area, in an easement, on City owned property (median islands, parks, city facilities) or in the street. Common reasons you would need one: Utility Saw-cuts, Excavation, Bicycle Racks Sidewalk Dining, Debris Boxes, Fences/Walls, Construction Staging

recordTypes.name: Hydrant Flow Request
recordTypes.description: A fire flow request is a request to perform a fire flow test to determine the maximum water flow rate a water distribution system can deliver. Fire flow tests are typically requested by engineers, developers, contractors, fire-suppression sprinkler companies, and/or insurance companies. Fire flow tests provide actual pressure and flow data measured at specific fire hydrants. This data can be used for fire-protection, sprinkler design, and sizing of domestic/fire service lines.

recordTypes.description: This form is used by the public to request a new address assignment(s) where new or revised addresses assignments are necessary due to new or altered development projects, housing units such as ADUs, or new tenant spaces in existing buildings.

recordTypes.name: Plaza Use Application
recordTypes.description: A Plaza Use Permit is required when a person or organization has intent to organize a gathering/event and wants to reserve a specific section of the Plaza for such use. Plaza Use Permits are also required when the organizer has intent to utilize vendors (not limited too caterers, transportation, party rental companies) on public property, sell, peddle, instruct, or distribute any merchandise within the Plaza.  Additional examples of when a Plaza Use permit is required: use of amplified music, use of a barbeque, and plans to monetize the public space in anyway.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit
recordTypes.description: A Building Permit is required for buildings, structures, equipment, facilities, electrical, gas, mechanical and plumbing systems and other constructed improvements that are regulated by the California Building Standards Code and that are proposed to be constructed, erected, enlarged, installed, altered, repaired, moved, demolished,  removed, converted or replaced; or if a change of the use or occupancy of a building or structure is proposed; or if anyone causes any such work to be done.

recordTypes.name: Historic Resource Evaluation
recordTypes.description: A Historic Resource Evaluation (HRE) is required for all primary and detached accessory structures over 45 years old and is to be prepared by a qualified architectural historian. The HRE shall evaluate the potential significance of the existing structures and their eligibility for listing on the Local, California, and/or National Register. The HRE or peer review shall be prepared by a qualified architectural historian selected and retained by the City. This application is only for properties without a proposed project that are planning to conduct the HRE or Peer Review prior to submitting a Uniform Application for Design Review. For structures determined to be eligible for listing, a secondary review shall be conducted during the Uniform Application - Design Review process for compliance with the Secretary of the Interior's Standards.

Additional examples of when a Depot Park Use permit is required: use of amplified music, use of a barbeque, and plans to monetize the public space in anyway.

recordTypes.description: Express Building Permits are for residential (no multi-family) projects that do not require plan review before permit is issued. Reroof, HVAC Replacement, Water Heater Replacement, Window/Door Replacement, Bathroom & Kitchen Remodels, Electric Vehicle Chargers, Temp Power Poles, Electrical Panel Replacement, and Siding Repair/Replacement. Please review the submittal requirements and limitations by clicking 'select'.

• Residential or Commercial: HVAC Equipment Replacement - Needing Planning Approval
• Residential: Gas Fireplace Insert
• Residential or Commercial: Water Heater Replacement - Needing Planning Approval
• Residential or Commercial: Conversion to Heat Pump or Tankless Water Heater
• Residential or Commercial: Window & Door Replacements - Needing Planning Approval
• Residential or Commercial: Siding Repair or Replacement - Needing Planning Approval
• Residential: Swimming Pool and/or Spa
• Commercial: Sign
• Residential or Commercial: Awning

recordTypes.description: Local public, non-profit, or not-for-profit organizations are eligible to sponsor banners. Applications may also be accepted from for-profit organizations to promote philanthropic events that generate financial support for local community organizations. Applications for banners that are determined to be inconsistent with the goals of the banner policy will not be approved.  All banner application i.e. the specific artwork is subject to review and approval by the Design Review and Historic Preservation Commission.

recordTypes.name: Sonoma's Tuesday Night Market Sponsorship Contract
recordTypes.description:
Sonoma's Tuesday Night Market is a cherished community event that runs every Tuesday evening May through the end of September.  This event is one of the number one attractions in Sonoma Valley attracting over 2,000 individuals  each evening.  The Tuesday night market brings fresh fruits and vegetables to the community through its certified farmers market, as well as some amazing artisan package foods.  Each Tuesday night the community comes out to celebrate being Sonoma with live music, coordinated by Sonoma Music and Sonoma Jazz Society.  

By sponsoring the market you can get your company, product, brand in front of this very dynamic group of attendees. The market partners with over 30 different local non-profits each year. The market has a comprehensive marketing campaign partnering with both the Sonoma Valley Chamber of Commerce and the Sonoma Valley Visitors Bureau.  

Don't miss out on your chance to be a market sponsor!

recordTypes.name: Design Change Application
recordTypes.description: This application form is used ONLY for design changes that do not increase or add to the existing scope of work covered under an existing permit. Changes in the design that add or increase the scope or valuation of work covered under a permit will require a new (separate) permit application. When approved plans for an issued building permit were prepared by a registered design professional, all proposed design changes for those portions of the plans must be designed and prepared by a registered design professional.  THIS RECORD IS ONLY USED IF THERE IS AN EXISTING ACTIVE BUILDING PERMIT FOR THE SUBJECT WORK.

recordTypes.name: SolarAPP+ Solar Permit
recordTypes.description:
Expedited Solar Permitting is available through the SolarAPP+ program, a collaboration between the National Renewable Energy Laboratory (NREL) and local communities.

SolarAPP+ is an automated plan review process for permitting new residential rooftop solar and storage systems that result in nearly instantaneous permitting. SolarAPP+ lowers permit costs and expedites solar installations.

If you are a licensed contractor, you must register with SolarAPP+ to utilize the process. 
Non-licensed individuals and owner-builders may not use the SolarAPP+ process and instead must apply for a Limited Scope Building Permit or a regular Building Permit (which require normal plan reviews).

After registering, applying for, and obtaining approval of a  SolarAPP+ plan review, contractors must apply for a SolarAPP+ Solar Permit with the City of Sonoma (directly from this location).

The application for the City's SolarAPP+ Solar Permit requires SolarAPP+ Approval Documents. If you don't already have the SolarAPP+ Approval Documents (which includes a AloarAPP+ Approval ID), you can learn how to get one at solarapp.nrel.gov.

You will be asked to log into your City of Sonoma Online Services account or register for an account if you do not have one.

recordTypes.description: A Wine Tasting Use Permit is required for all wine tasting facilities and wine bars in the City. Only 25 WTUPs will be issued within the Plaza Retail Overlay District (PROD).

recordTypes.name: Housing Development Project Pre-Application (SB 330)
recordTypes.description: California Senate Bill 330, "The Housing Crisis Act of 2019" ("Act") became effective on January 1, 2020. The Act allows for an applicant to submit this Preliminary Application to vest development rights upon the date of application for a period of 180 days. The Act applies to housing development projects and is intended to streamline discretionary review under local zoning laws.

recordTypes.description: This applications is for activities that are expected to take place on City/Public property including streets and sidewalks. In some cases events on private property that may impact public property or special services will requires a special event permit. To be safe, always check with the team to ensure you are thinking of everything that might impact your events success (203) 977-4979.

recordTypes.name: Annual Food Establishment License
recordTypes.description: Any fixed or mobile restaurant, industrial feeding establishment, catering kitchen, commissary, food vending machine location or similar place where food or drink is prepared for sale or service on the premises  shall apply for an Annual Food Establishment License. Please be advised, licenses are not transferable and a valid license shall be posted in every food service establishment.

recordTypes.name: Annual Retail Food Store License
recordTypes.description: Annual Retail Food Store license is a requirement of the Stamford Department of Health & Human Services. A retail food store establishment is a place that sells food products directly to consumers as its primary function. A retail food store establishment includes grocery stores, convenience stores, and vending machine locations. Please be advised, licenses are non-transferable and a valid license shall be posted in every retail food store establishment.

recordTypes.name: Assisted Living License
recordTypes.description: Please be advised, the name of applicant for this Assisted Living License will appear on this license once issued.

recordTypes.name: Plan Review Cosmetology & Massage
recordTypes.description:
Prior approval must be obtained from the City of Stamford, Department of Health & Human Services, for any changes or additions to the establishment and/or services.

A Plan Review for Cosmetology services is required for all establishments prior to receiving a valid City of Stamford, Department of Health issued License.  

Plan Review Submission Inventory Form/Guide is available at stamfordct.gov.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this form to obtain a demolition permit.

recordTypes.name: Cosmetology License
recordTypes.description:
No person shall maintain or operate any barbershop or hairdressing and/or cosmetology shop without having a valid license issued by the Director of Health. All licenses are valid for one (1) year or a portion thereof and are renewable each year on or before July 1 of each year. The chief corporation officer shall be designated for service in the event of a corporation. 
Transferring of licenses without going through the Change of Ownership process and prior approval from the Department of Health will be subject to Closure of Establishment.

recordTypes.name: Fire Alarm System Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this form to obtain a fire alarm system permit.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Apartment Occupancy
recordTypes.description: The City of Stamford requires that apartment buildings with 4 or more units secure individual Certificates of Apartment Occupancy per City of Stamford Code (Chapter 146 Section 33) states: No rent shall be recoverable by the owner or lessor of such apartment house for the occupation of any apartment for which a Certificate of Apartment for which a Certificate of Apartment Occupancy has not been obtained prior to the rental thereof in violation of Subsection (b) of this section.

recordTypes.name: Change or Dissolution of Business
recordTypes.description: The Department of Health & Human Services request that business owners complete a Change or Dissolution of Business application which may effect the department's licensing & permitting processes. This application shall be for persons changing ownership, business name, equipment and/or layout, as well as dissolution of business.

recordTypes.name: Plan Review Food Establishments
recordTypes.description: The Stamford Department of Health Environmental Inspections Division requires that a plan review application be completed for all new and remodeled food service establishments. This application will assist in determining the safety and compliance of all food service establishments.

recordTypes.description: Use this form to obtain a fire suppression permit.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this form to obtain an electrical permit.

recordTypes.name: General Plan Request
recordTypes.description: Request for Septic Plans, Well Completion reports and Maps must be submitted to the Stamford Department of Health Environmental Inspections Division. Request will be reviewed and completed within 3 - 5 business after submission.

recordTypes.name: Hotel/Motel License
recordTypes.description: Chapter 146, Section 34 of the Stamford City Code requires all owners or operators of hotels and motels in the City of Stamford to apply for and receive an annual license from the Department of Health. Your license period runs from July 1, 2020 thru June 30, 2021.  Additionally, The Stamford Board of Representatives has mandated, by ordinance, a Hotel/Motel License fee of three hundred and fifty dollars ($350.00), plus eighty five ($85.00) per hotel/motel unit. For any hotel owned by any person, firm, corporation, joint venture, or other legal entity that is exempt from income tax liability, pursuant to Section 501 (c) (3) of the Internal Revenue Code, the applicable licensing fees shall be two hundred and fifty dollars ($250.00), plus thirty dollars ($30.00) per hotel/motel unit.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this form to obtain a plumbing permit.

recordTypes.name: Lead Abatement Plan for Residential Dwellings
Massage Establishment License
recordTypes.description:
Annual license application is required per resolution No. 4019 of the City of Stamford BO
person, shall engage in the practice of massage or massage therapy unless he or she has obtained a license from the State Department of Public Health to practice massage therapy as provided in Chapter 844a, sections 20-206a et seq. of the Connecticut General Statutes, as amended, and is a Connecticut Licensed Massage Therapist. No person shall engage in, conduct or carry on, or permit to be engaged in, conducted or carried on, in or upon any premises in the City of Stamford, the operation of a massage establishment without first having obtained a permit from the Director of Health after screening by and approval from the City of Stamford Police Department. Each applicant for a permit to operate a massage establishment shall file an application with the Director of Health and pay a filing fee in an amount set by a Resolution of the Board of Representatives.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: Use this form to obtain a mechanical/HVAC system permit.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Establishment License
recordTypes.description: See Stamford Municipal Code Regarding Mobile Food Establishments. This permit is required under State of CT Public Health Code AND City of Stamford local Ordinance for food sales.  The City of Stamford Local Ordinance also requires you to obtain a permit to vend from the Cashiering & Permitting Department (203) 977-4979.

recordTypes.name: Multiple Family Dwelling License
recordTypes.description: Chapter 146, Section 34 of the Stamford City Code requires all owners or operators of Multiple Family Dwellings in the City of Stamford to apply for and receive an annual license from the Department of Health. Your license will expire on December 31st of each year.  A new License is required on January 1st annually.  Additionally, Chapter 146, Section 33 of the Stamford City Code mandates certification of all vacated apartments as fit for occupancy when the structure becomes fifteen years old and contains four or more apartments.  If your structure falls into this category, be sure to complete an application for Certification of Apartment Occupancy (CAO) each time one of the apartments is vacated.  Under Chapter 146, Section 33B of the Stamford City Code, it is illegal to rent an apartment without a CAO, if one is needed.  The fee for each CAO inspection is $75.00 which must  accompany any CAO Application.

recordTypes.name: Public Pool License
recordTypes.description: Public pools. The following requirements shall apply to any public pool. (a) Definitions. (1) "Public Pool" means an artificial basin constructed of concrete, steel, fiberglass or other relatively impervious material intended for recreational bathing, swimming, diving, or therapeutic purposes which is located either indoors or outdoors and is provided with a controlled water supply and which is not used or intended to be used as a pool at a single family residence. The term also includes a pool located at a single family residence which is used or intended to be used for commercial or business purposes. The term "public pool" includes any related equipment, structures, areas, and enclosures that are intended for the use of the pool patrons or pool staff such as toilet, dressing, locker, shower, and pool equipment rooms. See link below for complete public health code on pools. https://portal.ct.gov/-/media/Departments-and-Agencies/DPH/dph/environmental_health/recreation/pdf/1913b33bpdf.pdf

recordTypes.name: Refuse Trucks License
recordTypes.description: The Stamford Department of Health, Environmental Health and Inspections Division, regulates the installation of Subsurface Sewage Disposal Systems (SSDS), otherwise known as septic systems.  Providing plan review, site evaluation and final inspections on newly installed systems, the department permits only correctly installed SSDS's thus ensuring the Public Health. The regulations for SSDS installation are in the Public Health Code of the State of Connecticut, §19-13-B100a; §19-13-B103; the Technical Standards, (pursuant to §19-13-B103); and the Design Manual, Subsurface Sewage Disposal Systems for Households and Small Commercial Buildings.

recordTypes.name: Rooming House License
recordTypes.description: Chapter 146, Section 33 of the Stamford City Code requires all owners or operators of rooming houses in the City of Stamford to apply for and receive an annual license from the Department of Health. Your license period runs from July 1, 2020 thru June 30, 2021. Additionally, Chapter 146, Section 33 of the Stamford City Code mandates certification of all vacated apartments as fit for occupancy when the structure becomes fifteen years old and contains four or more apartments.  If your structure falls into this category, be sure to complete an application for Certification of Apartment Occupancy (CAO) each time one of the apartments is vacated.  Under Chapter 146, Section 33B of the Stamford City Code, it is illegal to rent an apartment without a CAO, if one is needed.  The fee for each CAO inspection is $75.00 which must  accompany any CAO Application. Please note: Chapter 146-40 Bedding. The operator of every rooming house shall change supplied bed linen and towels therein at least once each week and prior to the letting of any room to any occupant.  The operator shall be responsible for the maintenance of all supplied bedding in a clean and sanitary manner.

recordTypes.name: Septic Permit (Subsurface Sewage Disposal System, Soil Testing)
Septic Truck License
recordTypes.description: The Stamford Department of Health, Environmental Health and Inspections Division, regulates the installation of Subsurface Sewage Disposal Systems (SSDS), otherwise known as septic systems.  Providing plan review, site evaluation and final inspections on newly installed systems, the department permits only correctly installed SSDS's thus ensuring the Public Health. The regulations for SSDS installation are in the Public Health Code of the State of Connecticut, §19-13-B100a; §19-13-B103; the Technical Standards, (pursuant to §19-13-B103); and the Design Manual, Subsurface Sewage Disposal Systems for Households and Small Commercial Buildings.

recordTypes.name: Taximeter
recordTypes.description: The Sealer of Weights and Measures of the Stamford Department of Health annually inspects the devices used for commercial weighing and measuring. The devices are tested to ensure that they are appropriate for the intended use. The Environmental Inspections Division also enforces the regulations/laws pertaining to Weights & Measures and also responds to Consumer Complaints alleging short measure of weights or overcharges. Licenses for the devices inspected are issued and are valid for one year from January 1st to December 31st. Applications not received by December 31st are subject to a $90.00 fine for each day that it is late. An application must be completed in its entirety to ensure proper account credit. For questions regarding Weights and Measures activities, call (203) 977-4391.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Service Event License
recordTypes.description: Temporary Food Service Event Licenses must be obtained 2 - 3 weeks prior to the start date of events. Licenses for Temporary events are non-transferrable between persons nor locations.  Licensing terms are for the duration of 14 day increments.

Licenses for the devices inspected are issued and are valid for one year from January 1st to December 31st. Applications not received by December 31st are subject to a $90.00 fine for each day that it is late. An application must be completed in its entirety to ensure proper account credit. For questions regarding Weights and Measures activities, call (203) 977-4391.

Licenses for the devices inspected are issued and are valid for one year from January 1st to December 31st. Applications not received by December 31st are subject to a $90.00 fine for each day that it is late. An application must be completed in its entirety to ensure proper account credit. For questions regarding Weights and Measures activities, call (203) 977-4976.

recordTypes.name: Complaint
recordTypes.description: By using this section you can submit complaints relating to housing, blight, zoning, building code, streets, and sidewalks. If you do not have an address please be as specific as possible. You may use cross street names or telephone pole numbers to verify the location, along with building descriptions to assist staff in locating the area or property. Pictures of the complaint are also encouraged. These can be uploaded in the complaint form.

recordTypes.name: Temporary / Special Event - All Department Notice Form
recordTypes.description:
Temporary events include all organized municipal, civic, and private events which are temporary, non-reoccurring in any one calendar year, and last only one or two days, are open to the public, and not customarily associated with the primary use of the property.  Examples are, but not limited to a fair or carnival, a car show, block party, circus, craft fare, parade, festival, fishing derby,
race (walking, running, boat or bicycle), etc....

recordTypes.name: FOG Permit Application-NEW Food Preparation Establishments Fats, Oils & Grease
recordTypes.description:
The State of Connecticut has established a general permit for food preparation establishments (FPES) to meet compliance requirements for the discharge of fats, oils, and grease.

If you operate a Class III or IV Food Preparation Establishment (FPE) and you discharge to the Norwich sanitary sewer system, you must comply with the General Permit for the Discharge of Wastewater Associated with FPE.

For more information, visit our website at https://norwichpublicutilities.com/residential/polices/

recordTypes.name: ZONING - Letter of Zoning Compliance
recordTypes.description: Upon request the Zoning Officer will provide a Letter of Zoning Compliance. Based on the information on file, the letter will contain the specifics regarding the property and the zone in which it is located. It will state if the use is conforming or existing non-conforming and if the lot coverage, setbacks, parking, etc. are conforming or not. We will check the electronic and paper files for any open ZONING violations and will address only Zoning violations. Any liens on the property will be on file in the City Clerk's office. A letter of zoning compliance is not a substitute for a proper title search and should not be used as an FOI request. Documents will not be attached to a letter of zoning compliance.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: For the install, erect, enlarge, alter, repair, remove, convert or replace any electrical system or part thereof.  This includes but limited to electrical services, circuits, receptacles, light fixtures, low voltage, main breakers, disconnects and other devices.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: Permits for new, replacement, repair or modification of mechanical systems, equipment and venting. Includes like for like replacements of boilers or furnaces. Some installs will require both mechanical and electrical permits such as mini-split systems.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Permit (Commercial or Residential, New/Replace/Repair)
recordTypes.description: A Sewer Permit is required for new connections to the City of Norwich sanitary sewer system and repairs to existing sewer connections.

recordTypes.name: ZONING - Commercial & Business Zoning Verification - Including Home Business
recordTypes.description: This application is required to verify conformity of buildings and land (use, location and occupancy) for new commercial uses, including changes in ownership of existing businesses, and home occupations. This record is in addition to any zoning permits required for site work, conversions, new construction, or additions to existing structures.

recordTypes.name: Water Permit (Commercial or Residential, New/Replace/Repair)
recordTypes.description: A Water Permit is required for new connections to the City of Norwich water distribution system and repairs to existing water services.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing and/or Gas Permit
recordTypes.description:
Permit for new, replacement, repair or modification of plumbing systems, equipment and fixtures. Includes like for like replacements of water heaters, sinks or other fixtures.  Installing new, extending or repairing gas lines or tanks(without installing equipment)

* For work on sewer or water lines from the street to the house a plumbing permit is not required. NPU has permits for new or repairs to existing water and sewer lines from the house to the street. Link to NPU permits https://norwichct.portal.opengov.com/categories/1080

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit to demolish any building, structure or part thereof.  Major contractors license, Home Improvement Contractor Registration, or New Home Builder Registration does NOT take the place of a demo license or include demolition. There shall be no subcontracting of demolition operations unless the subcontractor possesses a proper demolition certificate. Demolition permit are valid for 30 days from date of issue

recordTypes.name: Hydrant Meter/Backflow Request
recordTypes.description:
Applications and payment must be submitted prior to installation.
Installation is available only Tue-Thu
Devices may NOT be removed or relocated by a contractor. NPU must be contacted to remove/replace/relocate the device. Applicable fees will apply.

recordTypes.name: ZONING - Lot Line Revision or Free Split
BLD - Fire Protection Systems Permit (Sprinklers, Commercial Kitchen Hood, Alarm Systems, ETC...)
recordTypes.description: Required for Fire Alarm System, Commercial Kitchen Hood, Hood Suppression Systems, Sprinkler - Commercial, Sprinkler - Residential 1-2 Family, Sprinkler - Residential 3 Family and Above

recordTypes.name: Zoning Permit
recordTypes.description: This application is required for, but not limited to the following:  new buildings, additions, pools, fences, sheds, garages (attached or detached), change of use, conversions, green houses, barns and other accessory structures, new driveways or parking lots, or the reconstruction of driveways and parking lots.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Installation-Event-Occupancy Permit (Tents, Construction Trailers, Staging, Fairs, Carnavals, ETC..)
recordTypes.description: Carnivals, fairs, weddings, parties or other events. Temp trailers for construction, staging or similar.

recordTypes.name: Annual Maintenance Permit
recordTypes.description:
An annual service permit may be issued for work involving the minor repair, refurbishing, or replacement of parts of the building service systems, not affecting life safety or life safety systems. Examples include:
* repairs or replacement of electrical equipment/devices performed on load side of meter,
*repairs or replacement of plumbing, piping and related equipment/devices/fixtures on distribution side of water meter,
*repairs or replacement of ductwork, coils, evaporators and related equipment and controllers with items which are of equal rating, load capacity, voltage, size, etc., as applicable.

IWWCC - Inland Wetlands and Watercourses Application

recordTypes.description: Required for individual vendors for seasonal sales and businesses selling fireworks/sparklers in stores

recordTypes.description: Motor Vehicle Location Approval.

categories.content: By using this section you can submit complaints relating to housing, blight, zoning, building code, streets, and sidewalks. If you do not have an address please be as specific as possible. You may use cross street names or telephone pole numbers to verify the location, along with building descriptions to assist staff in locating the area or property. Pictures of the complaint are also encouraged. These can be uploaded in the complaint form.

Right of Way License
recordTypes.description: A Town Right-of-Way License is required for issuance of a Right-of-Way Permit or Sanitary Sewer Permit from the Town Engineering Division.  This license requires a $10,000 Right-of-Way Bond and a current insurance certificate that provides the required minimum coverage and waiver of subrogation as per the Town's insurance requirements. This license expires annually on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: Food Service License Application
recordTypes.description: For annual licensure of public food service establishments

recordTypes.name: A Residential Building Application & One and Two Family Dwelling Only (for apt's or condo use Commercial Bldg)
recordTypes.description: The CT State Building Code requires building permits to construct, alter, or renovate any structure, building or mechanical, electrical or plumbing in compliance with the minimum standards of the CT State Building Code, and in accordance with the approved plans and specifications submitted with your application.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Service License Application
recordTypes.description: PLEASE NOTE: Food Service Applications are due in the Health Dept. no later than two weeks before the start of an event.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit General
recordTypes.description: The CT State Building Code requires building permits to construct, alter, or renovate any structure, building or mechanical, electrical or plumbing in compliance with the minimum standards of the CT State Building Code, and in accordance with the approved plans and specifications submitted with your application.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way Permit
recordTypes.description: Right-of-Way Permits are required for any excavation work performed within the Town Right-of-Way.  The Town right-of-way width varies for each street and includes both the roadway as well as abutting land that is designated for public use, such as for utilities and sidewalks.

Salon Permits are valid from July 1st through June 30th

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: The CT State Building Code requires building permits to construct, alter, or renovate any structure, building or mechanical, electrical or plumbing, or fire protection systems in compliance with the minimum standards of the CT State Building Code, and in accordance with the approved plans and specifications submitted with your application.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: The CT State Building Code requires building permits to construct, alter, or renovate any structure, building or mechanical, electrical or plumbing, or automatic fire sprinkler systems, in compliance with the minimum standards of the CT State Building Code, and in accordance with the approved plans and specifications submitted with your application.

recordTypes.name: Subsurface Sewage Disposal System
recordTypes.description: Approvals to Construct shall be issued by the Local Director of Health or Registered Sanitarian.

recordTypes.name: Water Treatment Wastewater Disposal System
recordTypes.description:
Permit expires one year from date of issuance if construction fails to start with the one year period. Fee 
is non-refundable. The installer shall provide 24 hours minimum notice to the Health Department prior 
to commencement of installation.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
The CT State Building Code requires building permits to construct, alter, or renovate any structure or building in compliance with the minimum standards of the CT State Building Code and in accordance with the approved plans and specifications submitted with your application. 

Commercial Building Permits must have architectural plans showing elevations, floor plans, and structural design specifications and elevation grades. Plans for tenant spaces in buildings over 5000 square feet must have the seal of a design professional, registered in the State of Connecticut, and contain all information required by the CT State Building Code and State Fire Code.  Larger sets of plans may be requested in hard copy to the Building Department for ease of reviewing. Complete plans must include electrical, plumbing, HVAC, sprinkler, and all other required information. Plans must comply with these requirements before they can be approved construction.

recordTypes.name: Sewer Permit
recordTypes.description: Sanitary Sewer Permits are required for all activities performed on the sanitary sewer system, whether located within Town-owned property or within private property on the exterior of the building. These activities include the installation or repair of a private sanitary sewer house connection, street sewer, sewer trunk line, or any other activity involving the sanitary sewer system.

recordTypes.name: Fire Marshal / Open Burning Permit
recordTypes.description:
(1) This is a valid permit only when signed by the Local Open Burning Official;
(2) The permit does not relieve the permittee of any legal liability, which may be incurred as a result of the fire;
(3) Failure to adhere to the conditions of the permit may result in forfeiture of this permit and/or other enforcement actions;

This Permit is NOT VALID UNDER THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
(a) When national or state ambient air quality standards may be exceeded
(b) Where a hazardous health condition might be created
(c) When the Air Quality Index (AQI) is forecast to be 100 or higher anywhere in the state
(d) When the Forest Fire Danger Index is high, very high, or extreme
(e) When there is an advisory from the Department of Energy and Environmental Protection (DEEP) Commissioner of any air pollution episode
(f) Burning of any material other than brush
(g) On property other than residential property upon which the permittee resides

recordTypes.name: Fire Marshal / Removal of Fuel Storage Tanks
recordTypes.description:
Inspection Services for REMOVAL of FUEL STORAGE TANKS (Section 7-12 Glastonbury Town Code) 

Effective July 1, 2010

Underground fuel storage tank removal – all fuel types (except propane)

recordTypes.description:
Zoning Permits are for those structures and uses that do not need a Building permit i.e. 
Sheds under 200 square feet in area, 
Fill and excavation operations under 600 cubic yards, 
Home Occupations

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description:
Demolition Permits are for removing structures or parts thereof and not any part of an interior demolition. Please choose this only if you intend on taking down or knocking down a structure or outbuilding.
Other than Home owners, a Home Improvement Contractors license is required for demolition of residential structures and their associated accessory structures.

recordTypes.name: Variance
recordTypes.description: A Variance is a request for relief from the provisions of the Development Code. Use this application to apply for a Stream Buffer Variance, Administrative Variance, Noise Variance, or General Variance.

recordTypes.name: Certified Building Inspector (CBI) Inspections
recordTypes.description: Certified Building Inspector (CBI) Inspections are included as part of the City of Sandy Springs new Multifamily Rental Housing ordinance that consolidates all the requirements into a single ordinance to simplify the annual inspection process.

recordTypes.name: Film Production Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Also includes Park Photography permits.

recordTypes.description: How to apply for a permit and pay any fees that are due.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Map Amendment (Rezoning)
recordTypes.description: A Zoning Map Amendment is a request to amend the Official Zoning Map from one zoning district to another, to change the boundaries of an existing zoning district, or to modify any existing condition of rezoning.

recordTypes.name: 3. Adding a Guest to a Record
recordTypes.description: Instructions on how to Add Contacts as Guests to any OpenGov Records.
