certificate can be produced, or for invisible fences.

recordTypes.name: Natural Landscape Permit
recordTypes.description:
Native plantings will be allowed as landscaping. Native and Natural Landscape shall mean grasses and flowering broad-leaf plants that are native to, or adapted to, the State of Ohio, and that are commonly found in meadow and prairie plant communities, except weeds.
A Natural Landscape Permit is required.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pools
recordTypes.description: Swimming pools are a great addition to a backyard! As you make plans for the swimming pool, it is important to verify that the pool fits in your backyard and meets local, state and federal laws and regulations.

recordTypes.name: Variance from the Zoning Code
recordTypes.description: When practical difficulties, unnecessary hardships or the regulations of the Zoning Code are inconsistent, applicants may request a variance before the Board of Zoning Appeals. Completed application packets must be submitted to the Planning and Zoning Office at least 36 days prior to the public hearing.

recordTypes.name: Application to File a Roadway Concern
recordTypes.description: Please use this form to submit a concern about our roadways and similar.

recordTypes.name: Application to Report Water Concerns
recordTypes.description: Please use this form to submit a concern about water main breaks, water pressure and similar.

recordTypes.name: Addition - Residential
recordTypes.description: When building an addition on to an existing house, zoning approval is required.

recordTypes.name: Addition - Non-Residential
recordTypes.description: When building an addition on to an existing building, zoning approval is required.

recordTypes.name: New Residential Dwelling
recordTypes.description: When building a new house on a property, zoning approval is required.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Use & Compliance
recordTypes.description: When a business is planning to locate in the city, a Use & Compliance application with floor plan must be submitted to ensure that the business is in accordance with local regulations and zoning laws.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Use & Compliance-Home Occupation
recordTypes.description: When a resident is planning to operate a home occupation, a Use & Compliance application must be submitted to ensure that the business is in accordance with the Home Occupation Regulations.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Use & Compliance-Poultry & Fowl
recordTypes.description:
When a resident plans on keeping poultry and/or other fowl on their property, a Use & Compliance application must be submitted to ensure compliance with the Zoning Code.
If the poultry and/or fowl have been in existence prior to November 1, 2021, a Non-Conforming Use Registration will be issued.
In all circumstances, Roosters are PROHIBITED in the City of Tallmadge.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter
recordTypes.description: Requested letter outlining zoning information for a property or properties, this may include official confirmation of a property's zoning status and compliance with local regulations.

recordTypes.name: Site Plan Review
recordTypes.description: In the case where new construction or substantial expansion (an increase of 25% or more of the built footprint of the principal structure) to existing structures and/or expansion of parking lots is proposed, a Site Plan Review application is to be made and is reviewed and acted upon by the Planning & Zoning Commission (PZC). For more information, reference our Zoning Code

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Use & Compliance-Roadside Stand
recordTypes.description: When a resident plans to operate a roadside stand, a Use & Compliance application must be submitted to ensure compliance with the Zoning Code.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Use & Compliance-Ungulates
recordTypes.description:
When a resident plans on keeping ungulates (any hooved animal) on their property, a Use & Compliance application must be submitted to ensure compliance with the Zoning Code.
If the ungulate has been in existence prior to November 1, 2021, a Non-Conforming Use Registration will be issued.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Appropriateness
recordTypes.description: A Certificate of Appropriateness (COA) is required for any expansion and/or exterior appearance alteration of any existing structure in the Design Control Overlay District (O-DC) or of a structure designated as a Recognized Heritage Structure (RHS). Any new construction in the O-DC, will require a COA in addition to a Site Plan Review. Additionally, any signage proposed in the Overlay Districts requires a COA. A COA application will be reviewed by the Architectural Review Board.

recordTypes.name: Signage
recordTypes.description: Zoning Compliance is required for all new and replacement of permanent signage.

recordTypes.name: Engineering Review
recordTypes.description:
Engineering Review is required for Drainage Review, Site Plan Review, Storm Water Fee Calculations, Photometric Lighting Plans, and Retaining Walls over 4 ft in height. Generally, these are related to new construction. All fees will be collected prior to review and held in escrow by the City and disbursed as the City is billed for the services. Any unused fees will be returned to the applicant upon completion of the review.

NOTE: This application is not for a Floodplain Development Permit.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Use & Compliance-Apiculture
recordTypes.description:
When a resident plans on keeping bees on their property, a Use & Compliance application must be submitted to ensure compliance with the Zoning Code.
If the bee hives have been in existence prior to November 1, 2021, a Non-Conforming Use Registration will be issued.

recordTypes.name: Application for Exclusion for Recognized Heritage Structures
recordTypes.description: The owner(s) of any structure(s) that has/have been previously designated as an RHS may apply to have such structure removed as an RHS

recordTypes.name: Vacation of Streets, Alleys or Easements
recordTypes.description:
This following outlines the steps involved in the vacation of a street, alley, or easement. (TCO 1110.05)

1. Vacation Plat Submission and Abutter Signatures:

A Vacation Plat, prepared by a registered surveyor, must be submitted to the Planning & Zoning Department. This plat should clearly indicate the street, alley, or easement to be vacated and include legal descriptions.
The petition for vacation requires signatures from all property owners that abut the area proposed for vacation.
If all abutting property owner signatures are not obtained, a Public Notice of Consideration to Vacate must be advertised in a local newspaper for four consecutive weeks. The petitioner is responsible for the advertising costs.

2. City Review and Council Approval:

The Planning & Zoning Commission (PZC) will review the vacation plat and make a recommendation to City Council.
City Council will then consider legislation regarding the vacation, which requires three separate readings.
A public meeting will be scheduled to allow anyone to address the Council regarding the proposed vacation.

3. Utility Easements:

If a street, alley, or public highway is vacated or narrowed, affected railroads or public utilities may retain permanent easements for their facilities if the City determines relocation is unnecessary. This ensures the continued maintenance, operation, and access to these utilities.

4. Plat Recording:

Following City Council approval, the original tracing/mylar of the plat, along with three signed prints, will be returned to the petitioner.
The petitioner is then responsible for filing the approved vacation plat with the Summit County Recorder within 60 days.
Failure to record the plat within this timeframe will result in the approval being voided.

5. Final Submission:

Within five working days of recording the plat, the petitioner must furnish the Department of Planning & Zoning with the original tracing/mylar of the plat and a digital copy in a format acceptable to the City.

recordTypes.name: Request for Extension of Approval
recordTypes.description: If no construction is started or use changed within one year of date of permit, a new permit is required upon proper application unless the applicant applies for an extension by the approving body/bodies. One extension may be granted for up to twelve (12) months. Any application for extension must be made in writing to the approving body/bodies prior to the expiration of the initial Certificate.

recordTypes.name: Minor Subdivision (Lot Splits/Consolidations)
Non-Residential New Construction
recordTypes.description: Based on the approval/approval with Conditions by the Planning & Zoning Commission, this application will be used to initiate review of improvement plans prior to submittal to the Building Department.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use Certificate
recordTypes.description: To use or develop land in the City of Tallmadge, where the land use is listed as a Conditional Use in the Zoning Code Table of Uses, a Conditional Use Certificate Application must be submitted at least 45 days prior to the public hearing held before the Planning & Zoning Commission.

recordTypes.name: Major Subdivision Development: Improvement Plans
recordTypes.description: This is the 2nd Step to developing a Major Subdivision. To ensure all proper applications and approvals are submitted, start a PROJECT in the portal.

recordTypes.name: Long-Term Storm Water Management Agreement
recordTypes.description: It is required to file a Long-Term Storm Water Management Agreement with the City of Tallmadge establishing mutual responsibilities for maintenance of the storm water management infrastructure.

recordTypes.name: Major Subdivision Development: Preliminary Plat
recordTypes.description: This is the 1st Step to developing a Major Subdivision. To ensure all proper applications and approvals are submitted, start a PROJECT in the portal.

recordTypes.name: Floodplain Development Permit
recordTypes.description: An application for a floodplain development permit shall be required for all development activities located wholly within, partially within, or in contact with an identified special flood hazard area. For more information, reference our Zoning Code.

recordTypes.name: Major Subdivision Development: Final Plat
recordTypes.description: This is the 3rd Step to developing a Major Subdivision. To ensure all proper applications and approvals are submitted, start a PROJECT in the portal.

recordTypes.name: Major Subdivision Development: RePlat
recordTypes.description: When a Lot Split/Consolidation does not meet the minor subdivision parameter and/or is located in Portage County, a Replat application must be filed for review and approval by the Planning & Zoning Commission and City Council

recordTypes.name: Zoning Map Amendment
recordTypes.description: To change the zoning of a property or multiple properties, the application must be considered by the City of Tallmadge Planning & Zoning Commission and then the City Council for legislation and approval. Approval is granted in conjunction with an approved General Development Plan. For more information, reference our Zoning Code.

recordTypes.name: Variance from the Riparian Setback
recordTypes.description: Requests for a variance from the Riparian Setback are heard by the Planning & Zoning Commission. For more information, reference our Zoning Code.

recordTypes.name: Appeal Application
recordTypes.description:
This application is used when an appeal is made from a decision by
a. the Zoning Inspector, 
b. the Planning & Zoning Commission (which is not a legislative decision), or 
c. a decision or action of Architectural Review Board

recordTypes.description: New home construction, building additions, remodeling. THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Deck - Residential
recordTypes.description: THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Deck - Commercial
recordTypes.description: THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Demolition - Commercial
recordTypes.description: Permits for the demolition of commercial buildings.

recordTypes.name: Demolition - Residential
recordTypes.description: Permits for house demolition.

recordTypes.name: Driveway/Apron - Zoning Certificate
recordTypes.description: This application is for the widening of a driveway, apron/sidewalk replacements, and curb cuts. A site map showing where the work is to be done and the dimensions is required.

recordTypes.name: Fence - Commercial
recordTypes.description: THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Apron/Curb - Commercial
recordTypes.description: This application is for existing apron areas and/or curbs only for commercial properties. A site map showing where the work is to be done and the dimensions is required.

recordTypes.name: Fence - Residential
recordTypes.description:
This permit is for fences over 4ft tall ONLY. The tallest fencing allowed in the City of Fairfield is 6ft. 

THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Fire Suppression Sprinkler
recordTypes.description: Fire suppression sprinklers and underground fire lines

recordTypes.name: Fence - Zoning Certificate
recordTypes.description:
This no cost Fence - Zoning Certificate is required for fences 4ft tall or less in height. 

For fences over 4ft in height, please go back and fill out a "Fence - Residential" permit application.

recordTypes.name: HVAC Kitchen Hood- Commercial
recordTypes.description: This permit requires the applicant to have an HVAC registration.

recordTypes.name: Handicap Ramp/Stairlift (Metal) - Zoning Certificate
recordTypes.description: THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Pool - Residential
recordTypes.description: THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Pool - Commercial
recordTypes.description: THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Promotional Tent
recordTypes.description: Flame Retardant Certificate is required to be submitted upon application.

recordTypes.name: Solar Panels - Residential
recordTypes.description: THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Sign - Grand Opening
recordTypes.description: Permit for temporary Grand Opening Signage. THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Sign - Permanent
recordTypes.description: This permit requires application by a sign contractor that has been licensed with the City of Fairfield. THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Sign - Promotional
recordTypes.description: Permit for temporary Special Event Signs, Flutter Flags, and Promotional Banners. THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Solar Panel - Commercial
recordTypes.description: THIS PERMIT TYPE REQUIRES ZONING REVIEW AND APPROVAL. PLAN REVIEW WILL BEGIN AFTER ZONING IS APPROVED.

recordTypes.name: Tanks
recordTypes.description: Permit for aboveground/underground storage tanks.

categories.name: Building Department - Residential Permits
categories.content:
Responsibilities

The Building and Zoning Division protects residents’ health, safety and welfare as they relate to new construction, additions, remodeling and existing buildings.

The City of Fairfield enforces building codes, along with other adopted zoning and property maintenance codes, to protect you by making sure the building is constructed properly, that the

recordTypes.name: Rental Registry
recordTypes.description: Gahanna Code requires all residential rental properties to be registered with the City. Registration is due by March 15th biennially (every other year).

recordTypes.name: Rotary Stage Rental Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is to reserve the Rotary Stage and surrounding stage area at Creekside Park.

recordTypes.name: Alarm Registration Permit
recordTypes.description: An alarm registration is required for residents and businesses installing and/or operating an alarm system.

recordTypes.name: Certified Address Request
recordTypes.description: A certified address request is required to create or update addresses in the City of Gahanna. The request process will identify all information required for review including a site plan.

recordTypes.name: 5K Event Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for 5K routes/run-walks taking place on the Big Walnut Trail.

recordTypes.name: Fence Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit for the construction of a new fence or major modifications to an existing fence as defined in GCO Section 1109.05.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use
recordTypes.description: Uses identified in GCO Section 1105.01 as conditionally permitted in a specific zoning district.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: A building permit for new construction, additions, alterations, tenant buildouts, swimming pools, accessory buildings, and other similar projects for commercial properties. The term commercial refers to the Ohio Building Code (OBC) categories which include Multi-family (4 or more units), Multi-family – Individual Condo Unit (in a building of 4 or more units), and Commercial.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Certificate Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit for the construction of a shed, freestanding deck, or other structure not requiring a building permit as defined in GCO Section 1117.01.

recordTypes.name: Site Civil Engineering Permit
recordTypes.description: The site civil engineering permit facilitates review of commercial developments. The review considers stormwater management, utility installation, and environmental impacts.

recordTypes.name: Block Party Permit
recordTypes.description: A Block Party Permit is required to use a public street for neighborhood gatherings to block the street temporarily.

recordTypes.name: Gahanna Market Vendor Application
recordTypes.description: This application is for vendors interested in participating in the Gahanna Market. The Gahanna Market is located on the Creekside Plaza and occurs on the fourth Wednesday of each month June through September.

recordTypes.name: House Watch Request
recordTypes.description: A House Watch Request is for the Division of Police to monitor a residential property while the resident is away for five days or more.

recordTypes.name: Permanent Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit for the installation of a ground or building-mounted sign as defined in GCO Section 1111.03.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description: A building permit for new construction, additions, alterations, decks, garages, swimming pools, and other similar projects for residential properties. The term residential refers to the Residential Code of Ohio (RCO) categories which include Single-Family Detached, 2-Family Attached (Duplex), and 3-Family Attached (Triplex).

recordTypes.name: Development Plan
recordTypes.description: A minor or major development as defined in GCO Section 1117.07 for new construction, redevelopment, addition, alteration, site improvement, or other similar projects.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: A trade permit for new construction, additions, alterations, fire rehabs, temporary services, swimming pools, and other similar commercial or residential electrical projects. This permit is for both standalone electrical work and work associated with a building permit.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit to allow a ground or building-mounted sign for a limited time as defined in GCO Section 1111.04.

recordTypes.name: Vendor Application
recordTypes.description: This application is for vendors seeking to participate in Parks & Recreation Special Events, community special events, or within City of Gahanna park property.

recordTypes.name: Traffic Study Permit (TIS/TAS/MOU)
recordTypes.description: The traffic study permit facilitates review of commercial developments and their impacts on traffic.

recordTypes.name: Noise Ordinance Special Provisions Permit
recordTypes.description: A Noise Ordinance Special Provisions Permit is required when a property owner or business operates outside of the designated quiet hours or exceeds the allowable noise levels set by the noise ordinance (Section 559.04 GCO).

recordTypes.name: Temporary Parking Permit
recordTypes.description: A temporary parking permit is required for on-street parking where signs otherwise prohibit it.

recordTypes.name: Floodplain Use Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit for the construction, modification, or improvement of a property located in the floodplain as defined in GCO Chapter 1113.

recordTypes.name: Residence/Business Right-of-Way Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for work occurring typically on one parcel and covers items such as sidewalk and driveway work. Previously permitted private development work within the right-of-way will also fall under this application.

recordTypes.name: Fire Protection System Permit
recordTypes.description: A trade permit for fire alarms, sprinkler systems, underground piping, or other fire extinguishing systems for commercial or residential projects. This permit is for both standalone fire protection work and work associated with a building permit.

recordTypes.name: Utility Franchisee Right-of-Way Permit
recordTypes.description: This permit is for all work performed by franchised utility companies including gas, electric, or communication lines (phone, cable, and internet).

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Utility Franchisee Application
recordTypes.description: This application is for private utility companies seeking franchise registration to occupy and perform work with the right-of-way per Gahanna Codified Ordinance Chapter 931. This is an application that must be renewed annually.

recordTypes.name: Home Occupation Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit to allow the use of a portion of a home for a business as defined in GCO Section 1105.02(g).

recordTypes.name: Final Plat
recordTypes.description: A subdivision of land as defined in GCO Section 1117.08(a) including six (6) or more lots or the dedication of public right-of-way.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Without Plat
recordTypes.description: A subdivision of a single property into five (5) or less lots, including the original lot, as defined in GCO Section 1117.08(b).

recordTypes.name: Tree Removal Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit to allow for the removal of protected trees on a property as defined in GCO Section 914.06.

recordTypes.name: Gas Piping Permit
recordTypes.description: A trade permit for commercial or residential gas piping projects. This permit is for both standalone gas work and work associated with a building permit.

recordTypes.name: Master Sign Plan
recordTypes.description: A comprehensive set of sign standards including size, location, height, color, and design of signs for a multi-tenant building or multi-building development as defined in GCO Section 1117.06.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter
recordTypes.description: A letter confirming the zoning requirements, active code violations, and other similar requested information for a specific property.

recordTypes.name: Rezoning
recordTypes.description: An amendment or change to the official zoning map or text in the Zoning Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: HVAC/Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: A trade permit for new construction, additions, alterations, unit replacements, duct work, and other similar commercial or residential mechanical projects. This permit is for both standalone mechanical work and work associated with a building permit.

recordTypes.name: Variance
recordTypes.description: A de minimis, non-dimensional, or dimensional variance defined in GCO Section 1117.02 for a proposed use, building, or structure that does not conform to a requirement of the Zoning Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: A trade permit for new construction, additions, alterations, and other similar work defined by Franklin County Public Health for commercial or residential plumbing projects. This permit is for both standalone plumbing work and work associated with a building permit.

recordTypes.name: Wireless Service Facility
recordTypes.description: A new tower, co-location, antenna support structure, alternative tower structure, or other Wireless Communications Facility (WCF) as defined in GCO Chapter 1115.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Occupancy/Change of Use
recordTypes.description: A permit to allow for the change of use or occupancy of a building where no additional work (building, electrical, fire, gas, etc.) is included.

recordTypes.name: Winterfest 2025 Vendor Application
recordTypes.description: Complete this form to apply for vendor space on the City Hall Portico during the annual Winterfest Holiday Pop-Up Market.

recordTypes.name: Code Enforcement
recordTypes.description: Use this form to file a Code Enforcement Complaint with the City. Also known as nuisance complaints.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Certificate (Fence, Shed, Sign, etc.)
recordTypes.description: Apply for a zoning permit for accessory structures such as sheds, fences, and signs.

recordTypes.name: Development Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Apply for a review of proposed large-scale developments. A development plan review is required for all non-single-family residential new construction or major alterations including expanding the floor area of the permitted use; increasing the number of dwelling units in a multi-family development; changing the use which requires an increase in the amount of parking; or a change in the site's circulation.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to file for a Commercial Building Permit.

recordTypes.name: Rental Registration
recordTypes.description: Registration for rental units in the City of North Canton. One registration should be completed for each individual unit.

recordTypes.name: July 4 Celebration Market Vendor Application - America250
recordTypes.description: Complete this form to apply for vendor space during the America250 July 4 Celebration Market on Saturday, July 4th, 2026 from 5:00-9:30 PM on Main Street in North Canton.

recordTypes.name: Conditional or Similar Use
recordTypes.description: Apply for a conditional use permit or similar use determination from the North Canton Planning Commission.

recordTypes.name: Rental Change of Tenant Form
recordTypes.description: Use this form to request a change in tenant inspection for rental units registered with the Department of Development Services.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to file for a Residential (1-2-3 Family) Building Permit.

recordTypes.name: Roof Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to file for a Roofing Permit. (Residential or Commercial/Industrial)

recordTypes.name: Vacant Property Registration
recordTypes.description: Registration for vacant residential and commercial properties in the City of North Canton. Vacant properties must register and be inspected annually.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Amendment
recordTypes.description: Application for amendments to the zoning classification of property within the City of North Canton.

recordTypes.name: Zoning and Building Standards Board of Appeals
recordTypes.description:
Apply to the Zoning and Building Standards Board of Appeals for a variance or zoning appeal.
Appeals must be filed within thirty (30) days of the issuance of the document being appealed.
Applications must be filed by the 8th day of the month to be considered that month.

recordTypes.name: Civil Service Job Application
recordTypes.description: Application is for employment as a full-time Police Officer, Dispatcher, or EMT-P. This form will be used as an application for the appropriate Civil Service Examination.

recordTypes.name: Recreational Fire Permit
recordTypes.description: Recreational fires are small backyard fires, similar to the type you would normally find at a campground. These fires are less than 3 feet wide and less than 2 feet tall. Perfect for backyard get-togethers or making delicious s'mores. While these fires are a fun way to spend the summer it is still important to practice fire safety to reduce the risk of damage to your property or that of your neighbors.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to file for a Plumbing Permit. (Residential or Commercial/Industrial)

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to file for an Electrical Permit (Residential or Commercial/Industrial).

recordTypes.name: EMS Bill Payment
recordTypes.description: Make a payment towards an EMS Bill from the City of North Canton.

recordTypes.name: Rental Registration Removal
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to remove a previously registered rental property from the City's registration program or confirm that a property is not a rental unit.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Tent Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for a temporary event tent permit.

recordTypes.name: Transient Occupancy / Lodging Tax Filing
recordTypes.description: The City of North Canton levies a 3% Transient Occupancy or Lodging Tax on all hotel or motel accommodations within the City. Any hotel or motel with 5 or more rooms is required to file tax information quarterly using this form.

recordTypes.name: North Canton Sun Newsletter Advertisement Application
recordTypes.description: Apply to purchase advertisement space in the City's North Canton Sun newsletter, a quarterly print and digital publication mailed free of charge to nearly 12, 000 North Canton area addresses and published to the City's website.

recordTypes.name: Property Code Appeal
recordTypes.description:
Appeal a decision made by a Code Enforcement Officer to the Zoning and Building Standards Board of Appeals. Appeals must be filed within thirty (30) days of the issuance of the document being appealed.
Applications must be filed by the 8th day of the month to be considered that month.

recordTypes.name: Parking Tickets
recordTypes.description: Pay a parking ticket issued by the North Canton Police Department.

recordTypes.name: HVAC/Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to file for an HVAC/Mechanical Permit (Residential or Commercial/Industrial).

recordTypes.name: Subdivision of Land / Re-Plat
recordTypes.description: Use this application to submit a subdivision or replay for consideration by the City. This includes residential and commercial subdivisions, and minor re-plats.

recordTypes.name: Fire Suppression System
recordTypes.description: Apply for a permit for a commercial fire suppression system.

recordTypes.name: Special Duty Request
recordTypes.description: Request Special Duty Police or Fire/EMS personnel for an event, sports game, or traffic management.

recordTypes.name: Solicitor Permit
recordTypes.description: Application to perform commercial door-to-door solicitation in the City of North Canton. Religious or political organizations not seeking monetary donations are not required to have a permit.

recordTypes.name: MFU Parks Permit
recordTypes.description: Apply for a permit to operate a food truck or cart in North Canton City Parks.

recordTypes.name: Board and Commissions Application
recordTypes.description: Use this application to apply for an appointment on North Canton Boards and Commissions such as the Civil Service Commission, Planning Commission, or Zoning Board of Appeals. Appointments are typically made in December.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Unit Registration
recordTypes.description: Use this form to complete annual required registration for food trucks, ice cream trucks, food carts, and other mobile food units.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Occupancy
recordTypes.description: Apply for a Certificate of Occupancy with the Development Services Department.

recordTypes.name: Window Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to file for a Window Permit. (Residential or Commercial/Industrial)

recordTypes.name: Road Closure Permit
recordTypes.description: A road closure permit entitles the applicant or its organization to the reasonable use of certain city property in line with the property's intended purpose. This is commonly used for tree trimming, sewer or water lateral maintenance, parades, assemblies, block parties, and festivals.

recordTypes.name: High Visibility Address Sign
recordTypes.description: High visibility address signs are available to order to help keep your home visible to first responders and delivery services.

recordTypes.name: Oversize Vehicle/Load Permit
recordTypes.description: This form is to attain a permit for oversized vehicles or loads that need to be moved on North Canton city streets. Depending on the number and size of these loads as well as the route that they will be taking an appropriate number of police escorts will be assigned.

recordTypes.name: Wedding Ceremony Request
recordTypes.description: Complete this form to apply for a wedding ceremony performed by Mayor Matthew Stroia. This application will be reviewed by the Office of the Mayor for completion and scheduling. The original marriage license with the legal names of those to be married must be brought on the day of the ceremony for signing. The names on the license MUST match those provided in your request.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application in order to apply for a new Swimming Pool Permit.

recordTypes.name: Water or Sewer Lateral Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to file for a Plumbing Permit for a new or replacement water or sewer lateral. (Residential or Commercial/Industrial)

recordTypes.name: Community Reinvestment Area Application (CRA)
recordTypes.description: CRAs provide real property tax exemptions for property owners who renovate or construct new buildings based on eligibility established by Ordinance 19-2020. A CRA benefits property owners who take advantage of the program by reducing their property taxes. As an investment in our community the program also has greater and more wide-ranging benefits for the whole City by helping to create healthy housing stock, provide for the City’s future, and improve property values.

recordTypes.name: Flammable and Combustible Liquid Tank and Piping Permit
recordTypes.description: Flammable and Combustible Liquid Tank and Piping Permits allow for the construction of Underground Storage Tank (UST) systems. Pursuant to Chapter 1301: 7-9-10 of the Ohio Administrative Code, the North Canton Fire Department is authorized by the State Fire Marshal to oversee the permitting and inspection of UST systems.

recordTypes.name: Civil Service Commission Appeal
recordTypes.description: Appeal a decision made by an appointing authority with regard to the employment of a classified employee. This form can also be used to file challenges or protests related to promotional examinations.

recordTypes.name: New Water Service / Tap-In
recordTypes.description: Request connection to the City of North Canton water system.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application in order to apply for a demolition permit (Major or Minor).

recordTypes.name: Main St. Facade Improvement Program
recordTypes.description: The North Canton Main Street Façade Improvement Program, provides permit fee waivers to businesses on Main Street for substantial improvements to their building’s facade. This program grants permit fee waivers for businesses that renovate or update their building’s façade in accordance with the Recommended Cohesive Design Standards.

recordTypes.name: Request to Vacate a Street or Alley
recordTypes.description: Use this application to request that the City vacate a public street or alley. Property owners will be required to submit a Plat and Vacation Petition.

recordTypes.name: Right-Of-Way Permit
recordTypes.description: Apply to perform work in the public right-of-way that requires the deconstruction and repair of public infrastructure.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration
recordTypes.description: Use this application to complete contractor registration. All contractors performing work in the City of North Canton must be registered, even if a permit is not required.

recordTypes.name: Banner Program (City Lampposts)
recordTypes.description: The City Lamppost Banner Program allows scholastic or non-profit community organizations to display banners on City lampposts along Main Street and Maple Street near the Downtown Square, given available space.

recordTypes.name: Water Abandonment Request
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to request temporary, permanent, or semi-permanent water shut-off from the City of North Canton.

recordTypes.name: Water Service Line Inventory
recordTypes.description: Complete this form to assist the City in evaluating the presence of lead in our water distribution system. The purpose of the OEPA Lead Service Line program is to inventory water distribution systems across the state to identify the presence of lead service lines in need of replacement. Any properties that are suspected to contain lead service lines will receive additional testing from the City at no cost, as well as additional information about replacing lead lines if necessary.

recordTypes.name: Donation Form
recordTypes.description: Please fill out the following form to complete your donation to the City of North Canton Parks, Fire or Police Departments.

categories.name: Building Permits
categories.content:
The Department of Development Services is responsible for the administration of the Ohio Building Code and Ohio Residential Code in the City of North Canton and for issuing all permits for new construction, additions, or modification to buildings.

Apply for a Permit

Permits can be applied for online or in person. To apply for a permit find the appropriate permit application using the links below and and complete the fillable form along with paying the appropriate fees. An email

categories.name: Zoning Code Services
categories.content:
The Division of Planning and Zoning is responsible for the administration of the City's Planning and Zoning Code. Duties include maintaining the City's Zoning map, development plan reviews, and administrative support for the Planning Commission and Zoning and Building Board of Appeals.

What is Zoning?

Zoning means local regulations as to what types of land uses can be placed in specific locations throughout the community. Every lot, parcel, or property in the City has an

categories.name: Property Code Programs
categories.content: The North Canton Property Maintenance Code (Part 17) helps protect public health and safety by ensuring proper occupancy and maintenance of buildings and land throughout the City. Below residents can complete online applications for a number of property code related programs including rental registration, vacant property registration, and filing appeals with the Zoning and

categories.name: Emergency Services
categories.content: Below, residents can apply for services from the North Canton Fire and Police Departments. The Fire Prevention Bureau offers a number of services to help keep North Canton safe from fires, natural disasters, and other threats to safety.

categories.name: Administration / Council's Office
categories.content: Through City Hall, residents can apply for various City services, such as food truck permits for City parks, high visibility address sign orders, and Civil Service Exam applications, as well as other services managed by Administration or the Council’s Office.

recordTypes.name: Use of City Fire Hydrant
recordTypes.description: Use of a City Fire Hydrant requires a Hydrant Meter and Backflow Device. With this permit, the City will provide these for your project and allow use of a fire hydrant.

recordTypes.name: Planning Commission
recordTypes.description: Application to the Planning Commission for review of a Development Plan, Conditional Use, Subdivision, or Zoning Code or Map Amendment.

recordTypes.name: Board of Building & Zoning Appeals
recordTypes.description: Application to the Board of Building & Zoning Appeals for review of a variance, substitution of a nonconforming use, an appeal of an interpretation of the Planning & Zoning Code, an appeal of the Building Code for one, two and three family dwellings, or an appeal of the Property Maintenance Code.

recordTypes.name: Design and Review Board
recordTypes.description: Application to the Design and Review Board for a Certificate of Appropriateness, changes to signs in the C-4 zoning district, recommendation for a Development plan at a non-landmark property in the C-4 zoning district, or the designation of a Landmark or Landmark District.

recordTypes.name: Water Line or Sewer Lateral work inside City limits
recordTypes.description: Use this permit application when you are only installing, replacing or repairing a water or sewer line lateral into an existing residential or commercial building that is INSIDE City limits and no other plumbing work is being performed. This work is included with the building permit on new construction or with a plumbing permit when other plumbing work is being performed.

recordTypes.name: Water Line or Sewer Lateral work outside City limits
recordTypes.description: Use this permit application when you are only installing, replacing or repairing a water or sewer line lateral into an existing residential or commercial building that is OUTSIDE City limits but has City of Wooster water or sewer.

recordTypes.name: Downtown Waste Collection Program
recordTypes.description: Downtown businesses and residents can access the City's common Waste Collection and Recycling enclosures and containers.

recordTypes.name: Traffic Commission Request Application
recordTypes.description: Application for an issue to be brought before the Traffic Commission. The Traffic Commission coordinates traffic activities, supervises the preparation and publication of traffic reports, receives complaints having to do with traffic matters, and recommends to the Mayor and Council, the City Engineer, the Chief of the Police Division, and other City officials, ways and means for improving traffic and parking conditions and the administration and enforcement of traffic and parking regulations within the City.

recordTypes.name: Residential Waste Program for Non-Residential Property
recordTypes.description: This application is for commercial or mixed use properties to access the residential waste collection program. The intent is for smaller commercial properties located on an existing residential waste collection route to obtain the rolling toters for waste collection.

recordTypes.name: Address Request and Verification
recordTypes.description: Request necessary for the the assignment and verification of the correct business, residence or site address. Each parcel number requires a separate application.

recordTypes.name: Annual Mobile Food Unit Permit
recordTypes.description: PLEASE READ: ALL mobile food units operating inside the Wooster city limits (regardless of public or private events) are required to purchase a permit. There is a $30 processing fee associated with each permit. If you own multiple mobile food units, you will need a permit for each unit AND be required to pay the $30 fee for each one. Approved permits are valid for the current calendar year and will expire on December 31st.

recordTypes.name: CRA: Residential Application for Tax Exemption
recordTypes.description: Application for Residential CRA Tax Exemption - This program is available to any Wooster homeowner, landlord, or developer working to rehabilitate or even rebuild a single and two-family home within Wooster’s designated Community Reinvestment Area. Terms vary, but for most projects exceeding $2,500.00, property owners may receive a 100 percent Tax Abatement for 10 years on the improved value of the home.

recordTypes.name: Residential Waste Program for those Physically Unable to Place Totes
recordTypes.description: The City provides a waste and recycling pick-up service to residents who are disabled, impaired, or physically unable to place their refuse and recycling totes at the designated point of collection.

recordTypes.description: Acceptance testing for flammable liquid storage tanks that are "engine mounted" (e.g. generators) AND have a capacity of 500 gallons or less. Anything 501 gallons or more requires a State Fire Marshal AST permit.

recordTypes.name: Taxicab Company License - Renewed Annually
recordTypes.description: All Taxi Companies must register. Please submit this application first before applying for drivers and vehicles.  This license is $100 and must be renewed annually by March 1st. For questions, please call the Transportation Manager at 330-263-5255.

recordTypes.name: Taxicab Driver License - Renewed Annually
recordTypes.description:
All drivers for taxicab companies must be registered annually by March 1st. Per the City Ordinance  Chapter 743. To complete this application please be prepared to provide a Drivers License, BMV Driving Record, BCI &FBI Background check. The fee is $25 per driver.
2 year unofficial driving abstract from BMV can be found at https://bmv.ohio.gov/more-record-types.aspx
BCI&FBI background check can be scheduled at https://wayneoh.permitium.com/fingerprint/application

recordTypes.name: Major Subdivision Plat
recordTypes.description: Application to file a Major Subdivision Plat.

recordTypes.name: Alcohol Use Permit - The Chalet at Freedlander Park
recordTypes.description: An Alcohol Use Permit can be applied for by any events with a current building use agreement on file for the Chalet at Freedlander Park EXCEPT FOR High School Graduation Parties. The City of Wooster and the Recreation Department reserve the right to refuse Alcohol Use Permits to any events.

recordTypes.name: Building Permits
recordTypes.description: Purchase building permits for projects such as new construction and additions, alterations, decks/porches/garages and home improvements (siding, windows and roofing) . For residential projects (residential is defined as a one, two, or three-family dwelling), plans must be submitted and reviewed as part of this building permit application process. For Commercial projects, plans must have already been approved prior to applying for a building permit.

recordTypes.name: Building Standards Division Contact and Other Information
recordTypes.description: Here are all the emails and phone numbers of the inspectors and other personnel.

recordTypes.name: Development Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit necessary for any subdivisions, infrastructure improvements, commercial development site plan and other miscellaneous improvements.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Certificate
recordTypes.description: Select a Zoning Certificate application for all new, or changes to, buildings, additions, accessory structures, fences, patios, sidewalks, or other similar structures.  Also select a Zoning Certificate for a change of use or approval for an Itinerant Vendor.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Permit
recordTypes.description: This form is used exclusively for Public Events (Festivals, Concerts, Races, Walks, etc) within the city limits of Wooster.

recordTypes.name: Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: Plans must be approved before obtaining construction permits for commercial projects. This application is for plan review of commercial projects - New construction, alterations, and additions. Types of plans submitted for review with this application include: Architectural, MEP, and others. This application is used for initial plan submittals, re-submittals or to request plan review/approval of responses to plan comments. Plan reviews may be submitted by owners, designers, contractors or other agents of the owner, however, plan review results/comments will only be shared with the applicant. Plan Reviews may take from 1 day to 30 days to complete depending on the complexity of the project. Most plan reviews are completed in two weeks. Plans are reviewed in the order they are submitted with no projects expedited ahead of other projects.

recordTypes.name: Parking Permit for BUSINESS EMPLOYEES in the Downtown C-4 Zoning District
recordTypes.description: A permit to park in one of the City's off-street parking lots without the hourly time limit.  These are the North Buckeye, South Buckeye, or Merchants Block, parking lots. There are monthly ($45), semi-annual ($210), and annual permits ($300). Keep in mind, no permit is necessary to park in other City off-street parking lots all day. These include the S. Market St. and North Street lots.

recordTypes.name: Registering Licensed Contractors
recordTypes.description: Must I register as a contractor in the City of Wooster?

recordTypes.name: Taxicab Vehicle License - Renewed Annually
recordTypes.description: All vehicles for taxicab companies must be registered annually by March 1st. Per the City Ordinance  Chapter 743. To complete this application please be prepared to provide a completed inspection form signed by OSHP. The fee is $50 per vehicle.

recordTypes.description: Residents of the downtown C4 zoning district may purchase an annual permit ($25) that allows parking without a time limit, in any of the Municipal off-street parking facilities. These are the North Buckeye, South Buckeye, Merchants Block, or South Market parking lots.

recordTypes.name: How do I get plan approval for a commercial project?

recordTypes.description: Residents of the downtown residential district with a current parking permit may obtain a temporary visitor parking permit that would allow visitor parking in the district, without a time limit, in any of the off-street city lots in a three hour public parking space. The permit is valid for up to three days and is free.

recordTypes.description: This form is used to apply for an alley vacation within the Wooster Corporation Limits.

Shipping fees are not included in the price of the plans.

The permit is valid for one day and overnight restrictions apply. The permit fee is $5.00/day.

recordTypes.description: Utility Work: A permit is necessary for any contractor replacing and/or installing utilities (gas, electric, phone, fiber optic, etc.) within the City right-of-way. Applicants must be a registered member of the Ohio Utilities Protection Services. Non-Utility Work: A permit is necessary for driveway approaches, sidewalks, yard pipe, storm sewer connections or any other work within the City Right-of-Way.

recordTypes.description: A permit is necessary for sewer connections made to the City's sewer system.

recordTypes.description: Time limited parking permit for licensed contractors to access their work vehicles during the time they are working on a construction project in the Downtown Parking District (351.18). Select the Downtown address where the work is being performed. A single permit is valid for a maximum of 7 days. The fee is $10 for the first day and $5 for each day thereafter up to 7 days or $40 for the full 7 days.

For residential and simple commercial projects, plans will be submitted and reviewed as part of this permit application process.

recordTypes.description: A permit is necessary for water service and fire line connections made to the City's water system resulting from well abandonment, service replacement, or new service connections.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Permits
recordTypes.description: Residential and commercial demolition of structures when the structures have water or sewer connections or a basement. Structures without water, sewer, and a basement do not require a permit to demolish.

recordTypes.name: Tent Permits
recordTypes.description: Permit to erect a tent or temporary structure.

recordTypes.description: The owner, or the engineer or architect of record acting as the owner’s agent, shall provide reports of structural tests and inspections.

recordTypes.name: UCC Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
*** IMPORTANT NOTE: Projects submitted on or after January 1, 2026 must comply with the 2021 Uniform Construction Code (UCC). ***

Please complete the application below for building, electrical, plumbing, mechanical, demolition, and fire protection permits. If you have any questions, contact the York City Bureau of Permits and Inspections at (717) 849-2239.

recordTypes.name: CURB AND SIDEWALK PERMIT

Permit for repair or replacement of public sidewalks.

recordTypes.description: Permit for an electrical turn on inspection required by the electrical utility.

recordTypes.name: Demolition Agreement
recordTypes.description: This must be filled out with every Demolition application.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Occupancy Application
recordTypes.description:
*** IMPORTANT NOTE: Projects submitted on or after January 1, 2026 must comply with the 2021 Uniform Construction Code (UCC). ***

A Certificate of Occupancy is required for all new construction, major renovations, to reoccupy condemn structures, change of occupancy, and in some cases state licensures. To confirm whether you need a Certificate of Occupancy, please contact the Permits & Inspections Bureau. 

Inspections will be scheduled only after all work and final inspections have been completed. This inspection is to ensure that the property meets the minimum requirements of all codes. Under no circumstances may you occupy the premises prior to the issuance of a Certificate of Use and Occupancy. Plans, if any, must be reviewed and approved and all required permits obtained, and inspections completed prior to applying for the Certificate of Use and Occupancy. Please fill out this form completely. Incomplete applications will not be processed.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Food Permits
recordTypes.description:
Per the Ordinance, you must apply for a temporary food service permit 10 days prior to the date of the event. 
 As of 9/1/2024, all applications submitted less than 10 days prior to the event, will be DENIED.  If anyone continues to operate without a Temporary Food Service Permit, you will be escorted from the premises by the City of York Police department, and a citation will be issued for operating without a permit.
Vendors cannot exceed 14 permits in a calendar year. 

For a short-term (up to five days) permit for food service at an event. A temporary food service license will not be issued unless this application meets all local applicable requirements and those found in the FDA Model Food Code and the permit has been signed and approved by the City of York Health Officer. Additionally, the applicant is aware that non-compliance may result in prosecution or closure of the temporary licensed facility. Temporary food service licenses are non-transferable and non-refundable. The Health Officer may deny any application submitted the day of the event. 

Temporary Food Service Permit Fees:
City license holder, on-site: Free
City license holder, off-site: $20
Vendors without a City license, 1 or 2-day events: $35
Vendors without a City license, 3 to 5-day events: $50

recordTypes.name: Itinerant Vendor License
recordTypes.description: Itinerant vendors - all persons both principal and agent, who engage in or conduct a temporary or transient business in the City, selling goods, wares and merchandise with the intention of continuing in such business in any one place for a period of not more than sixty days and who, for the purpose of carrying on such business, hire, lease or occupy either in whole or in part any room, building or structure for the exhibition and sale of such goods, wares or merchandise.

recordTypes.name: Consolidated Board Of Appeals
recordTypes.description:
The application is for an appeal to the Consolidated Board of Appeals. The Consolidated Board of Appeals hears appeals of the following:

Assignment of nuisance abatement points, 
Imposition of the vacant property registration fees, 
Determinations of Blight, 
Decisions and interpretations of the Fire Code and Property Maintenance Code or their referenced 
   standards,
Consideration of equivalencies to the requirements of the Fire Code and Property Maintenance Code or 
   their referenced standards.

Applications that are incomplete will not be accepted. The appeal filing fee is $125.00 per address.

recordTypes.name: MOBILE FOOD LICENSING APPLICATION
recordTypes.description: ALL new applicants must complete a New Business Packet found on The City of York's website, www.yorkcity.org,  (Start of Business). Once completed a one time fee is required of $35.00. for the new business application. To complete the mobile vendor applicants a list of items must be upload. A copy of the ServSafe Certification, a picture of the mobile unit, a menu, hours of operation, a copy of insurance information, the number of employees,  the Tax ID Number, and  photo ID, and the address of the license facility where commissary is being stored.

recordTypes.name: Park N Shop
recordTypes.description: Purchase pre-paid chaser tickets for 1-hour of garage parking for customers, clients, or visitors.

recordTypes.name: Lost or Damaged Permits/Access Cards
recordTypes.description: Submit a request to replace a lost or damaged garage access card.

recordTypes.name: Response Form
recordTypes.description: The City of York Response Center is available to anyone who would like to submit a complaint, concern, compliment, or just has a general question for the City of York.  All complaints filed, must be for an address located in the City of York, ONLY. All complaints for an address outside the City of York boundaries, must be filed with their local jurisdiction.  If you submit your request via this website, you will receive updates about the status of your request and be able to check back on it at any time.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Please complete the application below for fence, decks, patios, sheds, driveways, signs, concrete pads, accessory structure, swimming pool, spa, whirlpool permits. If you have any questions, contact the York City Bureau of Permits, Planning, and Zoning at (717) 849-2239.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Determination Request
recordTypes.description: This form is used for the applicant to determine if their proposed use is permitted, or further action will need to be taken.  While the Zoning Hearing Board may grant your variance or special exception, this applies only to the Zoning Ordinance. There most likely will be requirements from the Uniform Construction Code that will apply. Please contact the Bureau of Permits and Inspections to get information related to code requirements.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Hearing Board Appeal
recordTypes.description:
Please complete this application to file an appeal to the York City Zoning Hearing Board. All zoning appeals are heard by the York City Planning Commission and the York City Zoning Hearing Board. The first Monday of each month is the submission deadline for appeals to be heard at the following month's meetings. For example, the first Monday in January is the deadline for the Planning Commission and Zoning Hearing Board meetings in February.

Please print out the attachments separately to be included in your packet.  Application does not print the full-size attachment.

INCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE HEARD BY THE BOARDS AND A CASE NUMBER WILL NOT BE ASSIGNED.

Completion Check List:
Complete Personal Information(application)
Specific about appeal description(application)
If known list previous use of property(application)
Completed Narrative Questions
Attach Deed or Sales Agreement 
Attach Site Plan (Google Earth view of property)
Attach Floor Plan (Drawing of each floor and its contents)
Attach Photos (Front and back of property, each room inside of property, off-street parking accommodations) Must be clear.  The more the better. 

Following a review of your application by the York City Zoning Officer, you will need to pay the submission fee and submit 15 paper copies containing all of the above check list including Zoning Determination Letter to the Zoning Officer. You can submit the 15 copies in person or by mail at York City Hall, 101 S George St, York, PA 17401.  If submitting in person, please schedule an appointment with the Zoning Officer the first Monday of the month.

While the Zoning Hearing Board may grant your variance or special exception, this applies only to the Zoning Ordinance. There most likely will be requirements from the Uniform Construction Code that will apply. Please contact the Bureau of Permits and Inspections to get information related to code requirements.

If you have any questions, contact the Zoning Officer at (717) 849-2280.

recordTypes.name: General Food  Application for Health License
recordTypes.description:
General Food License is a yearly health license for the city of York facilities. The owner must have a Servsafe certification (managers) and must apply for a new business packet with the city of York. All applicants must pass an inspection in order to operate.  The Codified Ordinance of York City, Part Eleven- Health & Sanitation Code - Section 1105 Licensing, Subsection 1105.01 General Food License Required: No person, firm or corporation shall produce, transport, process, sell dispose of or offer for sale as human food any milk or milk products, meat or meat products, fish or other foods and food products within the city without first obtaining a general food license therefore, in accordance with the provisions of this article and food regulations of the Bureau of Health.

The license fee is due on or before January 1, of all following years.  Failure to pay for your annual license on or before January 1 may result in the Health & Sanitation Officer invoking the penalties provided for section 1105.99 of the Codified Ordinances of the City or York.

recordTypes.name: CONTRACTOR REGISTRATION
recordTypes.description: All persons or firms performing construction, alteration, repair, maintenance, or related contracting work within the Township of Abington must be registered and licensed under Chapter 63 of the Township Code. Applicants must complete the township’s contractor registration form, provide proof of required insurance coverage (including general liability and property damage), and pay the applicable fee. Contractors are also required to report any change in ownership, business name, address, or management within ten (10) days. Contractors who are registered with the Pennsylvania Office of Attorney General as Home Improvement Contractors (HIC) are exempt from the township’s licensing fee but must still register, provide insurance, and comply with all other provisions of Chapter 63. No contractor may perform work within the Township without proper registration or a qualifying exemption.

recordTypes.name: FOOD TRUCK LICENSE
recordTypes.description: License issued to authorize operation of a mobile food truck (PA Dep of Agriculture Type 3 & 4) within Abington Township in compliance with the Mobile Food Vendor Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: ACCESSORY STRUCTURE PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Required to construct or install detached structures such as sheds, garages, carports, or similar non-habitable buildings on a property.

recordTypes.name: ADDITION PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Required for expanding an existing structure by adding new square footage such as rooms, decks, 3 season rooms or attached garages.

recordTypes.name: PLUMBER REGISTRATION
recordTypes.description: All master and journeyman plumbers performing work within the Township of Abington are required to be registered annually with the Township. Registration must be completed prior to December 31 for the following calendar year and is valid only for that year. Applicants must already hold a valid plumbing license issued after examination and meet all Township requirements. No person may engage in or perform plumbing or house-drainage work within the Township without maintaining current registration.

recordTypes.name: HOST BUSINESS PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Permit granted to a fixed-location business to host mobile food vendors on its property within Abington Township.

recordTypes.name: SINGLE EVENT PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Permit authorizing the operation of one or more mobile food vendors at a specific event within Abington Township on a temporary basis.

recordTypes.name: ALTERATION PERMIT
recordTypes.description:
Required for modifying, remodeling, or renovating existing interior or exterior spaces without expanding the structure’s footprint.

This permit is not intended for decks. Decks applications should be submitted as an Addition permit.
This permit is not intended for roofing/siding. Roofing/Siding should be submitted as a Roofing/Siding permit.

recordTypes.name: Emergency Responder Radio Coverage System
recordTypes.description: All  new Fire Alarm Systems and modification to existing systems must be designed/installed in accordance with NFPA 72 and the currently adopted editions of the International Building and Fire Codes, as well as Abington Township Ordinances.

recordTypes.name: DEMOLITION PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Required to partially or fully demolish any structure, including buildings, garages, or pools.

recordTypes.name: FOOD CART LICENSE
recordTypes.description: License issued to authorize operation of a mobile food cart (PA Dep of Agriculture Type 1 & 2) within Abington Township in compliance with the Mobile Food Vendor Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: EXEMPTION REQUEST: SINGLE-USE PLASTICS AND EXPANDED POLYSTYRENE FOAM PRODUCTS
recordTypes.description:
Abington Township adopted Ordinance 2226 on February 13, 2025, banning certain Single-Use Plastics and Expanded Polystyrene Foam Products.

An establishment may submit a request for a Temporary Exemption from the requirements of Ordinance No. 2226 because it would cause undue hardship. Ordinance No. 2226 goes into effect on August 12, 2025.

To request an exemption, please complete this form.

recordTypes.name: Fire Alarm System Permit
recordTypes.description: All  new Fire Alarm Systems and modification to existing systems must be designed/installed in accordance with NFPA 72 and the currently adopted editions of the International Building and Fire Codes, as well as Abington Township Ordinances.

recordTypes.name: FENCE PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Required to install or replace a fence on residential or commercial property.

recordTypes.name: ELECTRICAL PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Required for installing, altering, or upgrading electrical systems, wiring, service panels, or devices.

recordTypes.name: Fire Sprinkler System Permit
recordTypes.description: All new Fire Sprinkler Systems and modification to existing systems must be designed/installed in accordance with NFPA (13, 13D, 13R) Standards and the currently adopted editions of the International Building and Fire Codes, as well as Abington Township Ordinances.

recordTypes.name: RAIN BARREL PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Greater than 250 sq. ft. of impervious surface requires an "Application for Seepage Pits/Dry Well/Rain Gardens"

recordTypes.name: FIREPLACE/WOODSTOVE PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Required to install or replace a fireplace, wood-burning stove, or similar heating appliance.

recordTypes.name: Fire Suppression System Permit
recordTypes.description: All new Fire Suppression Systems and modification to existing systems must be designed/installed in accordance with the appropriate NFPA standards and the currently adopted editions of the International Building and Fire Codes, as well as Abington Township Ordinances.

recordTypes.name: FOUNDATION PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Required to construct the foundation of a building or structure before the full building permit is issued.

recordTypes.name: FLAME EFFECT PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Open flame used as part of a performance, event, or program requires a Flame Effect Permit. This includes, but is not limited to, shows, acts, candles, torches, flame-based special effects, or any other intentional use of open flame. Pyrotechnics require a separate permit and are not covered under this provision.

recordTypes.name: Storage Tank Removal Application
recordTypes.description: All removals will conform to the currently adopted editions of the International Building and Fire Codes and Local Ordinances, State, and Federal requirements. It is the applicant's responsibility to notify and apply to all applicable agencies including PA One Call. The applicant is responsible for the safety of the site and integrity of any spoil pile.

recordTypes.name: MECHANICAL PERMIT
recordTypes.description:
Required to install or modify HVAC systems including furnaces, air conditioners, ductwork, and ventilation.

**Electrical permit required to be submitted for any new or replacment units.

recordTypes.name: GENERATOR PERMIT
recordTypes.description:
Required to install a permanent standby generator, including associated fuel and electrical connections.

Note: A separate electrical permit application is required to be submitted concurrently. Please separate the job costs between the Generator and Electrical applications.

recordTypes.name: PAVING PERMIT
recordTypes.description:
Required for installing or replacing driveways, patios, or other impervious surfaces. This includes paving utilizing pervious materials.
(Sidewalk, curbing & driveway apron replacement should be filed under SIDEWALK permit)

recordTypes.name: NEW CONSTRUCTION - BUILDING PERMIT
recordTypes.description:
Required to construct a brand-new structure such as a house, commercial building, or other primary facility.

Note: This is only for new primary structures. Sheds, garages, etc. should be submitted as an Accessory Structure Permit.

recordTypes.name: SEEPAGE PIT / DRY WELL / RAIN GARDEN PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Homeowner Storm Water Management

recordTypes.name: PLUMBING PERMIT
recordTypes.description:
Required for installation, replacement, or modification of plumbing systems including pipes, fixtures, and drains.  

Note: Only Registered Plumbers (Master Plumbers or Journeymen) may complete plumbing work in Abington Township. The only way in which someone who is not a Register Plumber may apply for a permit is with a letter from said Registered Plumer authorizing an individual to apply for a permit under their license.

recordTypes.name: RETAINING WALL PERMIT
recordTypes.description:
Required to construct or replace a retaining wall, particularly any of that meet any of the following parameters:
- Walls over 4 feet in height measured from the lowest level of grade to the top of the wall
- Walls that support a surcharge
- Walls impounding Class I, II or III-A liquids

recordTypes.name: ROOFING AND SIDING PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Required to install or replace roofing or siding on any building.

recordTypes.name: SANITARY SEWER PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Required for connection of new sanitary sewer line

recordTypes.name: SIDEWALK PERMIT
recordTypes.description:
Required for constructing, replacing, or repairing public or private sidewalks, curbing and driveway aprons.

Sidewalks are required to comply with the conditions and provisions of Abington Township Ordinance No. 1026 and No. 1336, all supplemental or amending ordinances added thereto and all rules and regulations of the Abington Township Engineering Department.

recordTypes.name: SIGN PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Required to install, modify, or replace permanent or temporary signs on a property.

recordTypes.name: SOLAR PANEL PERMIT
recordTypes.description:
Required for installing rooftop or ground-mounted solar photovoltaic systems.

Electrical permit required to be submitted also.

recordTypes.name: SWIMMING POOL PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Required for installing an in-ground or above-ground swimming pool, including associated barriers.

recordTypes.name: TANK INSTALLATION PERMIT
recordTypes.description:
Required to install above-ground or underground storage tanks for fuel, oil, or chemicals. This includes all new installs and replacements. 

If replacing an existing tank, a Storage Tank Removal permit is required by the Fire Department (and is a separate application)

recordTypes.name: TEMPORARY DUMSPTER/PORTABLE STORAGE PERMIT
recordTypes.description: Required to place a dumpster or temporary storage unit on private property or public right-of-way.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Compliance Request
recordTypes.description: Used to verify if a proposed use, structure, or change complies with the local zoning ordinance. Covers both Zoning Compliance Request applications and requests for Preliminary Opinions.

recordTypes.name: WIRELESS COMMUNICATIONS FACILITIES PERMIT
recordTypes.description:
Required for the installation or modification of wireless communication infrastructure such as antennas or cell towers.

Electrical permit required to be submitted also.

recordTypes.name: USE AND OCCUPANCY PERMIT

recordTypes.name: Zoning Accessory Dwelling Unit (ADU)
recordTypes.description:
Accessory dwelling unit (ADU). A secondary residential living unit on the same lot where the principal use is a legally established single-family dwelling-unit or multi-family dwelling up to three (3) units. An ADU provides separate, complete, independent living facilities with a separate entrance, kitchen, sleeping area, and full bathroom facilities. The ADU may take various forms (i.e., a detached unit, a unit within an accessory structure such as a detached garage, or a unit that is part of an expanded or remodeled primary dwelling).

1.Per RIGL 45-24-37(e) an ADU is permitted as-of-right in all residential zoning districts, in each of the following circumstances.

A.One accessory dwelling unit ("ADU") is permitted on residential property, in either an existing remodeled primary structure, as an addition to an existing primary structure, or within a new primary structure. 

B.One accessory dwelling unit (ADU) is permitted within the existing footprint of an existing detached accessory structure, provided the ADU does not expand the footprint of the structure.

C.One accessory dwelling unit (ADU) in a new development or a new structure is permitted by right on a residential lot with a total area of twenty thousand square feet (20,000 sq. ft.). If such ADU is part of an inclusionary zoning or comprehensive permit application, it may be restricted to affordable housing. See Section 260-50.

2.Tenants of an ADU are not restricted based on familial relationships or age unless required by the terms of a federal, state, or municipal subsidy related to affordability.

3.Private restrictions on ADUs imposed by condominium associations, homeowner associations, or similar residential property governing bodies, which conflict with the provisions of this section or the definition of an ADU as outlined in § 45-24-31, shall be void as against public policy. 

4.The following requirements apply to all ADUs.

(i)An ADU shall have no more than two (2) bedrooms.

(ii)The off-street parking requirement for an ADU shall be no more than one (1) space per bedroom.

(iii)A studio or one-bedroom ADU may contain up to 900 sq. ft., or sixty percent (60%) of the floor area of the principal dwelling unit, whichever is less. For this section, “floor area” shall be defined as heated above-ground living space.

(iv)A two-bedroom ADU may contain up to 1,200 sq. ft., or sixty percent (60%) of the floor area of the principal dwelling unit, whichever is less. For this section, “floor area” shall be defined as heated above-ground living space.

(v)Dimensional requirements applicable to any ADU shall be the same as any accessory or principal structure in the same zoning district. No additional lot area, lot frontage or lot width is required, for both conforming lots and legal nonconforming lots of record, solely to accommodate an ADU.

(vi)ADUs shall not be offered or rented for tourist or transient use through a hosting platform, as such terms are defined in §42-63.1-2.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Structure
recordTypes.description:
An accessory structure is a structure that is clearly incidental to and customarily found in connection with a principal use, is subordinate in size and intensity of use to a principal structure, is located on the same lot as the principal structure being served and contributes to the comfort, convenience, or necessity of the occupants, business, or industry located in the principal structure being served.

Typical Accessory Structures include:  Detached Garage, Shed, Pool, Pool house, Pergola, Gazebo, Tennis Courts.  

Additional information is available online at:   https://ecode360.com/7757422

recordTypes.name: Addition to Structure
recordTypes.description:
Any increase in area of an existing structure (principle, or accessory) including decks, that must comply with the dimensional regulations of the Zoning Ordinance, § 260-19 Minimum dimensional regulations, § 260-20- Standard Dimensional Regulations

Connected structures. Where a structure is within six feet of the principal structure or interconnected to the principal structure (which must include a foundation, walls and a roof), such structure is no longer accessory, but wholly part of the principal structure, and the dimensional and use requirements for a principal structure shall apply.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Ownership
recordTypes.description:
DBA (Doing Business As) - Registration of Assumed Business Name (the name that will be on the sign for the business)

If you are conducting a business in the Town of Westerly under an assumed business name, or under any designation, name or style, corporate or otherwise, other than the real name or names of the individual or individuals conducting or transacting, Title 6, Chapter 1, of the Rhode Island General Laws requires that the person or persons shall file electronically with the the Town Clerk's Department in the Town or City in which the person or persons conduct, or transact its business.

Contractors working temporarily within the City of Goose Creek should choose the "Per Job Contractors Business License".

recordTypes.description: Application for the installation, repairs, or modifications to fire alarm systems.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Structure Zoning Permit
