Any residential accessory structure over 200 sq ft and any commercial accessory structure over 120 sq ft must apply for a permit through the City's building department.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Architects & Engineers Plan Review Application
recordTypes.description: Application for preliminary commercial plan reviews to receive prior building department approval. This is optional and additional fees apply.

recordTypes.name: Fire Sprinkler Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for the installation, repairs, or modifications to fire sprinkler systems.

recordTypes.name: Residential Building Permit

recordTypes.name: Commercial Building Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for construction of a new commercial building or structure.

recordTypes.name: Residential Accessory Structure Permit

recordTypes.name: Commercial Addition/Alteration/Remodel/Tenant Upfits

recordTypes.description:

Contractors working temporarily within the City of Goose Creek should choose the "Job per Job Business License.

recordTypes.description: Application for mechanical work associated with residential single-family dwellings, duplexes, or townhomes, including new construction, additions, alterations, furnace & air-conditioning replacement, water heater replacement, or repair of existing mechanical system elements.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Accessory Structure Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for a commercial accessory structure on a parcel or lot with a completed principal structure. This may include storage buildings, warehouses, garages, arbors, decks, etc.

recordTypes.name: Per Job Contractor Business License Registration  (Step 1)
recordTypes.description:
Choose this if you are performing construction work within the City of Goose Creek, but your office is located outside of the City of Goose Creek.  You will pay the base business license tax thru this license beginning each license period.

*Be aware that a construction permit may be required as well.

recordTypes.name: Residential Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for electrical work associated with residential single-family dwellings, duplexes, or townhomes, including new construction, additions, alterations, repairs, service panel replacements, electric vehicle chargers, energy storage systems, and electrical work associated with photovoltaic solar systems.

recordTypes.name: Roads Closeout
recordTypes.description: Turnover roads infrastructure to the City after project/phase completion

recordTypes.name: Commercial Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for mechanical work associated with commercial buildings or structures, including but not limited to, new construction, additions, alterations, HVAC & RTU repair or replacement, water heater repair or replacement, new commercial exhaust hood installation, exhaust hood suppression system, or repair of an existing system.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for electrical work associated with commercial buildings or structures, including new construction, addition, alterations, service panel replacement, repairs of existing electrical systems or elements, electric vehicle chargers, energy storage systems, and electrical work associated with photovoltaic solar systems.

recordTypes.name: Architectural Design Approval
recordTypes.description: Click here to have your architectural design, landscaping, lighting, or exterior color change approved.

recordTypes.name: Residential Electrical Reconnection Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for an electrical reconnection for residential single-family dwellings, duplexes, or townhomes when a meter release is required to restore power.

recordTypes.name: Residential Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for plumbing work associated with residential single-family dwellings, duplexes, or townhomes, including new construction, additions, alterations, water heater repairs or replacement, or repair of existing plumbing system elements.

recordTypes.name: Per Job Contractor Business License Update (Step 2)
recordTypes.description:
Choose this if you are performing construction work within the City of Goose Creek, but your office is located outside of the City of Goose Creek and you have paid for and obtained a Job per Job Business License within this business license year (business license year is May 1 to April 30 of each year).  If this is your first business license in this business license year you must apply for the "Per Job Contractor Business License Registration (Step 1)", once this is done you can apply for this license type.

*Be aware that a construction permit may be required as well.  If a permit is required, you will pay for your business license update thru the permit portal.

recordTypes.description: Submit a new development water plan for approval

recordTypes.description: Please submit any plats or site plans for development within Carnes Crossroads here.

recordTypes.name: Commercial Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: Application for mechanical work associated with commercial buildings or structures, including new construction, additions, alterations, water heater repairs or replacement, or repair of existing plumbing system elements.

recordTypes.description: Click here to apply for a zoning permit to construct a fence.

recordTypes.description: Application for a building safety permit is required when a tenant of a commercial structure requires an electrical or gas meter release to restore power. The inspection will include confirmation of accessibility, fire systems, and other life safety elements.

recordTypes.name: Land Disturbance Permit
recordTypes.description: A Land Disturbance Permit is required prior to the removal of any trees and horizontal construction on a piece of land. As per Chapter 151 Section 5.1 of the City of Goose Creek Code of Ordinances, the clear-cutting of trees and vegetative cover on any lot, parcel, tract or acreage in any district is specifically prohibited. Please note, all Land Disturbance applications require a Pre-Application Conference with the City's Zoning Administrator.

recordTypes.description: Application for a swimming pool permit for residential single-family dwellings, duplexes, or townhomes; excluding swimming pools that are portable in construction, not more than 48 inches in depth, not more than 3500 gallons, and are completely above ground with no permanent attachments to water or electrical services.

Depending on the specifications of the proposed pool, you may need to apply for a permit from the building department. If you are unsure if your pool needs building department approval, this application will inform you based upon the information you provide.

recordTypes.description: Application for Inground Swimming Pools, Inground Spa or Jacuzzis, Water Fountains, Splash Pads, for non-residential projects.

recordTypes.description: Application for the installation, replacement of windows, doors, or storefront glazing associated with commercial  structures.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Sign Permit
recordTypes.description: Click here to apply for a permit for all temporary and/or special event signs.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Use Permit
recordTypes.description: Click here to apply for any temporary uses such as sales trailers, pumpkin patches, Christmas tree lots, fireworks stands, etc.

recordTypes.name: Traffic Impact Analysis Application
recordTypes.description: A Traffic Impact Analysis is required for all developments which include subdivisions twenty five or more lots, subdivisions requiring new streets or roads, or the extension of new water and/or sewer infrastructure, more than 25,000 square feet of building coverage in existing and/or new buildings, or active developments wherein substantial changes have occurred in pertinent conditions existing at the time of approval of the development which would, if not addressed, pose a threat to the public health, safety, or welfare.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Application
recordTypes.description: All proposed land development must apply for a zoning application prior to meeting with members of staff.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter
recordTypes.description: Click here to request a zoning verification letter. Zoning verification letters can be used to confirm the zoning of a parcel, required lot dimensions, setbacks, and more.

recordTypes.name: Vehicle Accident Report

recordTypes.name: Electrical Meter Release
recordTypes.description: **PLEASE READ**  If you are doing any type of electrical service repair you will need to fill out a Basic Building Permit Application.  An Electrical Meter Release is to ONLY be used for electrical service that has had an interruption in service due to disconnection or has been unoccupied without service.

recordTypes.name: Permit for Outdoor Burning
recordTypes.description: To permit the outdoor burning of brush piles resulting from land clearing operations.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Demolition or Relocation of a Historic Building
recordTypes.description: For the demolition of any historic landmark or buildings within a historic overlay designation

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter
recordTypes.description:
A Zoning Verification Letter provides information about and verifies the current zoning of a
particular piece of property and the types of uses that may be allowed in that zoning district.

recordTypes.name: Pre-Development Meeting Request
recordTypes.description:
The City of Ennis is now holding Pre-Development meetings to guide and assist those seeking to build developments/projects in Ennis.  These meetings are scheduled for the 1st and 3rd Thursday of each month starting at 9:15 AM and the last meeting starting at 1:45 PM.  Each meeting is scheduled for 45 minutes and the developer(s) can request an in-person, a virtual or a hybrid meeting.  

To request a meeting, please complete each section of this request form and attach a location map and a site/concept plan of the area you wish to discuss.

recordTypes.name: 1. Signing Up, Creating a Profile & Accessing Your Information
recordTypes.description: Instructions on signing up for an OpenGov Account and how to access your profile and records.

recordTypes.name: 2. Applying for a Permit & Paying Fees
recordTypes.description: How to apply for a permit and pay any fees that are due.

recordTypes.name: Civil Construction Master Record
recordTypes.description:
Complete this application when you are ready to schedule a preconstruction meeting.

All public infrastructure installations require preconstruction meetings.

Civil Plans must be approved before a preconstruction meeting may be scheduled.

recordTypes.name: 3. Receiving Your Permit or Other Documents
recordTypes.description: How to view and print your issued permit, license, or other issued documents.

recordTypes.name: Utility Locate Request
recordTypes.description: For requesting locates of City of Ennis Utilities including Water, Sewer, Street Light Electrical, and Traffic Signal and other facilities. Fees are based upon a single address or the distance set in a location segment and must be paid before the City locates utilities.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Health Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Any group, organization, company, or individual preparing, selling, or offering any food item(s) to the public must first obtain a temporary food permit from the City of Ennis Health Department.

recordTypes.name: Food Establishment Permit Application
recordTypes.description:
A food establishment health permit is required for all businesses or organizations that provide perishable foods, whether prepackaged or non-prepackaged, to the public.
Annual permit renewals will be accessible approximately six weeks prior to the permit expiration date.

recordTypes.name: Verification of Water and Wastewater Availability Request
recordTypes.description: The Verification of Water and Wastewater Availability Request Form represents the nearest available water and wastewater points to the requested location.

recordTypes.name: Early Grading Permit
recordTypes.description: Complete this application to obtain a permit to begin grading a development site before final building permits have been issued.  The City of Ennis reserves the right to deny or postpone authorization of early grading.

recordTypes.name: Civil Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Civil Plans review proposed construction site plans, which, depending on the type of development, include streets, drainage, utilities, lighting, signage, erosion control, details, and any other applicable plans. Civil drawings and site plan approvals shall expire 1-year after the approval date.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Unit - Annual Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Mobile food units must pass an annual inspection from Health Department staff and Fire Marshal, and obtain a permit in order to operate within the City limits. The City of Ennis does not allow pushcarts or stand-alone kiosks as a mobile food unit.

recordTypes.name: Single Family/Duplex Rental Application
recordTypes.description:
No single family rental unit may be operated within the city without registration and license.  The property owner or property manager of a rental dwelling unit shall apply for registration with the city.  A registration shall be valid from January 1st - December 31st of each year and must be renewed on an annual basis. 
The definition of a single family rental unit includes duplexes.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Permit Application
recordTypes.description: The City of Ennis requires a Special Event Permit for any organized activity that takes place on public or, in some cases, private property, or may impact public services, such as festivals, parades, runs/walks, concerts, and large gatherings. The permitting process ensures that events are safe, well-organized, and in compliance with local ordinances.

recordTypes.name: Public Works Application
recordTypes.description: The Public Works Application is used to request Water Meters and Boxes, Wastewater Cleanouts and Boxes, Estimates for Water and/or Wastewater installations, Driveway or Barrier-Free Ramp Inspections, and TxDOT Driveway and Utility Permit assistance.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Permits for New Construction, Additions, Detached Accessory Structure (Garage, Granny Flat, etc.), or Major Remodels or for any Residential and Commercial uses where there is any food or drink preparation or anything that will involve approval from the Health Department.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Annual Registration Form
recordTypes.description: Right-of-Way Annual Registration is required prior to applying for a ROW permit in accordance with Ordinance No. 19-0226-13 Section 16-6. Please refer to the ROW Permit checklist for additional information on application requirements.

recordTypes.name: Ennis Bluebonnet Market Vendor Application
recordTypes.description: Be part of a community-driven market that fosters growth and brings the best of local talent and products to the heart of Ennis. Apply here to become a vendor at the Bluebonnet Market!

recordTypes.name: Multi-Family Rental Application
recordTypes.description:
No multi-family complex may be operated within the city without registration and license.  The property manager of a complex shall apply for registration with the city.  A license shall be valid from January 1st - December 31st of each year and must be renewed on an annual basis. 
The definition of a multi-family rental unit means one (1) or more buildings that are on one (1) platted lot and that each contain three (3) or more dwelling units.

recordTypes.name: Rental Inspection Request Form
recordTypes.description:
Per city ordinance, when there is a change in tenancy in single-family dwellings, or upon request by the tenant, an inspection must be made by one of our inspectors to ensure there are no life-safety or critical violations present.

Please note: If a second re-inspection is required, a $75.00 fee will be assessed. Each additional re-inspection thereafter will incur a $150.00 fee per visit.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Construction Permit
recordTypes.description:
This application is for any work being performed within any Right of Way within the city limits of Ennis.  

There is a $250 non-refundable application fee for all applicants that do not have a franchise agreement or are not paying fees to the City of Ennis.

recordTypes.name: Basic Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Permits for electrical, solar, plumbing, HVAC/mechanical, roofing, foundation, storage building under 400 sq ft, flatwork, demolition, brick work, or for simple remodels (windows, doors, siding) for Residential or Commercial.

recordTypes.name: Mosquito Complaint Investigation Request
recordTypes.description: Are mosquitoes causing trouble in your area? Help us take action! Please fill out this form to report mosquito issues in your neighborhood. Your information will assist our public health team in identifying and addressing mosquito breeding sites. Together, we can reduce the risk of mosquito-borne diseases and make our community a safer place.

recordTypes.name: Empower Ennis Volunteer Form
recordTypes.description: Make a difference right where it counts—in your community. Empower Ennis is calling on neighbors like you to lend a hand and a heart in helping those around us in need of lawn maintenance and minor home repairs. Filling out this form is the first step towards becoming an Empower Ennis volunteer.

recordTypes.name: Driveway Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Permits for new driveways or to repair existing driveways.

recordTypes.name: Industrial Pretreatment Program Self-Monitoring Report
recordTypes.description: Please enter the information and the print and sign this document.  This must be submitted by Certified mail or Had delivery to the City of Ennis Pretreatment Program.

recordTypes.name: Driveway Approach or Barrier-Free Ramp Inspections
Pretreatment Industrial User Waste Survey

recordTypes.description: Please use this to apply for a new Certificate of Occupancy for commercial new constructions, a new owner, or new tenant.

recordTypes.description: For new construction and modifications of On-Site Sewage Facility and Septic System

recordTypes.name: Wastewater Discharge Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Industrial User Wastewater Discharge Permit Application

recordTypes.name: Variance Application
recordTypes.description: Required to seek relief from the application of zoning regulations to alleviate from a hardship to a particular property

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit Application
recordTypes.description: No signs may be attached to trees, fences, shrubs, utility poles or street signs.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration Application
recordTypes.description: Each contractor shall maintain registration with the city until the work being performed under such permit is complete. Contractors shall furnish the building official with the contractor's permanent business and residential address, and telephone numbers.

recordTypes.name: Development Application
recordTypes.description: Required for the submittal of a Concept Plan, Development or Site Plan

recordTypes.name: Mural Application
recordTypes.description: Required if seeking to paint a mural on a building. This application type will be reviewed by the Planning & Zoning Commission and Historic Landmark Commission (HLC if applicable) as required by City Code of Ordinances and Unified Development Ordinance.

recordTypes.name: Plat Application
recordTypes.description: Required if seeking subdivision of land.  No plat application will be reviewed and processed until the required civil plans have been approved by the Department of Public Works.

recordTypes.name: Specific Use Permit (SUP)
recordTypes.description: Required if seeking to obtain a Specific Use Permit (SUP)

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Appropriateness Application
recordTypes.description: Required for changes to the exterior of structures in the Historic Districts.  Do not upload or attach a paper copy of this application in lieu of the online application.

recordTypes.name: Zoning  Change Application
recordTypes.description: Required if seeking a change in use of the property

recordTypes.name: Annexation Application
recordTypes.description: Required if seeking to bring a property into the City of Ennis limits

categories.content:
Welcome to the City of Ennis Health Department

At the heart of our vibrant community lies the commitment to the well-being of all who live, work, and visit here. The City of Ennis Department of Health Services is dedicated to fostering a healthy, safe, and thriving environment for everyone. Upholding the highest standards of public

categories.name: Public Works
categories.content: The Public Works Department's purpose is to provide the community with the highest quality water, sanitation, and streets services possible. Our priorities are to maintain a cost-effective operation while providing efficient services. We are dedicated to accomplishing the mission through prudent allocation of resources, utilizing advanced technology, innovative teamwork, and timely coordination.

categories.name: Planning, Development and Building Inspections
categories.content:
Please follow carefully and closely the instructions and requirements for the application you intend to submit with the Department.  Failing to do so will cause delays and/or rejection of your request.  

In addition, do not upload or attach a hard copy of the application and/or ZIP files.

categories.content:
Introducing OpenGov: Simplifying Permits and Licenses in Ennis

The City of Ennis is excited to announce our new permitting and licensing system, OpenGov. Designed with you in mind, OpenGov is set to streamline the application process, making it faster and more efficient for businesses and citizens alike to obtain the permits and licenses they

recordTypes.name: Garage Sale Permit
recordTypes.description: Residential property owners are required to obtain a permit to conduct garage sales on their property.

recordTypes.name: Recreational Vehicle -RV Parking Permit
recordTypes.description: A temporary parking permit for on-street parking for a period of time not to exceed seven days may be issued by the city with the following conditions:(1)Allowed only for preparation of use and cleaning.(2)May not exceed seven consecutive days. After expiration of a permit, a new permit may not be issued until at least 45 days have elapsed since the issuance of the previous permit. Not more than three such permits may be issued to a single person or household in a single calendar year.(3)Under no circumstance shall the recreational vehicle be occupied for any residential purpose.

recordTypes.name: Multi-Family Registration
recordTypes.description: No multi-family complex may be operated within the city without registration and license.  The landlord of a complex shall apply for registration with the city.  A registration shall be valid for a 12-month period upon issuance and must be renewed on an annual basis.

recordTypes.name: Solicitors/Handbill Permit
recordTypes.description: Each person that is engaging in soliciting or distributing handbills must register with the city and obtain permits to aid in crime detection efforts and deter deceptive practices and fraud.

recordTypes.name: Massage Establishment Registration
recordTypes.description: No person shall operate a massage parlor or massage establishment in the city without having first obtained a license therefore from the city.

recordTypes.name: Fire Marshal Permit
recordTypes.description: All fire marshal related applications are covered within this one record type.  Applications include fire sprinkler systems, underground storage tanks, fire alarms, tents, vent-a-hoods, protechnics, access control, hazardous material or other related permits that are required to be issued through the Fire Marshal's Office.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration - General Contractor
recordTypes.description: Each contractor shall maintain registration with the city until the work being performed under such permit is complete. Contractors shall furnish the building official with the contractor's permanent business and residential address, telephone numbers and driver's license number.

recordTypes.name: New Construction/Additions
recordTypes.description: Permits for new construction or additions for residential and nonresidential projects.

recordTypes.name: Public Infrastructure  - Civil Plan Review
recordTypes.description: Any public infrastructure constructed including the public portion of the street, sidewalk, drive approaches, traffic improvements, water, sanitary sewer, and drainage of private construction projects must be reviewed and approved by the Engineering Department.

recordTypes.name: Pre-Application - Development Review Committee
recordTypes.description: Bedford's Development Review Committee offer anyone wishing to develop in the City of Bedford an opportunity to meet with City Staff before making a development related application.

recordTypes.name: Specific Use Permit (SUP)
recordTypes.description: SUP (SPECIFIC USE PERMITS) - Certain uses, because of the characteristics of the use, may be appropriate in some zoning districts under certain conditions in addition to the zoning districts wherein they are a permitted use. These uses have been identified by the City Council in Section 3.1, Schedule of Permitted Uses.

recordTypes.name: Drive Approach/Sidewalk Permit
recordTypes.description: Any work to driveways or sidewalks located within the City's right-of-way requires a permit to be issued and work to be inspected.

recordTypes.name: Remodel Building Permit - Residential & Non-Residential
recordTypes.description: Permits for structural remodels of both residential and non-residential structures.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration - Plumbing Contractor
recordTypes.description: Contractors shall furnish the building official with the contractor's permanent business and residential address, telephone numbers and driver's license number.

recordTypes.name: Rental Registration - Long Term
recordTypes.description: With the goal of preserving and improving the City of Bedford's neighborhoods, we require that all rental properties be registered with the City and inspected to ensure the City's adopted minimum housing code is met.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration - Electrical Contractor
recordTypes.description: Electrical  Contractors shall furnish the building official with the contractor's permanent business and residential address, telephone numbers and state issued licenses.

recordTypes.name: Accessory Structure Permit
recordTypes.description: Accessory structures include patio covers, carports, detached garages, storage buildings, storm shelters and accessory dwelling units on residential properties include permits from this application.   Any nonresidential properties requesting an accessory structure will need to apply through the New Construction, Addition or Remodel permit application.

recordTypes.name: Land Disturbance (Grading) Permit
recordTypes.description: No person shall engage in any clearing, grading, grubbing, stockpiling, excavating, cutting, or other site earthwork without first obtaining the proper permit and/or authorization as required by City ordinance, state, or federal law and in compliance with any other applicable criteria, manuals, plans, polices, city standards or general professional practices as they relate to earth moving activities.

recordTypes.name: Planned Unit Development
recordTypes.description: The purpose of this district is to accommodate planned associations or uses developed as integral land use units such as industrial parks or industrial districts, office, commercial or service centers, shopping centers, residential developments of multiple or mixed housing, or any appropriate combination of uses which may be planned, developed, and operated as integral land use units either by a single owner or combination of owners.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Change
recordTypes.description: All property within the City of Bedford is assigned a land use zoning designation in accordance with Ordinance #2275.  Zoning divides the City into districts for the purpose of regulating land use and development. Zoning addresses items such as the types of uses allowed, building height, setbacks from property lines, lot coverage and minimum lot area.  Property owners have a right to request a zoning change on their property, if you are a potential buyer of property and you wish to have the property rezoned then you must get approval from the registered property owner in order to make a zoning change application.

recordTypes.name: Fence/ Retaining Wall  Permit
recordTypes.description: Permits are required to erect a new fence or any part of a fence in excess of 25% per elevation side.

recordTypes.name: Rental Registration - Short-Term
recordTypes.description: With the goal of preserving and improving the City of Bedford's neighborhoods, we require that all rental properties be registered with the City and inspected to ensure the City's adopted minimum housing code is met.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration - Mechanical Contractor
recordTypes.description: Each contractor shall maintain registration with the city until the work being performed under such permit is complete. Contractors shall furnish the building official with the contractor's permanent business and residential address, telephone numbers and driver's license number.

recordTypes.name: Special Event Permit
Contractor Registration  - Irrigation Contractor
recordTypes.description: Each contractor shall maintain registration with the city until the work being performed under such permit is complete. Contractors shall furnish the building official with the contractor's permanent business and residential address, telephone numbers and driver's license number.

recordTypes.name: Mechanical Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit application for mechanical permits including new construction, remodels or addition permits, system replacements or upgrades and fixture installments.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way Permit (Franchise Utility Only)
recordTypes.description: Any work conducted in the City of Bedford right-of-way requires a licensed contractor be registered within the City of Bedford and obtain permits for work being completed.

recordTypes.name: Electrical Permit
recordTypes.description: Permit application for electrical permits including new construction, remodels or addition permits, system replacements or upgrades and fixture installments.

recordTypes.name: Grease/Grit Generator Permit
recordTypes.description: Any establishment where food is manufactured, packaged, produced, processed, transported, stored, sold, commercially prepared, vended, or otherwise handled must obtain a grease trap/interceptor permit

recordTypes.name: Site Plan Application
recordTypes.description:
When required by the Administrative Official,  any applicant for a zoning change shall submit a proposed site plan for approval. It is the established policy of the Planning and Zoning Commission and the City Council under this section of the City of Bedford Zoning Ordinance that a site plan will be required for any application for a zoning change to "S", "L", or "H" Commercial, and to "I" Industrial, on any tract of land which meets one or more of the following conditions:

(1)Adjacent to any of the following Single Family Residential Zoning Districts: "R-l5,000"; "R-9,000"; "R-7,500"; "R-6,500"; "MD-1", "MD-2", "MD-3", and "MD-4".
(2)Unique topographical conditions are present on the tract.(
3)Greater than three (3) acres in area.
(4)Any property located within the Central Business District Overlay or Master Highway Corridor Overlay District.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration - Sign Contractor
recordTypes.description: Contractors shall furnish the building official with the contractor's permanent business and residential address, telephone numbers and driver's license number.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration - Public Works Contractor
recordTypes.description: Contractors shall furnish the building official with the contractor's permanent business and residential address, telephone numbers and driver's license number.

recordTypes.name: Plat Application
recordTypes.description: No permit for the construction upon any tract or plot shall be issued until the lot(s) have been platted. There are several different types of plats that can be submitted and approved depending on factors associated with the site. If a final plat, preliminary plat, or replat is required, action by the Planning and Zoning Commission must occur prior to recordation.

recordTypes.name: Liquid Waste Hauler Registration
recordTypes.description: All Haulers of liquid waste must register with the City.

recordTypes.name: Plumbing Permit
recordTypes.description: Permits are required for any plumbing work to ensure compliance with all applicable codes. Only licensed Plumbing Contractor through the State of Texas and registered with the City of Bedford are allowed to apply for plumbing permits unless a homeowner who has a registered Homestead exemption of the property.

recordTypes.name: Miscellaneous Building Permits (Demolition, Siding, Temporary Buildings, Windows/Doors, Awnings)
recordTypes.description: This application type is for miscellaneous building permits for construction work such as siding, demolition of structures, and temporary buildings.

recordTypes.name: Water Well Permit
recordTypes.description: Before constructing or modifying any water well within the jurisdiction of Bedford, a permit must be obtained.

recordTypes.name: Contractor Registration - Right-of-Way Contractor
recordTypes.description: Contractors shall furnish the building official with the contractor's permanent business and residential address, telephone numbers and driver's license number.

recordTypes.name: Special Exception
recordTypes.description: In some cases, a property owner may request a special exception from city regulations of permitted by ordinance, so long as they are not  contrary to the public interest and literal enforcement of the provisions of this ordinance would result in unnecessary hardship.

recordTypes.name: Mobile Food Unit Permit Application
recordTypes.description: Application for Mobile Food Units

recordTypes.name: Variance (Building Requirements/ Zoning Requirements/ Alcohol Distance Requirements)
recordTypes.description: In some cases, a property owner may request a variance from city regulations so long as they are not  contrary to the public interest and literal enforcement of the provisions of this ordinance would result in unnecessary hardship.

recordTypes.name: Residential Roofing Permit
recordTypes.description: This application type is for residential roofing projects only.  A permit is required for any re-roofing, including shingles and decking, within the City of Bedford for any single-family residential structure.

recordTypes.name: Sign  Permit
recordTypes.description: Most signs erected or altered require permits to be issued by the City.  Each individual sign requires a separate permit application. If you have a question about a particular sign and the permitting requirement, please email building.permits@bedfordtx.gov.

recordTypes.name: Tree Mitigation Permit
recordTypes.description: No person, directly or indirectly, shall cut down, destroy, remove or move, or effectively destroy through damaging, any tree situated on property described above without first obtaining a tree removal permit.

recordTypes.name: Certificate of Occupancy Permit
recordTypes.description: All Commercial businesses in Bedford must have a Certificate of Occupancy.  This includes new business, business name changes, new location of business, or expansion of business.  If you are unsure whether a Certificate of Occupancy is required, please contact Building Inspections at 817-952-2140.

recordTypes.name: Clothing Donation Box
recordTypes.description: All Clothing Donation Containers within the City must have a valid permit on file.

recordTypes.name: Swimming Pool Permit
recordTypes.description: A permit is required for installation or demolition of in-ground, or prefabricated swimming pools that are greater than 24 inches deep, spas or hot tubs, in either commercial or residential use.

recordTypes.name: Administrative Appeal
recordTypes.description: Any person aggrieved by any interpretation or by any decision or ruling of the building official, fire marshal or code compliance official under the minimum housing codes, sign regulations, construction codes or the fire protection codes, shall have the right to make an appeal to the building and standards commission.

recordTypes.name: Outside Sales Event
recordTypes.description: OUTSIDE SALES- Certain outside sales and/or storage of merchandise may be essential to the full development and utilization of the land and deemed to promote the health, safety, and general welfare of the City. In "L" and "H", Commercial Zoning Districts, the outside sales and/or storage of merchandise for sale is prohibited in the City of Bedford unless a permit for such outdoor activities is obtained by the applicant. $100 PERMIT FEE

recordTypes.name: Lawn Irrigation Systems Permit
recordTypes.description: This application type is for any work related to a lawn irrigation system.

recordTypes.name: Credit Access Business Registration
recordTypes.description: To protect the welfare of the citizens of the City of Bedford, the City monitors credit access businesses in an effort to reduce abusive and predatory lending practices. All credit access business within the City of Bedford must annually register with the City.

recordTypes.name: Solar Panel Permit
recordTypes.description: Permits are required for the installation of solar panels. *Please note that the City of Bedford now requires submission of proof of Interconnection Agreement approval.*

recordTypes.name: Foundation Repair Permit - Residential Only
recordTypes.description: A building permit is required for residential or commercial foundation repair.

recordTypes.name: Request for Temporary Utility Service (Clean & Show)
recordTypes.description: This application type is for temporary utility service, including electric and gas.

A permit is required for: 

  • New or remodel residential and commercial buildings 
  • D

categories.content: The Planning and Zoning Division promotes the efficient and orderly development of private properties and encourages the growth and enhancement of business relative to Comprehensive Land Use Plan.

Housing (Multi-Family Registration, Single-Family Long-Term Registration, Short-Term Rental Registration (Airbnb, vrbo, etc.))
categories.content:
Neighborhood Services oversees the City's recently adopted Long-Term Rental and Short-Term Rental Registration Programs. Soon, all residential properties that are leased for either 30-days or less (short-term) or more than 30-days (long-term) will be required to register annually with the City.  

If this is after hours and requires immediate attention, please call the Bedford Police Non-Emergency number at 817-952-2127.

recordTypes.name: Right of Way Permit
recordTypes.description: A Bexar County Right-of-Way permit is required for all work within a right of way maintained by Bexar County or proposed to be maintained by Bexar County.

recordTypes.name: Subdivision Plat Application
recordTypes.description: Detailed review of documents used to establish a graphic respresentation of the metes and bounds description of a lot; easements for utilities and other shared uses; building setbacks from the Right of Way or Private Street Lot to prevent permanent structure construction from obstructing clear vision; impacts/improvements to existing drainage infrastructure and floodplain; environmental impacts; plat notes and signature blocks; and that proposed construction is in complaince with current regulations for: 1) Street and drainage construction, 2) Mitigations identified in a Traffic Impact Analysis are studied, proposed, or constructed.

recordTypes.name: Contact List Application
recordTypes.description: This is the table of contacts that will be used to fill in contact information for the applications available on this website.

recordTypes.name: Storm Water Quality Permit
recordTypes.description: A Bexar County Storm Water Quality Permit is required when one (1) or more acres of soil are being disturbed on the site or as part of Common Plan of Development.

recordTypes.name: Construction Testing Reports Submittal to 3rd Party Reviewer
recordTypes.description: Submit Construction Testing Reports and Precast shop drawings and lay schedules.

recordTypes.name: Floodplain Permit
recordTypes.description: A Bexar County Floodplain Development Permit is required for any property that is encumbered or within 100 feet of a FEMA designated 1% (100yr) floodplain.  Floodplain permits are issued after the all other applicable Bexar County Permits (Storm Water Quality, Post Construction, Right of Way, and On-Site Sewage Facility (OSSF aka Septic) have been issued.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Verification for Fire Marshal Building Permit
recordTypes.description:
The purpose of this Record is to ensure that you have obtained or applied for the necessary permits with Bexar County Public Works (PW) when a Building Permit is required from the Bexar County Fire Marshal Office (FMO).

Contact the FMO to determine if your project requires a building construction, electrical, or flammable liquids related  permit.  For more information, visit: https://www.bexar.org/643/Permits-Applications.

If you do not need a FMO permit, you will still be required to obtain permits from PW as well as permits from a city if your property is within a City's Extraterritorial Jurisdiction (ETJ) (e.g., Tree, Outdoor Sign, Irrigation, and residential building (if the property is within a Special Improvement District or Non-annexation Agreement Area)).  Visit:  https://countyofbexartx.portal.opengov.com/projectTemplate/2 to research information regarding your property and answer questions to determine the permits you will need.

In general, the process to follow for a signed PW Permit Verification in order to obtain a permit from the FMO is:

1. Obtain City of San Antonio (COSA) documentation (from COSA Public Works Storm Water regarding storm water detention (application form must be stamped and dated by COSA staff along with any drainage report and stamped site plan reviewed by COSA) and a Certificate of Compliance in Military Protection Areas from COSA Development Services, if applicable).
2. Submit Bexar County Permit Verification Form and supporting documents to Bexar County Public Works by clicking on the Select button above.
3. Permit Verification (PV) Form signed by Bexar County Public Works (PW) once all items on the form have been confirmed
4.  Once the PV is signed, PW will e-mail the signed form to Bexar County Fire Marshal Office (FMO) and applicant.
5. Permit Review/Issuance by FMO.
6. Construction and Inspection.
7. Certification and Food Service Permits.
8. Permit Renewal and Maintenance.

Before or during the PW Permit Verification process, you may schedule an appointment to submit the building permit application and electronic plan files to the Fire Marshal Office (FMO) for their review and approval.   For more information, visit: https://www.bexar.org/643/Permits-Applications.

The building permit issuance in step 5 will not occur until the FMO receives a signed Permit Verification Form from Public Works.

Physical Locations and Contact Phone Numbers:

COSA Permits and Platting Location: 1901 S Alamo St San Antonio TX 78204 Contact: 210-207-1111

Bexar County Public Works and Environmental Services Permits
Location: 1948 Probandt San Antonio TX 78214 Contact: Luz Gonzales 210-335-0030

Bexar County Fire Marshal Code Compliance Office
Location:  9810 Southton Rd San Antonio TX 78223 Contact:  210-335-0300

recordTypes.name: Amendment to Storm Water Quality Permit
recordTypes.description:
A current Bexar County Storm Water Quality Permit may be amended when information related to the existing permit has changed.  The amendment is considered Major if any one of the following apply:
          Change of Project Limits

          - Major Field Modification

          - Increase of Disturbance Area

          - Increase of Impervious Cover

recordTypes.name: 1. Signing Up, Creating a Profile & Accessing Your Information
recordTypes.description: Instructions on signing up for a ViewPoint Cloud Account and how to access your profile and records.

recordTypes.name: Building Permit Application
recordTypes.description: This building permit covers all new buildings, additions, remodels, fences, sheds, pools, decks, roofing, siding, egress windows, porches, solar, gazebos, etc. for all building types (residential, commercial, industrial, multi-family, and institutional).

recordTypes.name: Planning Review
recordTypes.description: This permit will include Conditional Use Permits, Zoning Determination Letters, Temporary Use Permits, Special Exceptions, Zoning Map Amendments, Comprehensive Plan Amendments, Planned Development Districts, Subdivision Reviews, Certified Survey Maps, and Extraterritorial Plat / CSMs

recordTypes.name: Erosion Control
recordTypes.description: Erosion control permit for all sites besides 1-2 family new residential homes, as these will be issued with your building permit. All other sites will need to fill out this application prior to a building permit being issued.

recordTypes.name: Right-of-Way Permit
recordTypes.description: The Right of Way Permit is intended for any work taking placing in the City’s Right of Way. This includes any company who wishes to construct, maintain, or repair utilities within the City of Oconomowoc's Right-Of-Way, as well as any Contractor that will be installing facilities for that company. This permit is also used for approval to store any materials within City ROW/property.

recordTypes.name: Dog License
recordTypes.description: Dog and cats are required to be licensed in the City of Oconomowoc. The fee for spayed/neutered pets is $15 per animal/per year. The fee for pets not spayed or neutered is $20 per animal/per year.  All dogs and cats over the age of 5 months need to be licensed. We will need proof of a current rabies vaccination. An invoice or statement from your veterinarian, which shows the rabies manufacturer name, serial number and expiration date is acceptable proof.

recordTypes.name: Architectural Building Review
recordTypes.description: This application will include Architectural Building Reviews, which including both a concept and final review by the Architectural Commission.

recordTypes.name: 2. Applying for a Permit & Paying Fees
recordTypes.description: How to apply for a permit and pay any fees that are due.

recordTypes.name: 3. Receiving Your Permit or Other Document
recordTypes.description: How to view and print your issued permit, license, or other issued document.

recordTypes.name: Cat License
recordTypes.description: Dog and cats are required to be licensed in the City of Oconomowoc. The fee for spayed/neutered pets is $15 per animal/per year. The fee for pets not spayed or neutered is $20 per animal/per year.  All dogs and cats over the age of 5 months need to be licensed. We will need proof of a current rabies vaccination. An invoice or statement from your veterinarian, which shows the rabies manufacturer name, serial number and expiration date is acceptable proof.

recordTypes.name: Permanent Sign Application
recordTypes.description: All permanent signs with the City shall be reviewed and approved by the City prior to installation.

recordTypes.name: Occupancy Compliance Application
recordTypes.description:
Occupancy Compliance is a notification to ensure the protection of the health, safety, morals, and general welfare for residents in the City of Oconomowoc per Section 17.002 of the City's Municipal Code. 

Occupancy Compliance is necessary when: Unoccupied space in an existing building is occupied, an occupancy in an existing building changes to a different use or a different Owner, or a new building construction.

recordTypes.name: Keeping of Chickens
recordTypes.description: The City of Oconomowoc allows the Keeping of Chickens per Section 17.109(5) of the City Ordinance.  Chickens are allowed within the following zoning districts: RR - Rural Residential; TR - Traditional Residential; SR - Suburban Residential; IP - Intuitional Public and UR - Urban Reserve.
